story:
About Us

My name is Kimberly Yamada, currently a student at the U of Alberta. I am blessed with the oppurtunity to travel down to Tanzania this summer, in order to work with Good Hope Orphange. But I knew I wasn't going down empty handed! So I haved temaed up with the orphanage directly, with the goal to bring HOPE to the children of Good Hope.

Good Hope was founded by Mama Asha in 2005, when she came across a street child who was in desperate need of care. Overwhelmed, by compassion Mama Asha not only adopted the child, but expanded her love to many by starting Good Hope. Today, the orphange operates on the morals that they began on: safety, oppurtunity, courage, love, and of course, hope. They provide each of their 16 children with not only the basic necessities, but also access to education. Good Hope works hard to ensure these children, who have all experienced brutal losses and extreme hardships, can find hope again and begin a brighter future.

Meet the Children

Currently, Good Hope is home to 16 beautiful children...and we invite you to learn more about a couple!!

Mohammed: Mohammed, now 8, lost both his parents at a very early age, not because of natural deaths, but because of violent uprisings. In protest to a big mining company invading the area, villagers protested...but not peacefully. His healthy father was stripped from him because of these outbreaks. Just as Mohammed was recovering from a tragic loss, the violence rose again. This time, he WATCHED as his own mother died in front of him. Mohammed was left alone, with no family with the means to support him. It wasn't until he tuned to Good Hope that he felt secure again. Good Hope has provided him thus far with a primary school education and a place to call home. Good Hope is the reason Mohammed is able to move forward from his traumatizing past; to become a boy who loves math and has goals of becoming a salesman.

Amri: Amri, now 10, has never even known his parents. HIs mother died in childbirth, and his father shortly after, due to the same violent uprisings that caused Mohammed's losses. He was born into this world alone. His extended family was struggling to even care for their own families, let alone another child. It was the Amri entered the Good Hope family. They brought him in and gave him a family to call his own, and surrounded him with the joy and love he never knew existed. Today, Amri is a gifted athlete, with a love for drawing and English. He dreams of becoming a movie star! But even still, Amri has not seen his extended family since entering Good Hope, as they are too poor to afford bus fare.

What You Can Do

Good Hope is ENTIRELY funded by donors, much like yourselves. From the meals they provide, to the medical attention needed, to the childrens' toys...every aspect would not be possible without generosity. To help continue providing the love and care Good Hope is known for, my goal is to raise $7500!!

Your money goes DIRECTLY to the children and the orphanage. The money I raise will be brought down to the orphanage, and then used to help expand the orphanage, send children to school, pay for meals, medical supplies, clothing and more. As well, I plan on using 20% of money raised to purchase supplies and toys in Edmonton, which I will personally deliver.

NONE of your money goes to my travel expenses. I am paying for all my flights and accomodations out of my own pocket, so there is absolutely no worry that your money is funding a student with more than enough resources to travel. EVERY SINGLE PENNY GOES TO GOOD HOPE.

  How You Benefit

EVERY DONATION COUNTS! Not one penny goes unappreciated. My direct partnership with Good Hope has allowed me to give back to YOU, our generous donor, and let you know exactly how much your gift means. 

   

With every donation of $50 or more, we are sending you a hand written thank you!! Each child at the orphanage loves to express themselves through art and we couldn't think of a better way to let you know how much your support means! Each card is crafted with thanks by a child themselves, full of sincere gratitude and happiness. We send these personalized cards to you, as just a small token of their appreciation. This allows you to become more connnected on a personal level with the orphanage and know exactly what your donation means.

 Why I Am Doing This

Just last summer, I was fortunate enough to travel with Ecuaexperience and help build a community in Pallatanga, Ecuador. I witnessed first hand what a little bit of love and hard work can do for a family, and how LITTLE it takes to make a BIG difference. The families I met inspired me to try and spread love as far as I could.

I paired my desire to help with my love of children, and with a little research, I found Good Hope. Reading about the children's past broke my heart, and I immediately knew I had to help. I am beyond excited to be able to travel down and interact on such a personal level, which makes this campaign so much closer to me. I want to make a difference in the lives of these beautiful young children and help them to achieve their dreams.

  Other Ways To Help

If you can't contribute, there are still other of ways to get involved!! Share my campaign with your friends and family, via the indiegogo sharing tools at the very top of the page!! One click of a button is all it takes!! Tell your friends and family about Good Hope and my efforts; spreading the word is a key part of fundraising!

If you would like to do MORE, or are even interested in travelling to Good Hope yourself, please contact me at kyamada@ualberta.ca. Remember, every little bit counts!!

Learn More!

   

I encourage you to visit the Good Hope website, by following the link below! Learn more about the children and the amazing staff, discover what Good Hope has in store for the future, and get closer to the cause!!

http://www.goodhopeorphanage.org/

story:
Lainey was born with a heart of GOLD, She is full if spirit and love for others.  This Christmas she wants to make an impact and we are here to help her do that!  She would love to provide gifts for over 300 children on the DFW area.  She has such BIG dreams of making other childrens holiday as happy and full of joy as hers <3

 

 

She will be donating to:

The Samaritan Inn - McKinney, TX

Childrens Hospital Dallas

 

If you would like to donate in other ways such as clothing, gift cards, new unwrapped items or any other way please contact me at Amandabowmer2@gmail.com

story:
My Dream

My name is Corina Haywood and I would like to introduce you to my dream. I would like to influence the viability of  a community of hat-makers in Los Angeles. London, Paris, and New York each have their own Meccas of millinery, schools and shops that promote a unique aesthetics and vision. My dream is to add L.A. to that list and to help shape that vision, to create hand-crafted hats that are wearable works of art.  I have been producing hand made sculptural hats for men and women for over 10 years out of my home. I make pieces for custom clients, and have collaborated with designers to produce private label work which has sold nationally and internationally at high-end department stores and exclusive boutiques. I have sold my own line of avant-guard hats in a variety of boutiques in Los Angeles on consignment. Over the last 3 years I have been teaching workshops at a variety of schools, art centers and non-profit arts associations.


In order to continue to share my love of millinery and to make my business viable in the future there are a few things I need:

Funds to secure my participation in an upcoming trade show that is showcasing Los Angeles accessory designers.
Funds to help to secure a work studio where I can teach classes and work with interns and employees to produce larger orders for retailers and designers.
Eventually I would like to employ several artists in the production of the hats and have an agency represent the line to  handle my marketing and sales so that I have more time for my classes and new designs. 

The Impact

By supporting my goals to build my business and continue to share my craft I will be able to provide a continuing source of education and innovation in the art of millinery for designers and artists in the Los Angeles area. At this time there are very few places to take workshops in hat-making and no design schools that offer long-term courses in the southern California area. Teaching will always remain an important part of my business, as I will continue to teach workshops at local art centers as well as private classes in my studio. With my own space to produce my hats I will have room to hire employees and to take on design students as interns who would not have another opportunity to learn millinery. By supporting my efforts to build my business you are insuring a resource for future designers to develop their skills and build their own businesses. 

What We Need & What You Get


The great thing about a flexible goal is that I have a staged plan, so no matter how much I raise, it will propel my dreams further. 
If I raise 1000 I can hire help to produce samples of my spring 2012 line of hats. 
If I raise 3000 I can  participate in an upcoming trade show where I can get multiple orders for my spring 2012 line of hats.
If we reach our goal of 5000 the funding will go towards securing a studio where we can  produce the orders, see new custom clients, and teach workshops. 

We will be producing special editions of hats and accessories for our Indie-a-go-go supporters:
if you contribute $5 or more: you will get a heart felt thank you on my website!
For $25 you will get a thank you and a felt and feather pin to be worn on your lapel or hat band
For $50 you will get your choice of 30% off a hat class or 30% off of a hat from my etsy shop!
For$150 you will get a limited edition wool felt cap.
For  $150 you will get a  thank you and a limited edition headpiece.
For $200 you will get a limited edition straw hat.
For $500 you will get a custom hat in straw or felt.
For $1000 you will get your choice of any three of our perks!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help out by sharing this campaign with your friends and colleagues! You can  use the sharing tools with twitter and Facebook. Or if you prefer the old fashioned approach you can always support my business by ordering a hat or taking a class! for more information go to: www.corinahaywood.com

story:
Our Story

Hi. I think you are gorgeous and perfect just the way you are and I am not just saying that. No, really. I believe that we should celebrate our differences and am creating a technology that will make it easier for you to get dressed with confidence every day without fighting your curves or lack thereof.

I'm Lisa Morales-Hellebo, the CEO and Founder of ShopSuey. As a 37 year old mom to two little boys, I wear MANY hats — wife, mom, business owner, chef, party and holiday planner, grocery shopper, home decorator, after school activity coordinator, social planner, and the list goes on. As a result, my time is very precious and valuable to me. If it comes down to the choice between going to my son's soccer game or shopping for an outfit for a big meeting, my boys will win every time.

However, I do LOVE fashion, so what's a girl to do when she has no time to browse rack after rack at retail or spend weeks bookmarking and searching online? My solution was running to Saks or Nordstrom's, getting a personal shopper, and literally telling them, "I have 40 minutes, $500 and I am going to this type of event. Go!" While I do LOVE personal shoppers, this was still time taken out of living my life to handle a task that used to be so much FUN for me. There is little fun in cramming shopping into a tight timeline while relying on one personal shopper's ability to translate my body type, style and budget and get me out of there with a successful purchase. I thought, there has to be a better way. Why can't I do this online? Those questions haunted me from 2007 until 2009 when, after a series of very vivid and creative dreams, I finally woke up one morning and started jotting it all down.

My 15 year career in e-commerce strategy, branding, user experience and design was the reason for my overactive REM state. The bigger questions I started tackling were, "Why has everything online evolved to be open, except for commerce? Why has e-commerce remained a glorified version of catalog shopping for 15 years? Why has e-commerce failed to address the way women love to shop — experientially with a sense of discovery, rather than transactionally? Where is the fun? Why hasn't someone developed a better way to shop that actually saves me time rather than asking for more of it?

After many months of research, documentation, modeling and sketching, ShopSuey was born.
http://www.shopsueymarket.com


What is ShopSuey?

ShopSuey is a search engine that delivers results as visually merchandised groups of related goods (think visual collages of head-to-toe outfits). You can then dynamically modify the groups by applying filters (i.e. - changing a $5000 outfit into the closest match for $500). Lastly, there is a layer of social influence where we map your Style Profile (Style DNA) to others like you, so the more they shop, the smarter your recommendations get.


ShopSuey's Style DNA graph is capturing the multifaceted and subjective nature of taste, preference, and style to allow you to shop by groups of relevant and contextually related consumer goods that are customized just for you.


For consumers, ShopSuey allows women to shop experientially, see things in context and modify groupings until they are happy with all the items and complete their purchase. For retailers, ShopSuey provides a free, fast and flexible tool to visually merchandise their online goods and tap into "invisible markets," while alleviating the number one reason for shopping cart abandonment — searching for other options.


ShopSuey will be launching in fashion, but we have plans to roll out in other verticals such as, home decor, baby, kids, sporting goods, and toys.


I believe that the future of commerce lies in shopping and remixing groups of related goods that are all targeting your specific taste and needs. Imagine shopping for everything in your life this way... decorate your entire home in a weekend, pack for your tropical vacation in minutes, and saving hours every week answering the question of what to wear.


ShopSuey Highlights to date...

  • I have over 15 years experience in e-commerce with startups, F500s (P&G, Coke, Nexxus, Herman Miller) and running my own agency, Good Egg Design, for 5 years

  • ShopSuey's non-provisional and global technology and business method patents are filed and pending

  • My team is made up of Silicon Valley veterans that I have known for over a decade

  • ShopSuey's advisory team includes a NYC based fashion exec with over 19 years experience and connections, a former P&G exec who was one of the founders of Reflect.com, was the Director of Global E-commerce at Coca-Cola and is currently VP of Multimedia Marketing at Domino's, and a former Rand analyst who launched her own shoe line with the help of Good Egg Design's branding

  • ShopSuey was selected to be a part of Springboard Enterprises 2010 All Things Media Forum at the Paley Center in NYC

  • ShopSuey was selected as one of the 50 most promising startups of 2010 by the Global Entrepreneurship Week Startup Open Competition

  • Lisa is selected as one of the Top Rising CEOs of the Mid-Atlantic by Always On and is asked to present at the Always On Mid-Atlantic Venture Summit

  • ShopSuey is selected to present at the Always On Silicon Valley Venture Summit at Half Moon Bay in Dec 2010

  • ShopSuey was selected to be a featured company at FashInvest in NYC Dec 2010

  • we were recently nominated for the Emerging Company of the Year- The 2011 TCM Tech Awards: Best and Brightest


The Impact

I am not a developer even though I went to Carnegie Mellon and played one in my past life. Soooo... with your support we will be able to hire another developer to support our part time, bootstrapping team and roll out our first release of utility for YOU. I have invested over $40k of my own money so far and we have gotten some Friends and Family money to date, but with your money, we will be one feature set closer to our vision of shopping nirvana within ~6-8 weeks of your donations meeting our goal. Without it, we are inching along in my team's evenings and weekends.


What We Need & What You Get

Some of the ShopSuey features we will be building out include...

  • the look for less - as you search, filter and browse the looks and find a look you love that is out of your price range, you can apply a simple price filter that will dynamically recreate the look with the closest possible matches within your price point. ShopSuey does all the work to save you days of browsing and bookmarking to recreate the look manually.
  • create looks from my closet - have ShopSuey make looks using the items you have already saved to your closet, which represent things you already own. Refresh your wardrobe and discover new inspired ways to wear your favorite pieces.
  • new looks from items you've selected - after finding a look that has a few items you love, you can lock them in and use the REMIX tool to have ShopSuey create new looks using the items you have locked in. You know what you like when you see it, so let us bring you all the options for you to pick and choose from.
  • shop by occasion - when you have an upcoming event and just don't have the time or energy to find an appropriate outfit, you can just browse the ShopSuey filter that lets you shop by occasion. Whether you have a go to little black dress that you are looking for a new way to style, or you want to step out of your usual look, ShopSuey is here to help provide just the inspiration you need — the best part is, you can actually BUY everything straight from our site too!
  • shop my Style Tribe(s) - ShopSuey matches you to other women like you, not just in taste, but also in physical characteristics — measurements, hair color, eye color, height, body type, etc. If you choose to share your closet or a lookbook, then other women can see what brands, styles, etc. you wear and how you put them together. Have you been stuck buying one type of pants from one brand because it is the only one that fits you right? When you can shop your Style Tribes, you can discover new alternatives bought by women who are most similar to you.

The first feature we will be rolling out with your funding is the look for less.

Obviously, the amount we are currently seeking is representative of an initial build. We will be seeking additional raises so we can delivery more utility to YOU. Of course, if you are so inclined to keep it coming, it would help expedite our feature releases and allow us to get more developers on board. I know that I am dying to have ShopSuey up and running because I know I will use it every day. I hope that you see how greatly this could impact your life by allowing you to spend more time living and less time shopping, while still getting everything you need and a few things you never knew you were looking for.


Other Ways You Can Help

We need YOUR help to get the word out.


Shout it from rooftops, Twitter, Facebook, or any other social media tool of choice. Tell EVERY WOMAN YOU KNOW to donate, young or old, because ShopSuey will help them all! Whether they are already a fashionista or hate shopping — we are the universal solution for the daily question of "what should I wear?"


Women are busy, believe me, I know. We need a better way to shop. ShopSuey is the next revolution in shopping.


Thanks for your support and for joining the ShopSuey Tribe!


Sincerely,

Lisa

CEO and Founder, ShopSuey

 consumer goods that are customized just for you.

 things in context and modify groupings until 
					they are happy with all the items and complete their purchase. For 
retailers, ShopSuey provides a free, fast 
					and flexible tool to visually merchandise their online goods and 
tap into "invisible markets," while alleviating
					the number one reason for shopping cart abandonment — searching for
 other options.

ShopSuey will be launching in fashion, but we have plans to roll out
 in other verticals such as, home decor, 
					baby, kids, sporting goods, and toys.

I believe that the future of commerce lies in shopping and remixing groups of related goods that are all targeting your specific taste and needs. Imagine shopping for everything in your life this way... decorate your entire home in a weekend, pack for your tropical vacation in minutes, and saving hours every week answering the question of what to wear. 


ShopSuey Highlights to date...


I have over 15 years experience in e-commerce with startups, F500s (P&G, Coke, Nexxus, Herman Miller) and running my own agency, Good Egg Design, for 5 years
ShopSuey's non-provisional and global technology and business method patents are filed and pending
My team is made up of Silicon Valley veterans that I have known for over a decade
ShopSuey's advisory team includes a NYC based fashion exec with over 19 years experience and connections, a former P&G exec who was one of the founders of Reflect.com, was the Director of Global E-commerce at Coca-Cola and is currently VP of Multimedia Marketing at Domino's, and a former Rand analyst who launched her own shoe line with the help of Good Egg Design's branding 
ShopSuey was selected to be a 
part of Springboard
 Enterprises 2010 All Things Media Forum at the Paley Center in NYC
ShopSuey was selected as one 
of the 50 most promising startups of 2010 by the Global
 Entrepreneurship Week Startup Open Competition
Lisa is selected as one of 
the Top Rising CEOs of the Mid-Atlantic by Always On and is asked to present 
at the Always On Mid-Atlantic Venture Summit
ShopSuey is selected to present at the Always On Silicon Valley Venture Summit at Half Moon Bay in Dec 2010
ShopSuey was selected to be a featured company at FashInvest in NYC Dec 2010
we were recently nominated for the Emerging Company of the Year- The 2011 TCM Tech Awards: Best and Brightest



The Impact
I am not a developer even though I went to Carnegie Mellon and played one in my past life. Soooo... with your support we will be able to hire another developer to support our part time, bootstrapping team and roll out our first release of utility for YOU. I have invested over $40k of my own money so far and we have gotten some Friends and Family money to date, but with your money, we will be one feature set closer to our vision of shopping nirvana within ~6-8 weeks of your donations meeting our goal. Without it, we are inching along in my team's evenings and weekends. 


What We Need & What You Get
Some of the ShopSuey features we will be building out include...


the look for less - as you search, filter and browse the looks and find a look you love that is out of your price range, you can apply a simple price filter that will dynamically recreate the look with the closest possible matches within your price point. ShopSuey does all the work to save you days of browsing and bookmarking to recreate the look manually.


create looks from my closet - have ShopSuey make looks using the items you have already saved to your closet, which represent things you already own. Refresh your wardrobe and discover new inspired ways to wear your favorite pieces.


new looks from items you've selected - after finding a look that has a few items you love, you can lock them in and use the REMIX tool to have ShopSuey create new looks using the items you have locked in. You know what you like when you see it, so let us bring you all the options for you to pick and choose from.

shop by occasion - when you have an upcoming event and just don't have the time or energy to find an appropriate outfit, you can just browse the ShopSuey filter that lets you shop by occasion. Whether you have a go to little black dress that you are looking for a new way to style, or you want to step out of your usual look, ShopSuey is here to help provide just the inspiration you need — the best part is, you can actually BUY everything straight from our site too!


shop my Style Tribe(s) - ShopSuey matches you to other women like you, not just in taste, but also in physical characteristics — measurements, hair color, eye color, height, body type, etc. If you choose to share your closet or a lookbook, then other women can see what brands, styles, etc. you wear and how you put them together. Have you been stuck buying one type of pants from one brand because it is the only one that fits you right? When you can shop your Style Tribes, you can discover new alternatives bought by women who are most similar to you. 


The first feature we will be rolling out with your funding is the look for less. Obviously, the amount we are currently seeking is representative of an initial build. We will be seeking additional raises so we can delivery more utility to YOU. Of course, if you are so inclined to keep it coming, it would help expedite our feature releases and allow us to get more developers on board. I know that I am dying to have ShopSuey up and running because I know I will use it every day. I hope that you see how greatly this could impact your life by allowing you to spend more time living and less time shopping, while still getting everything you need and a few things you never knew you were looking for.

Other Ways You Can Help
We need YOUR help to get the word out. 

Shout it from rooftops, Twitter, Facebook, or any other social media tool of choice. Tell EVERY WOMAN YOU KNOW to donate, young or old, because ShopSuey will help them all! Whether they are already a fashionista or hate shopping — we are the universal solution for the daily question of "what should I wear?" 

Women are busy, believe me, I know. We need a better way to shop. ShopSuey is the next revolution in shopping.

Thanks for your support and for joining the ShopSuey Tribe! 

Sincerely, 
Lisa
CEO and Founder, ShopSuey

story:
BronyCAN - The Canadian MLP Convention!

 

About Us

For those of you who are new to us, welcome! We are BronyCAN, Canada's premiere convention for fans of the show My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. We will be holding a convention this summer in British Columbia, Canada.

 

Our Goal

We are looking to hold a mind-blowingly awesome convention for all to attend, but this being our first year, we require a bit of initial funding to kick-start our convention. In exchange, we will reward you with your contribution's weight in awesome pony swag! However, some of the tiers are in limited supply, so contribute quickly before they are gone!

We are looking at a hard-goal of $5,000, however, we gave room to grow since this community has a history of incredible acts of generosity!

If and when we reach our funding goal, we will shortly there-after announce our venue/date and promply open registration soon after that. i.e. The faster we get funded, the sooner you get to register!!!

 

We are looking at a registration price of around $40-50, however, it will varry depending on how many contributions we receive before-hand. The more contributions we receive, the cheaper registration will be!

(Note: We did not include a straight registration tier reward because a registration price has not been finalized yet, as it depends on how much funding we receive pre-registration!)

 

Delivery

We will commence production of all rewards as soon as the Indiegogo comes to a close on January 31st, 2012, and will be shipped/delivered as they are finished (all rewards for a given contributor will be shipped together).

 

Shipping

Some of our rewards are actual physical objects and will be shipped to their respective contributor. That said, we ask that North American contributors add $10 to their contribution for shipping, and international contributors add $20.

Alternatively, you may also specify that you wish to pick up your rewards at the con and spare the shipping costs!

 

Note: All reward tiers are cumulative unless otherwise specified. (You receive the selected tiers as well as all previous tiers)

story:
Rowing the Pacific Ocean 2014

On the 7th June 2014, team Fourbirdsaboating will set off from Monterey Bay, California on an 8 month row across the Pacific Ocean, stopping in Honolulu, Hawaii as part of the first ever Great Pacific Race, before continuing on alone and unsupported to Cairns, Australia.

The whole point of the journey, is to teach children worldwide, live from the boat, and to raise funds for young people and our online classroom. The project began as a school club to teach English as a foreign language to students in the former Soviet Republic of Georgia in 2010, and now has around 19,000 online students in 56 countries who would otherwise have little or no access to any form of education. The project is entirely self supported so funds raised through grants and donations will enable us to continue our work, and to reach even more young people, to help them lift themselves out of poverty.

Working with students in the UK, every £500 we raise provides an educational package to another children's project in a developing country. This pack includes an ipad, mini prohjector, solar charger, speakers, two years access to internet, and a paper map to follow us on our journey. Our main subjects taught online include English as a foreign language, science, engineering, and geography.

During the Pacific Ocean row we will collect scientific data on human physiology, plastic pollution, and cetaceans. We'll also be raising money for the Thai Children's Trust who care for 2000 orphans across Thailand.

What We Need 

To row across the ocean, we need a boat, and sadly these don't come cheap. We need to raise around £40,000 for the boat named 'Mr Toad', and around £16,000 for all the kit, training, and other bits, though we are already being given a lot of this kit 'in-kind' by some great sponsors. 

This is a large investment, but the most important thing, is that the row will help us to raise the profile of our work, and to raise funds to provide our online class to some of the most disadvantaged children in the world, as well as more affluent students in the UK. The boat will be then be made available, free of charge, to future ocean rowers, on the proviso that they continue to raise our profile, provide live from the boat education through our online platform, and to raise funds for us. So your support, will really have a long term impact, and make the world a better place for lots of young people.

How You Can Help: The Perks

  • Sponsor a nautical mile of the 7200 nautical mile journey for £1
  • Sponsor us £1 and we'll write your name on the boat.
  • Sponsor us £10 and we'll send you a postcard from the journey.
  • For £15 we'll send you a Fourbirdsaboating mug and use the proceeds to fund a bit of kit with your name associated with it.
  • For £20 we'll send you a Fourbirdsaboating T-Shirt and use the proceeds towards a bit of kit for the row, associated with your donation.
  • Become a Fourbirdsaboating Friend for £25 and you'll get your name written on the boat, invite to special events and our send off party, a purpose designed map to track us on (dispatched May 2014), expedition postcard, regular newsletter, and the choice of a Henley teddy bear or a 'Birdlife' mug (please give your preference for a mug or bear when donating).
  • Become a #Fundoodlefriday doodle for £30
  • Sponsor us £325 and we'll write our names on one of the ocean rowing oars, and present it to you when we return. Yours to keep forever.
  • £1000 to become a Bronze Sponsor, for which you get your logo on the boat, expedition postcard, and media coverage throughout.
  • £5000 to become a silver sponsor, for which you will receive your logo on the boat and online media, expedition postcards, and you'll be providing one children's project in a developing country with access to education for the first time in their life.
  • £7500 to become a Gold sponsor.  For this you will receive key placement of your logo on the boat and online activity, invites to exclusive events, postcards from the expedition, and you'll provide educational packs to two children's projects in developing countries.
  • £10,000 to become the Platinum and headline sponsor, for which you will receive the highest level of media exposure, prime placement of your logo on the boat, online activity, and our team kit, invites to exclusive events, postcards from the expedition, and educational packs for three children's projects in developing countries.

Bronze, silver, gold, and platinum sponsors will have the opportunity to promote their brand at our September 2013 Leander club event with the Olympic rowers, our participation in the UVU Jungle Marathon in October 2013, as well as the Pacific Ocean row and all associated media and educational events.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Make some noise about Fourbirdsaboating, tell your friends about us.
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Visit our website.
  • Donate to the Thai Children's Trust through our Justgiving page.

story:
Our Challenge

Have your ever played sardines? You know, that game where everyone has to squish together...  Living in our current home seems about like that everyday.  Some people struggle with being able to have any kids, we have had the opposite challenge. We have 9 small kids all of which were born while we were on different forms of birth control.  Our sweetest daughter Sofira is now 3 years old but is disabled from when she was born early at 26 weeks.  It has been a huge financial and physical challenge for us to take care of her and her siblings but luckily we have managed. We love our family but would like to help them have enough room to be kids. Its hard to look in their bedrooms and barely have enough room to fit all there beds in.  

Our Plan

My wife has spoken and is demanding that I find a way to get us in a larger home.  We have recently found a home that will fit our needs of just 2 kids per room.  The best part is it's for a great price but unfortunately in my current circumstances with the housing market I cant do a 100% loan. This means I have to come up with 5% down.  This campaign is to help us earn at least $4000 but preferrably the full $12,000 needed for a down payment so that we may expand into a home that will actually be sufficient for our needs.  

What you get

Please look through the things my kids and I are able to do for you and choose whichever you like best.  Also Don't forget that probably the best thing you can do for us is to spread the word about our campaign. 

 

Sardines of the world beware, its time you departed!! 

 

 

UPDATE!!

First off I want to thank everyone who has contributed so far, your help is very much appreciated.   So I just heard odd news from my mortgage broker in that now to get the loan I have to show 6 months worth of morgage payments for "BOTH" my current home and the home I'm wanting to move into in my bank account. So this including the down payment now totals $27k that I have to come up with.  Luckily the banks are ok with haveing the 6 month payments be borrowed. So I just have to show it in my bank account then I can return it.  My immediate family was blessed to have just recieved this much recently so they can help me do this part.  Your help with the $12k though is extrememly apreciated now more then ever since all of this is now needed and the $12k cant be borrowed or gifted (I'm told indiegogo won't count as gifted funds, probably since your getting perks for your contributions).

Also as a side note work gave me a good bonus wich counts towards the $12k so were getting closer!!!  Since the House is a "AS IS" bank sell, It would be nice to have just a little extra to pay for new carpet in the home where some water damage detstroyed it before we move in but we will make do without that as long as we can just get in it.

Thanks again,  I know with all your help we can make this happen and hit that $4k goal.

story:
THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Although we didn't meet the goal right here on Indiegogo, additional support was generated by the campaign, and the sign is up, with more work to be completed within a week or so.

GET THE DETAILS ON OUR BLOG

 

 

A Reasonable Question...

Why are we asking for help for a sign for a retail operation?

Because when the historic Beer Depot sign blew down in 2011, the cheaper, easier option was to simply replace it with a modern, less expensive one.

But we felt obligated to preserve this local landmark.

After almost two years and almost twenty thousand dollars, we came up a little short when the insurance company tried to deny payment on the sign's policy!

The Story

(For the full story, you can always visit our website)

Until it blew over on one of the windiest days on record in April 2011, the Doo Wop era neon Beer Depot sign was a symbol of a disappearing America that had been photographed and referenced as a cultural icon by people literally all over the world for decades.
 
In spite of its established reputation as a classic example of an historic era in signage as well as a local landmark, the effort to restore the sign has been an uphill battle all the way.

First obstacle: filing the appeal. Although the sign was on a property that is designated as historic by the City of Ann Arbor, we had to pursue a costly appeal process to even have permission to resurrect the sign.
 
We won the appeal, and began the process of restoration. We had expected to complete the work in the fall of 2012.
 
Then, we hit another obstacle. The insurance company refused to pay on the policy covering the sign!
 
We went to court, and although we "won", in this case "winning" meant receiving about 1/4 if the estimated value of the sign!

Many of the signs supporters had suggested early on that we do a fundraiser like this, but we were reluctant, until this final snag.

We have believed from the beginning that the extra expense and hardship we've endured to restore the sign is something we owe the community, so we'll get it completed no matter what it takes.

But now is YOUR chance to show YOUR support!
 
For the full history of what has happened so far, visit the Save Our Sign blog.

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of restoring the sign is approximately $25,000

Approximately $5,000 in legal and administrative costs for the appeal

Approximately $20,000 for the actual restoration

As a result of the insurance company attempting to not pay on the policy covering the sign, we ended up with nearly $10,000 less than anticipated.

We bit the bullet on half of that; now we're asking for the community's help on the rest. The sign is nearly complete, the pole for the sign is erected, but after almost two years and $20,000, we're temporarily out of steam!

In return for your support, we are offering various levels of one-time discounts for smaller donations, and a variety of commemorative acknowledgments or special gifts for "premium" supporters.

The Impact

In spite of Ann Arbor's literally international reputation as a charming college community with a walkable downtown, tree-lined streets, and a strong sense of historic preservation to maintain that charming character, in the opinion of most, it has slowly been losing that battle to blocky high-rise development.
 
The loss of the historic Beer Depot sign would have been yet another ding in the loss of character that the town has arguably endured. The site that the sign was on has been more or less in its current form since the 1950's, and the sign has been there more or less since the beginning.

And the battle to get it restored has placed additional hardship on a family-owned business that has already seen a dramatic drop in revenue due to the poor visibility of the store in the sign's absence.
 
Your support will help resurrect this classic neon sign, and help Ann Arbor preserve a little piece of its history!

Don't Have Funds To Donate?

That's okay, help us spread the word by using Indiegogo's sharing tools, Facebook, and word of mouth!

The loss of the historic Beer Depot sign would have been yet another ding in the loss of character that the town has arguably endured. The site that the sign was on has been more or less in its current form since the 1950's, and the sign has been there more or less since the beginning. And the battle to get it restored has placed additional hardship on a family-owned business that has already seen a dramatic drop in revenue due to the poor visibility of the store in the sign's absence.
 
Your support will help resurrect this classic neon sign, and help Ann Arbor preserve a little piece of its history!

Don't Have Funds To Donate?
That's okay, help us spread the word by using Indiegogo's sharing tools, Facebook, and word of mouth!

story:
Hello!

“The key to Mathopoly's success is the fact that it is a game rather than a textbook or lecture" - Samuel Thompson - The Herald

My name is Willi Penner and I have been a teacher for ten years. I always hated Mathematics as a student and found it difficult to comprehend, never mind boring. However, I knew that one day I would most likely be teaching it. The last thing I wanted was for students to end up learning Math through boring, un-inspired paper and pencil testing, assignments and quizzes. I wanted my students to be engaged in learning, to have fun while learning and to be caught up in the spirit of a great game that would double as a rich learning experience. 

In 2011 I was fortunate enough to manufacture my game and started holding sessions and professional development opportunities for teachers and parents with it. It's more than a game, its a learning experience, an assessment tool and a fantastic engagement opportunity. 

The one question I kept receiving over the past two years through conversations or emails was "When is it going to be available on an Ipad", "When will you have this ready for a Smartboard", "Can my kids play this on the computer?". Sadly, there wasn't an answer I could give them other than "I'm working on it.....". 

"Math may not be your children's favorite subject, but it might be if they play Mathopoly" - Kyla Duncan - Wheat City Journal

What my goal here is, is to create a version of the current game for Ipads, Androids and other multimedia platforms. The ultimate goal would be for my small business to be able to create a version so that students (even adults) could play in "real-time" against each other when they are thousands of miles apart. 

There have been so many great suggestions about how this could be done, unfortunately these avenues need funding. My wish is that you will see the importance of Mathematics and engagement in education and watch the video that I have pieced together. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for $20,000 to start the process of securing the right company to take on the challenge of creating a replica version (or close to) for an Application, be it for Ipads, Ipods or any Android system and even Smartboard.

I have been in contact with a reputable local gaming company which has given me great advice/examples on how this could be achieved. The $20,000 is just the beginning of what could be a much higher price tag, but we are confident that we could get something in the works to start with.

Other than being a part-time classroom teacher, I have also taught college courses on Gamification and using games in the classroom. I have a good understanding of what is feasible and what will work. As a teacher I'm always looking for something that is unique and different and I'm getting excited to see this project come to life. 

If I do not fundraise the $20,000 I will be using the funds for payment of programmers and the above mentioned company to start what they can with whatever amount is raised. 

The Impact

There is nothing worse than being frustrated in a classroom, be it as a teacher or student when it comes to Mathematics or any other discipline. The engagement and learning that has come from the first edition of this game/tool has been awesome, and I can't imagine how great it would be to have an edition that is Multimedia and available on may different platforms. I wish there was something like this when I was a student as I'm sure some of you wish too. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out! If you are unable to donate or feel you just can't, please look at my website and pass that information along to those you feel could benefit from learning and building math skills using a board game (the first edition). I also have a Facebook and Twitter page.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Moses, a young hotelier, technology enthusiast, amatuer writer and photographer. I grew up in rural Kenya, and after a very humble childhood, joined the hotel industry where I have grown up the ladder to a General Manager of a mid range 70 room hotel.

My passion though has always been in technology and how it can resolve the simple and complex challenges our communities face every day. I Love books and music, and faced a big challenge locating shops with titles I liked. I went as far as purchasing items online on Amazon and shipping them all the way to Kenya. This inspired me to start an e-commerce site www.epur.biz which sells house hold items and books to locals here in Nairobi.

Our nascent ecommerce industry however faces two major challenges. The first one is payment. Less than 1% of our population use credit cards. Payments and money transfer had been a real hindrance until the onset of Mobile banking. Today, Kenya has the highest penetration of mobile phone banking, money transfer and payments. Upto 60% of Kenyan adults use these services especially Mpesa.

The second challenge, which I intend to resolve is Physical Addresses. Towns and cities in Africa were developed with very little urban planning in mind. There are literally no physical addresses. Except for the CBD, streets have no names. Navigating through neighbourhoods is a nightmare. Essencial serices like policing, response to emergencies etc is made very difficult as there is no address to give to the response team. Delivering goods bought online is logistically not possible.

As I started working on my business, I realized I would need to resolve the address issue if my business was going to succeed. I put much thought to it and realized it was not about my business alone, it is also about security, it is also about emergency response and social services; it is about the well being of whole communities. 

I came up with a brilliant idea which I have already started testing, and successfully so. I came up with a way of giving specific points on google maps a unique address that when clicked either on a computer or mobile phone, will open the exact point consistently with the option to get directions. For example, the tallest biulding in Nairobi is KICC. I created the address www.kwetu.me/nbi/kicc for it. If you tap this address on your phone, it will open up google maps with the exact location of the biulding. This address can now be put on business cards, email signatures etc as accurate physical address of an office or business.

My vision is to have kwetu (swahili for "our place") addresses widely used for giving directions across the country. If there is a fire at KICC for example, it should suffice to send the address www.kwetu.me/nbi/kicc to fire services and they will know where to go. 

I believe this project is not just for Africa. As the world becomes more and more digital, it will become necessary for even countries with the best physical addresses to harmonize them with web based map addresses. 

I have already funded the basic technical requirements, I provide all the man hours and have started testing. Now I need to scale up, put up a team, and cover more more ground. 

I need your help to facilitate mobility of my team as they map the areas, preferably using 4 motorbikes and one mini van. I need to buy them lap tops for official use, create an office they can use and pay their daily upkeep.

 

I am therefore welcoming funding from all well wishers, both in Kind and in Cash. If you have your old motorbike you can ship our way, lap tops, or cash, we will highly appreciate. If you are in Kenya and you have office space within Nairobi, that will also be very welcome.

As we move on, we may also need advanced programming expertise (php), so if you have those skills and wish to assist at some point in the near future, do keep in touch.

I believe this is the beginning of something big, it is just the beginning of digitising physical addresses across the world, and this time, we will be starting with Africa For once.

Every Penny contributed will go towards this most worthy cause.

story:
What is the Boston Faith & Justice Network?

Since 2006, Boston Faith & Justice Network (BFJN) has been leading a local charge for Christians to live simply in order to give generously. Our initiatives support the process of economic discipleship, or put more simply, learning to follow Jesus with your money. In addition to our small group Bible study called Lazarus at the Gate, BFJN offers practical resources helping individuals shift consumption patterns.

Fresh Thoughts On Food

One way we’re helping Christians live simply is by challenging our community to think differently about food sourcing. For the industrialized West, food choices often come at a high cost to our health, finances, farm workers and the environment. Christians are beginning to shift food practices for reasons deeply rooted in their faith in Jesus Christ. These simple, affordable changes demonstrate creation-care and love for your neighbor. 

Over the next year we’ll be planning hands-on educational programming designed to shift food consumption. In order to expand this programming we need an additional 20 staff hours per week. The cost for BFJN to host this person is $2,500 over and above our current budget. To make this exciting expansion a reality we need your help. We’re asking the BFJN community to help fund the remaining amount!

How Will You Benefit?

As an incentive to support this initiative, we're offering a limited number of food-related "perks" generously donated by people and partner organizations that support BFJN’s mission. Perks include items like private Indian cooking classes, home made apple butter, locally roasted Equal Exchange coffee, a year's supply (yup that’s right!) of Ben & Jerry's ice cream and a lot more! Each one of these items is transferable, meaning you can also give the perks as gifts during the Christmas season.

Each tax deductable donation will invest in creating stronger food-justice programming at BFJN. Please consider supporting this exciting new initiative as a part of your end of year giving! (Even if you can’t contribute financially, you can still spread the word! Share this link with your friends on Facebook, Twitter or through email.)

story:
Short Summary

Massage has been a lifelong practice of mine. I began giving massage when I was around the age of 18 months old. My parents,unfortunately, were in a terrible car accident before I was born. From this very early age I would go with them to physical therapy, return home and immitate the things I saw the therapists do on my parents.  As I grew older I continued giving massage to anyone in pain, it was always a very natural response for me. For over ten years now I have been a professional massage therapist and every year my work continues to grow. In 2010 I began my in depth studies of Thai Yoga Massage and Ayurveda with Dr. Anthony James at the Thai Yoga School in Plant City, FL. I received a wealth of knowledge from him through his Soma Veda program. It has been a dream of mine to study in Thailand since I became interested in massage therapy as a profession. After completing his Level 1 program in 2011, I realized that it was something I MUST do. There are many places to study Thai Yoga Massage in Thailand, but the one I want to visit and calls to me is the Old Medicine Hospital in Chiang Mai.  Ajahn Sintorn ,who started this school, is no longer in the physical. He passed in 2005, however his son is currently in charge of the school. Ajahn Sintorn was one of the teachers whom Dr. James studied with for many years until his passing. Through his many stories about this school in Chiang Mai my teacher and mentor ,Dr. James, has fostered an ever growing desire in me to attend this healing institution. My goal is to gain as much knowledge as I can during the six weeks I will be in Thailand. I will be studying nutrition, Ayurvedic Science and assessments as well as gaining knowledge in treatments in herbal medicines and remedies. The bulk of this knowledge gained will have to be learned again & again and put it into practice, but we must all start somewhere. Upon my return home I hope to have a more solid foundation which will enable me to start giving free and low cost workshops to families so they, in turn, can give this natural care to each other. True healing and care taking should have a base inside the home and with the family. Another one of my goals is to have a deeper knowledge on medicinal herbs and plants. I am hoping to begin growing my own medicinal herbs and plants for use in treatments as well as homemade salves over the next couple of years. All contributors to my project will receive discounted bodywork, some sort of take home remedy (herbal bath, oil, salts), and the knowledge that everything I learn will be used to grow and sustain a more healing community.

“Every day, think as you wake up, today I am fortunate to be alive, I have a precious human life, I am not going to waste it. I am going to use all my energies to develop myself, to expand my heart out to others; to achieve enlightenment for the benefit of all beings. I am going to have kind thoughts towards others, I am not going to get angry or think badly about others. I am going to benefit others as much as I can.” ― Dalai Lama XIV

What I Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise at least $4500. This money will help take care of everything while I am away; pay for my school, my housing, and travel. Anything I am able to raise outside of this amount will stay in a fund to help me restart my practice when I return home. I will need a few more supplies and items once I get home and any extra money will support that. Here is a simple breakdown of my costs...

$900 Travel (So far I only have one way to BKK, this is for round trip to SFO from MSY and BKK to SFO)

$1000 School Tuition and Books

$400 Room and Board in Chiang Mai for 5 weeks

$2000 Expenses at home while out of country for six weeks and business set up

$100 for my own therapies to experience and learn while in Bangkok for one week


I am not asking for a handout, I have many different options to choose from to support me on this life changing experience. Each level will be treated as a gift certificate. All therapies are discounted and everyone will receive a special and personalized gift to treat themselves right with after their treatment. The gift certificates and applicable discounts will be good for two years and can begin being redeemed January 2, 2014. Even if I don't reach my full goal I will still be making the journey so every contribution helps. 


The Impact

Anyone who has received my massage and bodywork from me can attest to how much my practice has grown since the first time I left New Orleans to study with Dr.Anthony James. This is simply another opportunity for me to cultivate and enhance my skills in an even more specific and detailed way. This specialized study in healing massage will  also give me the space and opportunity to work more on my own healing, growth, and development which will make me more grounded and able to serve once I return home. This is something that will benefit both you and I. I look forward to the end results with hopeful anticipation. Once returning home to New Orleans, I will still be providing sliding scale pricing on certain days for any  low income service workers. I will also be providing low to no cost workshops from time to time for families and people in partnerships. We need to cultivate more loving kindness in our community and I realize that it starts within. It is easy to act out of line when our bodies hurt, but I find it nearly impossible to act so when we are healthy, happy, and pain free. In essence this is a three fold  investment; in your health, my health and others in our community.  I hope that you can help and am deeply grateful for any contributions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to contribute or not, I thank you for taking the time to read my campaign. It would help tremendously if you can please share this through Facebook, Twitter, email, or any other social media that you have. You may also donate any amount directly to me through my website or PayPal and even purchase instant gift certificates there. www.nola.massagetherapy.com. Thank you so much for giving me this opportunity to share myself with you. May we meet happily on my mat or table soon. 

With Love, Peace, and Gratitude,

Amy Nicole Stewart, LMT#3118

story:
WE ARE ATTEMPTING TO RAISE $8500 FOR OUR MONTHLY
                        ALLOTMENT OF TICKETS TO ALCATRAZ

When you travel someplace for leisure, wouldn't you rather experience the the destination instead of tourist traps?

Two years ago, while working at a Union Square hotel, my co-workers and I noticed a disconnect between the San Francisco that tourists see and the City that a local would show to their own family and guests. At Explore San Francisco, we propose to change that by offering visitors an opportunity to see the city with a local guide and to enjoy a more personal experience during their stay in San Francisco.

The San Francisco tourist industry is one big pre-packaged experience. The
experience, largely created by national tour companies, seems bent on keeping out-of-town visitors within striking distance of corporate, chain restaurants and retail stores while limiting their exposure to the nuances of the City. The only interaction most visitors have with San Franciscans is the low-wage service employees wearing oddly colored vests with shiny nametags or savvy sales people attempting to sign them up for a tour for which they are commissioned to sell.   

San Francisco is a completely unique place, the city's beautiful location and  turbulent history and the demographics of the population have helped to create an experience that is a delight to encounter and just walking from one block to the next can reveal something unexpected and amazing. With all of the physical beauty and enthralling culture to delight the senses It seems counter- intuitive to have tourists sequestered into an area full of national retail chains; franchised, fast food; sweatshirt shops; and overpriced, low-quality restaurants. While most locals avoid these areas, too many visitors never venture beyond. Simply asking for directions at a Fisherman's Wharf tourist info booth, tourists unknowingly may be talking with someone who is actually working in the timeshare industry and/ or selling space on tour buses!

We do not believe that visitors to San Francisco choose to sequester themselves to a small, over-simulated area of San Francisco. We believe they are not aware that there is actually more to see. An alternative for these travelers to really see our great city is not usually available for them. They are getting mugged without ever knowing it.

When we encounter these people they are as happy to have found us as we are happy to have found them. Instead of a travel experience designed by researchers to squeeze every last dollar out of their wallet, with us they see the city's neighborhoods as a guest. 

Everyone when traveling to a destination wants to see the destination, clearly, and not a corporate-designed fascimile created to mimic the experience of the destination while draining it's attendees of their cash. Everyone, even tourists, deserve to be treated with respect.

Why does this matter?  Imagine the possibilities. 

We believe that communication and the exchange of ideas is essential to creating a better society and that traveling to a new place is more beneficial to all concerned if there is a chance for communication between travelers and residents. Local commerce benefits when out-of-city travelers have the opportunity to do business with local merchants. We also believe that tourists have the best travel experiences when they are able to explore and encounter the place to which they have traveled and meet the people that live there. We do not believe that San Francisco or any other destination for that matter is best served by allowing big business to control the travel experience. We live in a fractured society, where people are separated from each other idealogically and economically. Yet that does not mean that we can't enable change, and we have learned from our interactions with travelers here in this city that when given the
choice, the travel consumer is always more satisfied with an authentic experience over a manufactured occurrence.

Our Role and How We Roll

Our company operates as a co-op, in that no one is paid an hourly wage, nor are we commission-based.  Each local tour guide splits the proceeds with the house -- 50-50%.  Our guides have an affinity for the arts and include a filmmaker, a journalist, a comedian, and sculptor, along with photographers, musicians, actors, writers, a few students and a select few who choose this work over retirement.  Many of our guides are veterans of the industry, some are historians and some are just very enthusiastic about the city in which they live, San Francisco. 

I am the servant to these great individuals. It is my role to ensure that the system runs smoothly and that we are promoted and marketed to the world-at-large. My prior work experience was primarily hospitality-based, but I also worked in leisure travel.  The local guides are free to develop their individual tours to reflect their interests and share their knowledge of a particular neighborhood with visitors to San Francisco.  Our tours are not “canned,” but rather well thought out and reflective of each individual’s personality and experiences. 

Not having experience in the tour industry on a local level I was surprised, but not intimidated, by the stranglehold that some large, national companies have on the local tourism market.  I did not realize that the reason most visitors to the city don't actually see the city is really because the information that they receive -- prior to and after arrival here -- is manipulated by companies with big advertising budgets. 

 Ironically, it is the savvy, well-traveled individuals or those on very limited budget who are more likely to have a real San Francisco experience; basically, this is because the larger tour companies have no interest in them.   From our inception, a large part of our business has come from these two groups.  However, the average consumers are going to be marketed to in such a way that they never see the nuances of the city, but instead a version of San Francisco seen through the eyes of a profit-hungry corporation. 

In no area could this be any truer than with one of San Francisco’s most natural wonders – Alcatraz Island. Yet, the fact of the matter is that Alcatraz is the most sought-after ticket by tourists coming to San Francisco. For us to reach the most people traveling here, we need to offer them what it is they want.

We are specifically seeking contributors to purchase advance tickets for Alcatraz Island Tours.  Alcatraz Island is a National Park and is part of the Golden Gate National Recreation.  All Alcatraz tickets sales are controlled Alcatraz Cruises, the authorized concessioner of the NPS. Alcatraz Cruises is currently operated by the Hornblower Corporation. They are required by the National Park Service to make half of their tickets available to local tour operators like Explore San Francisco.

Alcatraz Cruises allows tour operators to purchase tickets through a lengthy application process.   The tour operators are to sell the tickets as part of a packaged tour, with the price of the Alcatraz ticket costing the same as if it were purchased directly from Alcatraz Cruises.  It is an arduous approval process, and until Explore SF, no walking tour/ running tour/food tour companies have ever been approved.

Not surprisingly, most of the tour operators who are approved to sell the Alcatraz packaged tours have the capitol and infrastructure to deploy personnel throughout different locations all around the waterfront.  They sell the Alcatraz tour packages that are mostly limited to tours in and around Fisherman’s Wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge usually on the large sight-seeing buses. These tours always sell out during the summer travel months and during the holidays.

Following the three-month application process, we started selling tickets in August 2012.  We sold out our monthly allotment three months in a row.  During this period we were in constant contact with the average San Francisco tourist and introduced them to a whole new world that they would have never seen before. We got the out-of-towners off of the busses, introduced them to real San Franciscans, cleared up wrong impressions, broke down barriers and exchanged interesting ideas -- the tourists benefited, the local merchants benefited and we benefited. 

We believe that packaging and selling over-rated tourist destinations to San Francisco tourists is really absurd yet it is common practice; however, we learned when meeting people in small groups, in an congenial setting, everyone had more fun and all walked away happier. Certainly the experience that we are successfully developing here will influence the way people travel in the future.

Hopefully, this new approach to tourism is already taking hold elsewhere because if we are seeing this new approach as a logical next step, certainly other people in other cities are also feeling this way and finding it necessary to act on their ideas.  

The Bottom Line

We are attempting to raise the $8500 that we need to buy a full monthly allotment of tickets for Alcatraz.

Our concept is proving to be a success and we are growing. So why do we need contributions? We started this company almost two years ago with nothing more than a basic concept, a few ideas and fierce determination. Our profit margin is small and we compete with large organizations with even deeper pockets.  We have come a long way, but the profits that the house realizes, are returned immediately back to the business. 

 On our very popular food tours, we pay our restaurants in advance. Small eateries are not really set up to to extend credit or to run tabs for their customer base. We get that, and although we are delighted to be giving the money to small independent local restaurants, most of the websites that sell space on our tours do not reimburse us for several weeks and any cash flow that we have ends up being tied up for extended lengths of time.  So that is where we find ourselves now, and we are in dire need of a cash infusion.

Alcatraz tickets are purchased in advance and many of our larger competitors will buy their tickets two or three months in advance, and of course they buy tickets for the most sought-after times first. Frankly we have never had an extra $8,500 needed to purchase our monthly allotment. We currently borrow the money every month and the interest is $10 a ticket or $3,000 per month.  This cuts into our margin and forces us to raise the price of our packaged tours, making us less competitive. This situation puts us at a severe disadvantage in the market place and what could be the key to growing our concept is handicapped before it begins. 

Although we take a hit financially each month because we are forced to borrow the money, we have successfully negotiated with an online presence that currently sells out every month, year round for their current Alcatraz providers.  The demand on their site is so strong that they believe they will be able to do the same for us.  If we did not have to pay the additional $10 vig on a $28 ticket, it would make the difference for us and we would be able to survive and prosper amongst the competition.

Your help (and no donation is too small) will help us to change the way visitors experience San Francisco. You can help us to show an authentic city to those that seek it. If you are tired of the pre-packaged and artificial experience that is selected for you and presented to you instead of real choice and real people, you can make a difference right now.

 

Help Spread the Word

Why let someone else control the message when you can?

Help us spread the word. Use Indiegogo's share tools. 

Like us on Facebook:
http://www.facebook.com/ExploreSanFrancisco

Follow us on Twitter:

http://twitter.com/ExploreSF
or
http://twitter.com/ExploreSanFran



Visit the site: http://exploresf.biz


We sincerely appreciate anything that you can do for this worthwhile cause.

Thank you. Explore you world.

WE ARE ATTEMPTING TO RAISE $8500 FOR OUR MONTHLY                        ALLOTMENT OF TICKETS TO ALCATRAZ
When you travel someplace for leisure, wouldn't you rather experience the the destination instead of tourist traps? 
Two years ago, while working at a Union Square hotel, my co-workers and I noticed a disconnect between the San Francisco that tourists see and the City that a local would show to their own family and guests. At Explore San Francisco, we propose to change that by offering visitors an opportunity to see the city with a local guide and to enjoy a more personal experience during their stay in San Francisco.
The San Francisco tourist industry is one big pre-packaged experience. The experience, largely created by national tour companies, seems bent on keeping out-of-town visitors within striking distance of corporate, chain restaurants and retail stores while limiting their exposure to the nuances of the City. The only interaction most visitors have with San Franciscans is the low-wage service employees wearing oddly colored vests with shiny nametags or savvy sales people attempting to sign them up for a tour for which they are commissioned to sell.   
San Francisco is a completely unique place, the city's beautiful location and  turbulent history and the demographics of the population have helped to create an experience that is a delight to encounter and just walking from one block to the next can reveal something unexpected and amazing.
