story:
Planta Feliz a Panamá

Hemos inventado el primer fertilizante 100% derivado de reciclaje de descartes vegetales de Panamá. Somos un emprendimiento joven llamado Productos Orgánicos Panameños (PoP) y necesitamos su ayuda para continuar operando, ofreciendo nuestro producto a precios justos y enseñando agricultura sostenible.

“Planta Feliz” to Panama

We have created the very first 100% Panamanian discarded vegetable byproduct fertilizer.  We are a young venture named “Productos Orgánicos Panameños (POP)”- stands for Panamanian Organic Products – and we need your help to continue operating, offering our product at fair prices, and teaching sustainable agriculture.



Planta Feliz 

El fertilizante que está cambiando la forma de cultivar en Panamá. Transformamos un problema (basura orgánica) en una solución, que es un fertilizante de acción rápida, fácil de usar y que no es un riesgo para los usuarios o el ambiente. Hoy se distribuye a nivel nacional, pero necesitamos tu ayuda para llegar aun a más personas y transformarlo en la base de una revolución de comida urbana. 

“Planta Feliz”

The fertilizer that is changing the way we grow food in Panama.  We take a potential burden (organic waste), and we turn it into a utility, a fast-acting fertilizer that is easy to use and is not a hazard to the consumers nor the environment.  It is presently being distributed nationwide, but we still need your help to make it even more widespread, and transform it into the foundations of an urban farming revolution.

Los talleres

Durante los talleres les enseñamos a las personas como cultivar comida en sus hogares gratis, hacerlo fácil para todo tipo de persona independientemente del nivel de conocimiento técnico o práctico. Hemos estado realizando talleres desde febrero 2014 y a la fecha seguimos compartiendo nuestros conocimientos sin detenernos. Tu aporte nos ayudará a llegar a más personas con nuestros productos y nuestra información. 

Workshops

In these workshops, we teach people how to farm in their own homes for free, making it simple for people of all demographics, regardless of their technical or practical experience.  We have been hosting workshops going back to February 2014, and to this day we are still sharing our knowledge, with no signs of slowing down.  Your support will help us reach out to those who have not yet had the chance to sample our products and knowledge.



Riesgos y desafíos

Somos un emprendimiento y como tal confrontamos todos los obstáculos de ser más pequeños que una microempresa, competir con grandes empresas internacionales y combatir la falta de conocimiento en relación al modelo agrícola actual. ¡Pero estamos en este camino por convicción! Nuestro deseo es dejar un mundo mejor, enseñando a las personas a cultivar su propia comida, mejorar sus hábitos de consumo e impulsar el cambio hacia un modelo de producción sostenible. 

Risks & Challenges

As previously mentioned, we are a very young venture, and as such we must face all the obstacles that come with being smaller than a typical micro-enterprise, competing with large multinational corporations, and battling the lack of widespread knowledge as it pertains to the existing agricultural model.  But we are in this for the long haul! Our aspiration is to truly make the world a better place, teach people to farm their own food, improve their consumption habits, and stimulate the necessary changes towards a fully sustainable production model.  


Los fondos


Nuestro sistema actual usa el espacio eficientemente pero es primitivo y requiere mucho trabajo manual. 

Our current method uses vertical space, however it is still quite primitive and requires a lot of physical labor.

Estamos investigando para producir un sistema totalmente automatizado que ademas de ser mas eficiente en el uso de agua y energia, puede procesar mas material haciendo una diferencia significativa en los materiales que llegan a los vertederos y ofreciendo una alternativa a dueños de restaurantes y hoteles para reciclar sus desechos. 

We are researching to upgrade the system not only of make it less labor intensive but also to be able to process large quantities of organic wastes providing an alternative to food oriented business to recycle their organic wastes thus reducing the amount of waste reaching landfills. 

Los fondos recaudados se usaran para:

  • Finalizar la ampliación y mudanza de la operación de Planta Feliz a la ciudad de Panamá.
  • Construir un capital de trabajo propio de la empresa.
  • Continuar ofreciendo talleres gratuitos de agricultura urbana.

“Planta Feliz” to the city of Panama

Your donations will be used to:

-Build a solid work capital for our venture.

-Continue offering urban agriculture workshops, free of charge.

Otras Formas de Ayudar

Recomienda esta pagina a otras personas, no tenemos grandes presupuestos para mercadeo por eso tu ayuda es muy valiosa recomendando nuestro producto y proyecto a tus amigos y conocidos. 

Other Ways You Can Assist Us

Help us spread the word!  Come to our workshops!  Contact us through social media!  Share this campaign with the people you know… Your help is priceless.

In these workshops, we teach people how to
farm in their own homes for free, making it simple for people of all demographics,
regardless of their technical or practical experience.  We have been hosting workshops going back to
February 2014, and to this day we are still sharing our knowledge, with no
signs of slowing down.  Your support will
help us reach out to those who have not yet had the chance to sample our
products and knowledge.




Riesgos y desafíos
 Somos un emprendimiento y como tal confrontamos todos los obstáculos de ser más pequeños que una microempresa, competir con grandes empresas internacionales y combatir la falta de conocimiento en relación al modelo agrícola actual. ¡Pero estamos en este camino por convicción! Nuestro deseo es dejar un mundo mejor, enseñando a las personas a cultivar su propia comida, mejorar sus hábitos de consumo e impulsar el cambio hacia un modelo de producción sostenible. 


Risks & Challenges
As previously mentioned, we are a very
young venture, and as such we must face all the obstacles that come with being
smaller than a typical micro-enterprise, competing with large multinational
corporations, and battling the lack of widespread knowledge as it pertains to
the existing agricultural model.  But we are in this for the long haul!
Our aspiration is to truly make the world a better place, teach people to farm
their own food, improve their consumption habits, and stimulate the necessary
changes towards a fully sustainable production model.  





Los fondos



Nuestro sistema actual usa el espacio eficientemente pero es primitivo y requiere mucho trabajo manual. 
Our current method uses vertical space, however it is still quite primitive and requires a lot of physical labor.


Estamos investigando para producir un sistema totalmente automatizado que ademas de ser mas eficiente en el uso de agua y energia, puede procesar mas material haciendo una diferencia significativa en los materiales que llegan a los vertederos y ofreciendo una alternativa a dueños de restaurantes y hoteles para reciclar sus desechos. 
We are researching to upgrade the system not only of make it less labor
intensive but also to be able to process large quantities of organic wastes
providing an alternative to food oriented business to recycle their organic
wastes thus reducing the amount of waste reaching landfills. 

Los fondos recaudados se usaran para:



Finalizar la ampliación y mudanza de la operación de Planta Feliz a la ciudad de Panamá.
Construir un capital de trabajo propio de la empresa.
Continuar ofreciendo talleres gratuitos de agricultura urbana.


“Planta Feliz” to the city of Panama
Your donations will be used to:
-Build a solid work capital for our venture.
-Continue offering urban agriculture workshops, free of charge.
Otras Formas de Ayudar
Recomienda esta pagina a otras personas, no tenemos grandes presupuestos para mercadeo por eso tu ayuda es muy valiosa recomendando nuestro producto y proyecto a tus amigos y conocidos. 


Other Ways You Can Assist Us
Help us spread the word!  Come to our workshops!  Contact us through social media!  Share this campaign with the people you know…
Your help is priceless.

story:
Become an Official Blog Awards Nominee - Enter Your Blog Today!

To enter, select the Featured Perk - Official Blog Awards Nominee.


Our Story

Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 is a five-day event including a Conference and Expo, Blog Awards Ceremony, Community Meetup and Pub Crawl. The event is designed to educate bloggers with hands-on, interactive instruction on How To Monetize Their Blogs and Increase Revenue, and also Recognize and Honor Bloggers. 

Our campaign will be launched in two phases: 

  1. Phase 1 Goal Amount: $1,627 - Current Campaign (live now)
  2. Phase 2 Goal Amount: $12-15k - Follow on campaign (TBD)

I’m Dante Hamilton, Graphic Designer / Web Developer turned Event Organizer. I am the founder and lead organizer of Chicago Blog Week™ Summer 2015. 

In 2008 I co-founded Chicago WordPress Meetup Group (ChiWP) with Bruce Montgomery, Host of Technology Access TV on Cable Access Television here in Chicago, IL USA. ChiWP is the foundation for Chicago Blog Week™ Summer 2015.

Our Track Record of Success

ChiWP become the 5th largest WordPress Group on Meetup.com early on, then it peaked at 900+ members. See chart from Meetup.com below:

Currently there are 800+ members, mostly bloggers and web developers who use WordPress, the number one blogging software in the world. According to W3Techs.com, WordPress is used by 23.9% of all websites.

ChiWP has hosted over 120 Meetups, mainly 1-2 hour Free WordPress trainings. In 2009, ChiWP members collaborated to create a 1-Day WordPress Workshop, which was launched at OfficePort Chicago, a collaborative workspace similar to 1871 Chicago, that opened back in 2009. 

My company, Internet Webpages Newspaper Inc (IWN), was the very first OfficePort tenant, and our offices are still located in the facility (see photo of office below).

1-Day WP Workshop Trained Dozens of Attendees

From 2009-2011 we trained dozens of ChiWP members, and accumulated over 50-plus testimonials on Meetup.com. 

The 1-Day WP Workshop alone generated over $4,000-plus in revenues as a paid Meetup.com event, something very rare at that time, and developed a successful event-driven business model. 

See our financial results below achieved from actual Meetup.com statistics:

Giving Back to the Chicago WordPress Community

As a way to give back for the financial success of 1-Day WP Workshop, In November 2010, the Chicago Blog Week Lead Organizer, who is founder of Chicago WordPress Meetup Group, the largest WordPress Meetup in Chicago, setup Chicago WP Expo - a free event designed to educate the community about the benefits of WordPress websites and blogs (very similar in context to Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015). 

Chicago WP Expo launched as a FREE, 2-Day Hands-on, Interactive Training. 150+ Chicago WordPress Meetup Group members RSVPd, and 75 attended over that weekend, helping Bloggers like Diana Kakoma create AfricanChicago.com.

The event was held at OfficePort Chicago, which you can see in the background on the blow video of Diana Kakoma. Ironically, the very space behind Diana Kakoma is exactly where Chicago Blog Week / IWN offices are located today.

In June 2011, ChiWP Expo was held at University Conference Center in downtown Chicago. Over 70+ Chicago WordPress Meetup Group members and others RSVPd with 35 people attending that two-day event. These two Chicago WP Expo events was our way of giving back to members who paid to attend 1-Day WP Workshop trainings. 

The Potential Impact Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 Will Have on the Global Blogging Community

Listen to a testimonial from Chicago WP Expo attendee Diana Kakoma and feel the impact of the Chicago WP Expo event from her own words:

What happened to Diana Kakoma after she attended Chicago WP Expo in 2010? 

See for yourself. Here is her website: AfricanChicago.com. She even gives a shout out to the Chicago WordPress Meetup Group on her About page here: Site Info as she says Thank You "Chicago WordPress Meetup Group for all your early encouragement and enthusiastic support."

Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 will have a similar effect on attendees just as Chicago WP Expo did on Diana Kakoma. 

Here's Why Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 Is So Important

52% of Bloggers Earn Less Than $1,000 Annually, based on research from TechnoratiMedia's 2013 Digital Influencer Report.

Is this statistic for real? 

Absolutely. I can show you first hand how real it is. For instance my video blog, MyChicagoJourneys.com, is a YouTube.com Channel. With over 900+ videos, 140 subscribers and over 175,000 views in nearly five years, my total Lifetime estimated earnings (June 16, 2010 - May 11, 2015) is less $100! See for yourself below:

The Profound Effect and Magnitude of Your Contribution

Unfortunately for me, I was never taught how to monetize my Youtube,com channel. Had someone showed me how to setup my channel properly, and then how to increase revenues with MyChicagoJourneys.com, I could have potentially increased my revenues of $85 to maybe 10-times that amount to $850, or even more. 

This is the profound effect and magnitude of what your contribution to Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 will mean for bloggers like me who attend this event. So please help us educate and honor bloggers with a contribution now. 

You can make a donation in any amount without buying a perk, just click the Contribute Now button above. Please support us!

The Global Blogosphere: 158 Million Blogs

According to a Wikipedia citation: "In 2011 it was estimated that there are more than 158 million identified blogs." The success of Chicago Blog Week™ Summer 2015 will have far-reaching implications for bloggers everywhere.

Two Main Goals of Chicago Blog Week™ Summer 2015

The are two primary goals of Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 that will help alleviate this low income dilemma for most bloggers:

  1. Educate Bloggers on How To Monetize Their Blogs and Increase Revenues with a 3-Day Conference
  2. Promote, Recognize and Honor Bloggers from around the world in a Chicago Blog Week Awards Ceremony (similar to an Oscar Award or Webby Award event) with a 13" Statuette Trophy shown below:

What We Need & What You Get

Our Phase 1 Goal Amount is only $1,627 and it will be used to finance the purchase of an Attendify Mobile App (shown below), which will be used as the Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 event application.

Why a Mobile App for Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015? 

According to a Nielsen report released March 5, 2014, while all smartphone users spent 89 percent of their mobile media time in Q4 2013 using mobile apps, women spent nearly an hour-and-a-half more than men using mobile apps.

Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015's target audience, is tech savvy, affluent women (men are welcome to attend as well).

Our Phase 2 Goal of $12,000 covers the cost to manufacture 30 Blog Award Trophies (shown above). This follow on campaign will be conducted once we reach our Phase 1 Goal.  

Here are the costs breakdown:

  1. Phase 1 Goal: Mobile App powered by Attendify = $1,627
  2. Phase 2 Goal: 3D Manufacturing of 30 Blog Award Trophies = $12-15,000

Below are Sample Perks You Get as a Contributor

We've assembled some really cool perks for contributors. These include some really basic items and also a few we think are very special "experiences":

Basic Perks, Very Affordable

  1. Thank You Card $5 - Handwritten by Team Members and Mailed (not an email)
  2. 3-Inch Round Button $10 - Chicago Blog Week Rocket Logo in color 
  3. Bookmarks $15 - Set of three printed in full color
  4. Poster $20 - 11x17 inch printed full color, shipped in clear tube
  5. T-Shirt $35 - Personalized with your first name. Available in white and light blue
The perks above are just a few we think are easy on the budget. Most campaigns have these to offer and ours is no different. Go ahead and Contribute Now!

Check out our official Chicago Blog Week™ Summer 2015 Unisex Zip Hoodie. It's still kinda cool here in Chicago so you may wanna get this perk and stay warm! Contribute Now!

Our Featured Perk - 24x36 Inch Instagram Cutout Poster $100

This screenshot below is captured from the Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 Mobile Event App timeline. The Instagram poster you see there is a sample of our featured perk. Get yours today. Contribute Now!

What Happens if We Fall Short of Goal Amount?

We believe breaking our campaign into two phases increases our chances of reaching the goal amount for each phase. By starting out with a smaller goal of just $1,627, we feel confident this can be reached within our time period. So go ahead and Contribute Now!

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone reading this story can make a financial contribution to Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015. But you can help by using the Indiegogo share tools above and by helping us make some noise! 

Also, here are a few specific things you can right now to help us reach our goal:

  1. Spreading the word to your friends on Facebook by posting a link in your status
  2. Compose a Tweet and share it with your followers on Twitter
  3. Contact The Team at Chicago Blog Week Summer 2015 at 1-844-BLG-WEEK with any ideas you think will help us reach our campaign goal.

Please Contribute Now

Thanks!

Chicago Blog Week™ Summer 2015 Team
Dante, Lead Organizer and Corinthians, Sales Lead and Grace, Crowdfunding Marketing Coordinator. Not shown: Bruce Montgomery, Media Sponsor and Mary Vasquez, Published Author and Blogger.


Chicago Blog Week 2015 Salutes Our Championship Chicago Blackhawks on Winning Stanley Cup Three Times!!!Our Story continues under the video.

Published on Jun 18, 2015

#Chicago #NHL #Blackhawks #Parade #Stanley #Cup 6-18-2015. Awesome celebration at Dearborn and Monroe Streets in downtown Chicago. Let's Go Hawks! http://IWNurl.com/GO Make It Happen for Chicago Blog Week 2015! #CBW2015

story:
I'm sorry for the generic image of food, but I'm ashamed at having to beg strangers online for money, so don't wan't my face to be attatched. 

My name is Sawyer and I've been battling with near poverty since I've been fourteen and my parents decided that they didn't want me anymore. I don't mean for this to sound like a sob story, these are just the facts. 

I was taken in by my friend's family for a year and after that year I've been scraping all the money I can get from odd jobs (I have agoraphobia and a bunch of other anxieties which stop me from holding down a job for long) and money from being a full time student to just about survive. 

However, last year one of my friends died, and my other friend- who had been living with him- suddenly moved in with me since she's unable to return to her family. 

Since then her mental and physical health has been in decline, and I've had to care for her. While I'm still a student I can't claim any money for being a carer, and she is currently waiting for news of her benefit claims before she can pay anything towards food or bills. After rent and utility bills I had £300 last September, and have managed to make that three hundred last four months for two people. Almost. There's been many nights of not eating and doing without, but at least I've lost some weight throught it /s

I have £5 in my bank account and another month and a half to feed up as we have precious little lining our cuboards. 

As I said, I'm ashamed it's come to this, but I don't see any way that we can survive. I've cut down every single non-essential and our one meal a day is usually potatoes, rice or noodles. There's nothing else I can cut out. 

I'm sorry, I have no proof of this, so I doubt many of you will think we're telling the truth. That's fine, I can't argue with you. 

But if you do ignore your doubts and decide to help two people who are struggling, then there are absolutely no words I can use to express how thankful I would be. Seriously, there's nothing I can think of and I'm supposed to be a writer. Or a wannabe writer anyway. 

Thank you for reading <3 
Even if you don't help, I still hope you have a really amazing Christmas and holiday. 
-Sawyer x

P.S I, of course, don't need £500. It was just the lowest amount that it would allow me to claim. I'd be ridiculously grateful for £10, it can at least feed me for a week if I stretch it.

story:
Our goal is to teach seniors how to stay connected through technology. Technology is constantly changing and they aren't able to keep up. We want to teach them the essentials of communication through technology so they can chat with their grandkids, other family, and friends. If we are able to raise $5,500 we can impact their lives for the better. The money will help pay for proper training materials and a few training laptops.

Please consider helping up help others. If you're unable to contribute, please share our story on social media - that will help too!

story:
Bella Solviva is excited to announce the acquisition of our permanent home outside of East Jordan, Michigan!

The Bella Solviva eco-resort is now located on 229 stunning acres in the Jordan River Valley, on West Old State Road five miles east of Central Lake, half way between East Jordan and Bellaire, and 25 miles west of Gaylord.

With sweeping vistas, winding creeks, cedar and pine forests and towering hardwoods, we knew this was home. The two ponds, one which features an adventure island in the center of the pond, will be sure to stir the imagination of your children and create family memories for years to come.

We expect to announce an opening date this coming week, and are shooting for a handful of sites to be available in July. The announcement will coincide with our reservation system being turned on, allowing you to choose available accommodations and finalize your reservation.

We are thrilled to partner with you in building a legacy of traditions. Use our referral program to share your excitement about Bella Solviva and glamp with us for free. Check out our surveys to receive a discount on your first reservation and visit our sponsorship page to customize a glamping accommodation to your own personal specifications. We are building it so you can come! Follow us on Facebook or at BellaSolviva.com.  Reservations will be available shortly.  Let’s do this!


Phase I Note

We have chosen crowdfunding for our first phase to use as  a proof of concept.   This means that we wish to ascertain whether or not Bella Solviva is a viable concept, by means of the interest generated by this campaign.  If we hit our modest goal, we know the interest is there and will move on to Phase II.  If the interest is not evident, we will gladly refund those that participated in this phase if desired, (minus Indiegogo fees) and reevaluate our approach for the future. 

It should be noted that no Indiegogo campground campaign we've found has garnered much of any support, Bella Solviva is very different.  So, if you feel our concept hits the mark as something you and your family would enjoy for years to come, purchase with confidence!

Project Overview

This is not your Grandfather's campground.  Bella Solviva is a comfy camping eco-resort, being created for the outdoor adventure enthusiast who has an appetite for indulgence.  While traditional camping and RV's are supported at Bella Solviva, our emphasis is on glamping!  What's glamping, you say?  It's a new word for a new kind of travel - defined as posh, luxury or boutique camping.  Glamping is a fusion of glamour and camping which emerged internationally and came across the Atlantic over the last decade. Glamping emphasizes a high level services and amenities which focus on the complete comfort of our guests.

Bella Solviva is Midwest's first and only glamping destination where travelers will experience the positive aspects of camping without the uncomfortable negatives.  As our guest, you'll choose from an array of furnished accommodations; there’s no tent to pitch, no RV to haul and no sleeping bag to unroll. (unless you want to; we have sites for you, too!)  Whether in a safari tent, teepee, airstream, airliner, caboose, cabin, villa or tree house, you can experience the great outdoors without sacrificing comfort or luxury while enjoying an endless combination of year round activities, amenities, and services to make your stay relaxing and memorable.

If you are looking to experience the peace and tranquility of the outdoors coupled with the ease and comfort of a lavish retreat, then welcome to your new favorite vacation destination - Bella Solviva!

Press

    C&G Newspapers on 15-April, 2015

  Glamping.com on 06-April, 2015

    Crain's Chicago Business on 27-March, 2015

    Traverse City Ticker on 28-March, 2015

     PromoteMichigan on 25-March, 2015


Press Quotes

GLAMPING' AN UNDERSERVED MARKET (from Crain's Chicago Busines)

Glamping is an underserved market in the area, Brad Carlson said. “There's nothing like it. Campgrounds are already overflowing, so they need more occupancy.  I think we're hitting the right market at the right time with the right product, and we are interested to see if Indiegogo people agree with that.”

Ryan Hutchings, the Salt Lake City-based general manager of Glamping.com, a website through which guests can book glamping accommodations, agreed that the market is underserved, especially in the Midwest.

“It is still spread out across the country. You have a few places in Florida that serve it; you have California, Washington, Montana, and then beyond they are kind of interspersed here and there,” he said. “Unless you live in proximity to one of those places, it becomes a much bigger commitment.”

Since then, independent properties and global hospitality brands, including Four Seasons, have capitalized on the rising trend. Hutchings said online glamping search volumes have grown by double digits every month since January 2012. He said there are an estimated 2,000 to 3,000 glamping sites worldwide.

Alden, Mich., sits on the shores of Torch Lake, which runs parallel to the Grand Traverse Bay. The town is deep in Michigan wine country, and the area draws tourists from Chicago and Detroit focused on wine, hunting, water, foliage and cross-country skiing. It is about a 40-minute drive from Traverse City, which hosts outdoor recreation such as Sleeping Bear Dunes, Traverse City State Forest and other activities surrounding Lake Michigan.

“Glamping really epitomizes what we call experiential travel,” Hutchings said. “Where you are staying is part of your experience. It is not just another piece where you go back to your hotel room and sleep, it is part of your trip.”

Campsites are plentiful throughout the area, but Hutchings confirmed glamping sites are rare. Glamping.com lists only two sites in Michigan, one in the Upper Peninsula and one just north of the Indiana border. Glamping Hub, another website devoted to the activity, identifies only two places to glamp in the Grand Traverse Bay area—a yurt in Lake Leelanau and a garden cottage on Lakeview Lake.

The Chicago area has the same kind of scarcity in glamping sites, Hutchings said, with only a few locations listed on either website throughout Illinois and Wisconsin.


Bella Solviva Accommodation Types

Bella Solviva's property features 100+ acres of handsome woodlands and cascading creeks nestled among rolling hills and gorgeous ridge-top views – perfect for a private, secluded year-round getaway.

Typical Garden Bath

Bella Solviva means Beautiful Hope. Solviva is the name of a Swedish flower that means hope or it will at last be the way we wish. The word Solviva also means sun life which is one of our primary goals - to create a sustainable, near net-zero energy footprint recreational community by utilizing onsite generation of renewable energy through solar, wind and hydro power; a vacation destination unlike any other in Michigan, if not in the nation.

Some of our Amenities

Activities Galore!




When you make your 'reservation' to secure a 1-week stay at Bella Solviva today, you’ll earn a FoundersFirst VIP Membership!

FoundersFirst Benefits
  • Advanced reservation privileges on promotional offers
  • VIP Perks during your stay which include gifts, celebrations, and onsite privileges
  • Discounts toward future reservations
  • Your name will be included on our Wall of Fame at the Bella Solviva Resort
  • Earn complimentary services, meals or a free week of glamping when your friends & family, as a result of your referral, make a reservation during this campaign   (Go to BellaSolviva.com for more details)
As a FoundersFirst VIP member, you become the architects.  With your input on accommodations, activities, services and amenities, you have the opportunity to help draw up the blueprint for the Bella Solviva Eco-Resort.  In essence, you help to build a vacation destination that will create memories year after year.

Funds from this campaign will be used to

This is Phase 1 of at least 2 Indiegogo campaigns.  Primary use of Phase 1 funds are to:

  • Get reservations systems online and functioning
  • Purchase ads and links on various industry sites and publications
  • Handle regulatory & licensing needs
  • Develop as many sites as funds permit
  • If donations permit, begin work on permanent clubhouse/welcome center

About your Hosts


Brad and Sandy Carlson are a foward-thinking couple who have a passion for the outdoors and premium camping experiences, combined with real-world experience in a variety of companies that they have owned, making them ideally-suited to this venture.
 
Brad is an entrepreneurial, senior executive with over 30 years of proven leadership in business startups, team and project management.  He utilizes a team oriented, process focused management style to build and retain highly motivated development, sales and support teams.  Brad is proficient in operations, development, technical application, testing, marketing and training of personnel for startups as well as established public and private sector companies.
 
Sandy is a seasoned leader who has led, managed, and trained teams in a variety of service related industries including education, fitness, ministry, hospitality, and private duty home care over the last 25 years. As a trainer, Sandy has been invited to speak at seminars and conferences on the topics of personal development, interpersonal relationships, team building and creating viable profit centers as a strategy for short and long term growth of an organization. She is recognized for discernment and strong interpersonal skills while compassionately serving the unique needs of others. Honest transparency, a strong work ethic and integrity - doing the right thing when no one is looking - are central to what she expects from herself. As an entrepreneur, she has started and/or owned several other businesses, including an adventure-based travel venture.

Additionally, you will find Brad & Sandy, along with the entire staff, eager to please, open to ideas and wishing to make Bella Solviva as much your place as ours.


FAQ

1) Why is Bella Solviva using Indiegogo to fund this eco-resort?

  • It provides us a proof-of-concept.  Knowing before building what our clientele's desires and tastes are.  What the demand is for each accommodation type.  How popular different activities and amenities would be.  And most importantly, if this is a viable concept.
  • It allows our clientele to be part of the evolution of this project.  They help us define what it should be.  In exchange, we expect this to become a generational family destination, because many families will be fully engaged with us.

2) If the proof of concept shows the concept not to be viable, do I get my money back?

  • Yes, if we don't hit our goal and you request a refund, we will kindly honor that, minus fees charged us by payment processors and Indiegogo.  If we hit or exceed our goal, refunds are not an option. (We should have set this as a fixed funding campaign, but missed it)  The Indiegogo fee is 9% and if credit card is used, another 3%.
3) Will all unit-types be built immediately?
  • See #4 below!

4) How do reservations certificates work, and what is the fine print?

  • While we expect to have sites available late-June, weather, construction schedules or a host of other events have the potential to delay the opening.  We will work diligently to meet our expectations, but if the arranged unit is not available, we will work with you to either reschedule your stay, or find you alternative accommodations in lieu of.  Certificates will be good indefinitely, and do not have to be used in 2015.
  • Certificates will be numbered in the order donations are received.  Those who donate first get to reserve first when the reservation system is up!
  • With each paid contribution above $499 from the campaign, contributors will receive a survey where they will select the type of accommodation desired.  If we do not have enough “votes” for a given type, we will not build it at this time.  In such case, you will be given the choice of other comparable units.
  • Contributors will also rate by weight our various amenities and activity offerings.  With those weights in hand, certain ones will float to the top of the list, and others may take a lower priority.
  • By means of engagement with this project, you agree in the spirit of this venture to model flexibility and understanding of a project of this scope.  We agree to work towards the common goal of making this the best Eco-Resort in the Midwest, in a spirit of unity and cooperation.
story_txt:
Bella Solviva is excited to announce the acquisition of our permanent home outside of East Jordan, Michigan!



 The Bella Solviva eco-resort is now located on 229 stunning acres in 
the Jordan River Valley, on West Old State Road five miles east of 
Central Lake, half way between East Jordan and Bellaire, and 25 miles 
west of Gaylord.
 With sweeping vistas, winding creeks, cedar and pine forests and towering hardwoods, we knew this was home. The two ponds,
 one which features an adventure island in the center of the pond, will 
be sure to stir the imagination of your children and create family 
memories for years to come.

 We expect to announce an opening date this coming week, and are 
shooting for a handful of sites to be available in July.  The 
announcement will coincide with our reservation system being turned on, 
allowing you to choose available accommodations and finalize your 
reservation.
 We are thrilled to partner with you in building a 
legacy of traditions.  Use our referral program to share your excitement
 about Bella Solviva and glamp with us for free.  Check out our surveys 
to receive a discount on your first reservation and visit our 
sponsorship page to customize a glamping accommodation to your own 
personal specifications.  We are building it so you can come! Follow us on Facebook or at BellaSolviva.com.  Reservations will be available shortly.  Let’s do 
this!


Phase I Note

We have chosen crowdfunding for our first phase to use as  a proof of concept.   This means that we wish to ascertain whether or not Bella Solviva is a viable concept, by means of the interest generated by this campaign.  If we hit our modest goal, we know the interest is there and will move on to Phase II.  If the interest is not evident, we will gladly refund those that participated in this phase if desired, (minus Indiegogo fees) and reevaluate our approach for the future.  
It should be noted that no Indiegogo campground campaign we've found has garnered much of any support, Bella Solviva is very different.  So, if you feel our concept hits the mark as something you and your family would enjoy for years to come, purchase with confidence! 

Project Overview

This is not your Grandfather's campground.  Bella Solviva is a comfy camping eco-resort, being created for the outdoor adventure enthusiast who has an appetite for indulgence.  While traditional camping and RV's are supported at Bella Solviva, our emphasis is on glamping!  What's glamping, you say?  It's a new word for a new kind of travel - defined as posh, luxury or boutique camping.  Glamping is a fusion of glamour and camping which emerged internationally and came across the Atlantic over the last decade. Glamping emphasizes a high level services and amenities which focus on the complete comfort of our guests.



Bella Solviva is Midwest's first and only glamping destination where travelers will experience the positive aspects of camping without the uncomfortable negatives.  As our guest, you'll choose from an array of furnished accommodations; there’s no tent to pitch, no RV to haul and no sleeping bag to unroll. (unless you want to; we have sites for you, too!)  Whether in a safari tent, teepee, airstream, airliner, caboose, cabin, villa or tree house, you can experience the great outdoors without sacrificing comfort or luxury while enjoying an endless combination of year round activities, amenities, and services to make your stay relaxing and memorable. 

If you are looking to experience the peace and tranquility of the 
outdoors coupled with the ease and comfort of a lavish retreat, then 
welcome to your new favorite vacation destination - Bella Solviva!
Press

    C&G Newspapers on 15-April, 2015
    Glamping.com on 06-April, 2015

    Crain's Chicago Business on 27-March, 2015

    Traverse City Ticker on 28-March, 2015

     PromoteMichigan on 25-March, 2015

story:
MyBeautyAds.com is a family owned and operated small business in Scottsdale, AZ. Both my daughters are experienced hairstylists and I am a former Salon Owner. We created this website to address the following issue.

In today's world, cross referencing the seemingly endless amount of job classified ad sites is an overwhelming task. This makes it difficult for finding gainful employment or qualified employees for almost every profession. We feel it’s time the beauty industry had this process streamlined!

Our Solution – MyBeautyAds.com!

What separates us from the tangled confusion of multiple job classified sites found on the internet?

MyBeautyAds.com is a niche classified ad site strictly dedicated to servicing the beauty industry.

We also provide a FREE 45 day listing package. We do not believe a business owner should have to choose between seeking out qualified employees and other operating cost. Our low priced package combined with the specific focus of the listings our site provides will draw more relevant users to our location on the web. With more listings available, there will in turn be more opportunity for employers and prospective employees alike to more easily fill their specific needs.

Another aspect of our site that truly separates us from other sites is the users ability to select up to 5 different categories in one listing which saves time! We also offer other classified ad listings such as salons for sale, services such as shear repair and listings with retail ideas for salon owners as well as used salon furniture listings to help beauty professionals sell items they no longer need.

Mobile Friendly & Responsive

To top it all off, our site offers mobile device optimization with absolutely no APP download needed! We built mybeautyads.com to work on any platform: from your Desktop, iPhone, iPad or Android device. This enables our users to access everything we provide while on the go. 

More Site Features

- No Registration required to search site.

- Select categories you would like to receive an email when a new listing is added.

- Create and manage your favorites list.

- Select up to five different categories in one listing.

- Add up to 4 images.

- Google Maps.

- See how many views a listing has received.

- Share listing via Social Networks and Email.

How will we cover future expenses?

We plan to cover the costs of site maintenance, upgrades and future enhancements through listing upgrades and enhancements which can be implemented to any listing on the site by the user for a fee. Also, like most other websites, advertising space will be available on our website for relevant companies to showcase their products and services. However, this space will be limited as we have no desire or intention to overwhelm our users.

Please Help Us Launch MyBeautyAds.com!

Help Us Launch MyBeautyAds.com!

Our Goal is to be the primary source to find and list classified ads for Beauty Professionals. To accomplish this we need the beauty industry to know our site exists. To really gain momentum our marketing budgets needs a “KickStart” and with your help our vision is possible.

We would like to take advantage of the Facebook Go offer to provide small businesses with a dedicated Ads Specialist to help us learn how to use their sites to grow our business. We need to invest at least $25 per day with their ads to qualify for this personalized support. Our funding goal of $5,000 is based on using their help for 6 months and cover the costs of using indiegogo.com for this project.

If we are lucky enough to exceed our goal, the excess funds will be put towards additional marketing and advertisements with facebook plus Google without losing focus on site maintenance, further development, etc.

Thank You for Your Support!

We cannot put into words how much we appreciate your support! You will see we are offering "Perks" for your support; but I hope you know that they do not even come close to showing you how much we appreciate you for believing in our vision!

Thank You from our family; Brenda, Christina, Justine, Brendan and Tristen.

FAQ

How do I redeem my perks ad upgrade? Go to MyBeautyAds.com and select your state, click on post your listing above the header, select post a FREE 45 day listing, register, fill out your listing information - remember to submit listing at the bottom of the page and within 48 hrs we will upgrade your listing.

Other than contributing, how can I help? You can help by spreading the word about mybeautyads.com to your friends, family, co-workers via Twitter, Facebook, email, or any other social networking site.  You can find our share links at the top of this page. Thank you for helping us reach our goal!

If I have questions, how can I reach your team? For questions please feel free to email us at brenda@mybeautyads.com.

What are your risks and challenges?  If the beauty industry does not embrace our solution or we do not have a balance between users and listings.

story:
Helpful People Selling Really Good Cheese

We love the food scene in downtown Guelph. So many talented people selling incredible products such as beer, salami, bread. But there's one thing missing—a cheese shop!

That's why we're opening TOMME Cheese Shop—the best-stocked and most-inviting cheese shop this town has ever seen!

We're creating a comfortable, welcoming place where you can sample and buy the best cheese you've ever tasted. Each visit you'll discover delicious products from local artisans and centuries' old producers. Our knowledgeable staff will recommend mouthwatering options for your next party or corporate event. And for those who can't wait to get home, we'll have crisp cheese panini and individual cheese boards, available with wine, beer, or cider. 

We know this community is crazy about cheese. We've heard this from virtually everyone we've talked to about this idea. That's why TOMME isn't going to be a shop for snobs, it'll be a shop for cheese lovers—all you curd nerds!

We are so excited! We hope you'll contribute today to help open TOMME!

What's In It For You

As an incentive to help, we've created some fantastic perks our supporters will receive when they make a contribution. You'll find everything from shop discounts to art prints, locally crafted serving boards to VIP tickets for our opening party (swag bags included!). 

We even have a limited number of perks that will PAY YOU BACK dollar-for-dollar in cheese!

Your support will help fund essential aspects of the business: rent and permits to get our shop space open, legal and professional fees, creating a beautiful and inviting atmosphere, hiring and training staff, purchasing an amazing opening inventory, and getting the word out.

Long term, you're building into our community. TOMME Cheese Shop has already and will continue to support local artists, contractors, designers, artisans, and food producers. 

Challenges

The biggest challenge for this project is when we will open. We're aiming to throw open the doors in May 2018, the threshold of summer when foot traffic picks up and we'll have great exposure to all the people visiting Market Square. We want to maximize this time to establish our reputation as one of downtown Guelph's great food destinations.

If we don't open on schedule, we'll loose some of that opportunity. We'll also start burning through rent without any income. So hitting that opening date is a top priority.

Please Support Us Today

We ask that you support us in any way you can. We need contributions large and small. We've worked hard to ensure our perks are both fun and useful. 

And please help get the word out about TOMME Cheese Shop on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and via email. For the success we envision, we need the support of the whole community. Your sharing is the crucial!

Truly great shops are not just about products, they're about amazing experiences. Your support will help us create a place you'll love, a place you want to be, a shop you want to come back to again and again.

And for those who can't wait to get home, we'll have crisp cheese panini and individual cheese boards, available with wine, beer, or cider. We know this community is crazy about cheese. We've heard this from virtually everyone we've talked to about this idea. That's why TOMME isn't going to be a shop for snobs, it'll be a shop for cheese lovers—all you curd nerds!We are so excited! We hope you'll contribute today to help open TOMME!What's In It For YouAs an incentive to help, we've created some fantastic perks our supporters will receive when they make a contribution. You'll find everything from shop discounts to art prints, locally crafted serving boards to VIP tickets for our opening party (swag bags included!). We even have a limited number of perks that will PAY YOU BACK dollar-for-dollar in cheese!Your support will help fund essential aspects of the business: rent and permits to get our shop space open, legal and professional fees, creating a beautiful and inviting atmosphere, hiring and training staff, purchasing an amazing opening inventory, and getting the word out.Long term, you're building into our community. TOMME Cheese Shop has already and will continue to support local artists, contractors, designers, artisans, and food producers. ChallengesThe biggest challenge for this project is when we will open. We're aiming to throw open the doors in May 2018, the threshold of summer when foot traffic picks up and we'll have great exposure to all the people visiting Market Square. We want to maximize this time to establish our reputation as one of downtown Guelph's great food destinations.If we don't open on schedule, we'll loose some of that opportunity. We'll also start burning through rent without any income. So hitting that opening date is a top priority.Please Support Us TodayWe ask that you support us in any way you can. We need contributions large and small. We've worked hard to ensure our perks are both fun and useful. And please help get the word out about TOMME Cheese Shop on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and via email. For the success we envision, we need the support of the whole community. Your sharing is the crucial!Truly great shops are not just about products, they're about amazing experiences. Your support will help us create a place you'll love, a place you want to be, a shop you want to come back to again and again.

story:
We work with the local NGOs and volunteers in each country to provide sustainable clean safe water to families in need. 

 

FIJI: Nearly half of the population does not have access to safe water.

In the past year the country has been directly hit with TWO category 5 hurricanes.  

The country is rebuilding, and the need for clean SAFE water is greater than ever.

                                                

Recently, Kite4Water sent 20 filtration systems to Nepal, to provide clean water access to 2,000 people in rural areas.

Each filter has lifespan of 1,000,000 gallons, which means it will last for 5+ years!

 

We are seeking funding to support our teams traveling to Fiji and Nepal to transport filters to conduct our own clean water projects, work in collaboration with the NGOs (detailed below), and identify new partners that can easily incorporate these life saving filters into their existing programs.

 

Our team is currently traveling to Fiji in November, to work on a monumental project with other NGOs:

To bring the entire country clean water access.  

450,000+ Fijians.

 

Your support will help us to create a better quality of life for communities in Nepal + Fiji, while ensuring the success of future projects to come.

This project will show the world how far a dollar can go in changing a family's quality of life.  In Fiji, every $25 will provide a household clean water access for 30+ Years, thanks to an incredible donation by the filter manufacturer (more info below).

 

There are many different issues when it comes to clean water access, but we’ve chosen this filter technology and distribution/education techniques because we can implement them immediately in areas that have fresh water access, but water-borne illness is prevalent. 

 

Founders Scott Gordon & Jeff Kafka holding the easily portable filtration systems

 

FIJI

Our team members are traveling to Fiji to rally NGOs, businesses, and Fijian residents around a monumental project: To bring SUSTAINABLE clean water to EVERY SINGLE family in Fiji.

 

OUR GOAL IS TO RAISE FUNDS TO TAKE 1 TRIP TO FIJI EVERY MONTH, UNTIL LOCAL COMMUNITY LEADERS CAN RUN THE PROJECTS THEMSELVES.

THEN WE CAN FOCUS EFFORTS IN OTHER AREAS.


 

TRIP COSTS

Average cost for a trip to FIJI

14 Day trip to distribute 500 filter systems

 

Filters (including shipping) ALL DONATED = $0

Plastic Buckets to complete filtration systemf $3 each (x500) = $1500

Distribution Costs based on region + difficulty of access

Flight to region (Round trip to FIJI $1,000- $1,500)

4x4 rental truck ($90 per day) X 14 Days = $1,260  (Gas = $500)

Food + lodging for staff ($100 per day) X 14 Days = $1,400

Payment for staff (includes project development prior to trip) ($2000/ 14 days)

Payment for locals hired ($50 per day x 14 days = $700)

(includes: translating, in country strategy, identifying NEW communities

in need, and establishing new leaders in each community)

Adaptive Reserve funds for any situations we encounter that

would make access or distribution more difficult. Any reserve

funds not used, these funds carry over to the next trip ($3000)


 

Overview

Filters $0

Plastic Buckets $1,500

Flight $1,500

4x4 truck $1,260

Gas $500

food + lodging $1,400

Staff $2,000

Hired locals $700

Reserve funds $3000

TOTAL $11,860

 

 

The work in Fiji is leading the way for sustainability practices around the world.

Photo by Give Clean Water.

 

With this work, we cannot drop off filtration systems and do a simple training for families or communities; there has to be follow-up visits to every single filter installed, to ensure that the systems are being used and maintained properly.

 

We will work in collaboration with Give Clean Water, who has lead the way in Fiji since 2008, and we are working with them to continue our learning in sustainability.

 

Give Clean Water is receiving a donation of 100,000 filters, in order to reach households and villages across every island in the country.  

 

To complete this exciting initiative, we need significantly less financial support than before given the recent donation of filters ($3,400,000 of product).  We only need to purchase plastic buckets/ faucet adapters AND pay for distribution. 

 

This is a collaboration of NGOs as well as the Fijian Government to complete, distribute, and educate the public on use of the water filtration systems.

This work could take 5 years OR MORE. How long will depend on your support.

 

Children under the age of 5 are the most suseptable to water borne illnesses

 

The ultimate goal is to take everything we learn about the sustainability effort going on in Fiji, and share this with our partners in Nepal and NGOs around the world working for clean water access.

 

 

 

NEPAL

In April 2015 a 7.8 magnitude earthquake hit the country of Nepal.

It damaged 600k homes and 5k public buildings.

Displaced people are living under tarps, in man-made temporary housing.

Pre-earthquake: 10,500+ children die every year from diarrhea, caused by contaminated water.

Nepal’s clean water crisis is a complex problem with many compounding issues.

Government pumps water but does NOT filter.

Nepal Progress Report: 50% of population, 16 million, practices open defecation, 80% of communicable diseases are a result of contaminated water

No toilets or running water - open defecation and high probability of disease

India’s fuel blockade just months ago. (India’s reaction to Nepal's recent Constitution).

We have partnered with the group Volunteer Initiative Nepal (VIN) to incorporate our filtration systems into their current hygiene and sanitation programs in rural parts of the country.

 

VIN volunteers preparing filters to take to rural villages in Nepal

 

Currently we have the potential to distribute at least 6500 filtration systems over the next year, through VIN's already well organized network of volunteers.  This is a great challenge ahead of us.

 

Our first goal is to raise the funds to distribute 1000 filtration systems, then we will focusing on delivering clean water to every single family household in the areas detailed below. 

6,500 filters (completed systems) will cost approximately $125,000.

 

 

While this is an enormous goal, we do not need full funding immediately to start delivering filtration systems in Nepal.  

 

Our teams will start doing humanitarian trips with 100+ filters at a time to take to more centralized locations, before we work reach every single household.  

 

Our team is also working on ongoing project development, and is directly involved with distribution working side by side with VIN.

 

Filters will be distributed to:

schools

ECD centers

community centers

orphanages

local government public offices

monasteries

(350 filters NEEDED)

 

Filters will be distributed to Families in:

Taluwa, Thulachhap & Bhadaure of Okhaldhunga (2000 filters NEEDED)

Okharpouwa (1900)

Nuwakot and Kavresthali (1000)

Jitpurphedi (1250)

 

This project runs under the WASH (Water Sanitation & Hygiene) of VIN. The success of this project will help us gain support to branch out and bring more remote regions of the country clean water access.  This is only the beginning.

(VIN volunteers preparing filtration systems for distribution)

 

Our first clean water ambassadors have just returned from working with VIN on clean water initiatives, where they assisted in delivery of filters and identifying areas lacking clean water. VIN teams are also building wells, toilets, and the septic systems.  Over 1000 toilets have been built already by VIN. We can go back to the installed bases immediately to implement water filters.

 

Installing toilets (VIN's primary project) AND providing purified water is a three prong solution... Remove the waste from the water, supply and provide disease-free filtered water to wash hands and drink, and education. 

Only 30% of the population wash hands after defecation and only 12% use soap.


It's difficult to describe how life saving these filters are... Any support will save lives, NOW.

 VIN is heading this project currently.  They have proven that their connection to the families in communities we are trying to reach is invaluable! 

 

 

THE GLOBAL MOVEMENT

NGOs are using this filter technology and distribution techniques in 70 different countries around the world to bring MILLIONS of individuals clean water access. Please join us in helping to spread this amazing cause and combat the global clean water crisis.

As we continue to learn about the sustainability effort in Fiji, we want to take this knowledge and spread it to NGOs around the world.  There are countless groups working on clean water, hygiene, and sanitation projects. We want to help them realize the potential of these filtration systems.

 

We have a great challenge ahead of us, to raise the funds and awareness necessary to reach our goals with our partners in Fiji and Nepal, as well as to advise other NGOs on our innovative filter and education systems.

 

Our team is ready to start working on these projects full-time.  We can use all the help we can get to create a sustainable future of clean water access for those in need.

 

 

 

EVEN IF YOU CAN'T DONATE NOW

YOU CAN STILL HELP THE CAUSE

 

Start a Project/ Fundraiser

Are you a creator and an organizer? Get your local community involved today!

There are so many ways to contribute to the cause, whether you talk to friends about getting involved, or hold a full-on fundraiser party to raise money AND awareness.  Use your entrepreneurial skills to help those in need and start your own “TRAVEL 4 CLEAN WATER” project.  We will do anything we can to help and guide you in setting up your own fundraiser or project, just contact our team and we can begin collaborating.

 

Write about us

Any exceptional writers interested in writing about their experiences with us?  You can help us spread the word.  We are looking for any passionate society member to submit their work to us; it can be articles, interviews, or even art.  The goal is to submit these to media so more people can find out about Kite4Water, and our innovative filter technology and distribution techniques.

 

Share our Story

Sharing our story on Twitter, Facebook, or on any social media platform, will help us get recognition and will contribute towards this fantastic cause.

You can join the clean water movement with just a few clicks.  Our filter technology is so new that the majority of people have not heard of hollow fiber membrane filters yet.  They last for over 1,000,000 gallons. That alone will grab people's attention.

 

Much Aloha,

The Kite4Water Team

 

 

 

 

KITE4WATER T-SHIRT

story:
Hello! 

We are La Commune, a worker owned café and bookstore. 

But not yet. There is still a lot of work to do before we can actually say that we are a worker owned café and bookstore. Currently we are a worker owned bookstore in a big messy room with no plumbing (and believe us, it already took a lot of work to get this far.) We need your help!

Hence, this indiegogo. We are trying to raise funds to give our little café a good start in life, and take care of one or two things our health and fire permit issuing pals have ever so sweetly requested.

Let's talk a little more about La Commune, before we talk about money.

La Commune is located in the Omni building in North Oakland. A group of ragtag sweethearts with crazy political views moved into this building this summer. They formed the Omni Oakland Commons, a collective of collectives that includes artists, hackers, citizen scientists, dancers, a free university called the Bay Area Public School, a community print studio, a wellness collective, and us, with even more to come.

The idea of La Commune came from a mind melding session (during a full moon!) of David Brazil and Niki Shelley, of the Bay Area Public School. David wanted to support the public school with a bookshop and small press. Niki dreamed of creating a welcoming space for the Omni community and all its neighbors to gather, mingle, talk and break bread together. It wasn’t long before the two dreams became one even bigger and better dream. Then they began looking for the cast they would need to make it a reality. Soon they had rounded up a band of seasoned book and café warriors, Seven Samurai style, to build a café bookstore worthy of the Omni vision: veteran booksellers Owen Hill and Pamela Jackson, and writer and coffee wrangler Steve Orth.

The five of us have been working hard for 5 months to get La Commune off the ground. We're excited about our project for so many reasons. We’re excited to collaborate with our comrades at the Omni and provide a welcoming and nurturing space for the community. We’re excited to bring good books and coffee to a neighborhood where rising rents are making it impossible for no or low profit businesses like these to survive. We’re excited about the unique space we’ve moved into, and what we can do with it. Here are some specifics of our vision:

The bookstore: we’ll carry new and used books, with an emphasis on literature, poetry, philosophy, radical politics, and other topics close to our collective hearts. We’ll be a general bookstore as well, with a fabulous kids section, cookbooks, urban gardening and DIY, art, science and everything in between. We will buy and trade used books at our buying counter starting Opening Day.

As battle-scarred veterans of the book trade, we're well aware it’s a tough time to open an independent bookstore. Soon Amazon will be delivering books by drone. With a free cup of coffee. We know this. But we also know our neighborhood needs a bookstore.  In the spirit of mutual support -- and in the interest of a thriving world of books and ideas-- we’re seeking partnerships with small local presses and distributors, who are also feeling the pinch of online retail. Expect to see a dedicated table for Small Press Distribution in Berkeley and PM Press in Oakland, to start with, with more to follow. In the same spirit we will be hosting regular readings and book parties for local and visiting authors, and instituting a membership program with discounts on books and café fare.

The café : we aim to provide a friendly and  unpretentious alternative to the work station cafés that are popping up around the city: a comfortable space that welcomes the whole neighborhood with affordable coffee and wholesome foods. We'll start small with coffee, baked goods and sandwiches, but our dreams include soft serve ice cream and kombucha on tap. Really!

Beyond the café bookstore -- La Commune at the Omni: Once we have our space fixed up we can’t wait to get started on all the fruitful and mutually supportive collaborations we’re envisioning with other collectives in the Omni. We see La Commune as an integral part of a project much bigger, more ambitious and more amazing than just ourselves: the co-creation of a community and art space in Oakland open to all. We hope La Commune will be a classroom for the Bay Area Public School, a publisher of broadsides, posters, and chapbooks printed out of the Omni basement, an outlet for selling Omni-made wares, and a place for readings, workshops and gatherings of all sorts. But first...

What we’re asking:

Why do we need your money? Great question.

A lot of the stuff that was in our space that looked ready to use turned out to be broken or in violation of numerous city codes. Other stuff just wasn’t there. We had to remove the old bar, because it was rotten underneath, and we’re starting from scratch with the plumbing and electrical. We're opening the bookstore while still under construction, but we have a lot more to do before we can start serving coffee or food, and some of it is expensive. Here are some of the boring things that we didn’t plan on needing but can’t do without:

  • All new plumbing (ouch)
  • New lighting and electrical wiring
  • Working refrigeration
  • New sinks
  • A new bar
  • Clear glass windows
  • Louis Vitton handbags for our weekend getaways to Napa
  • A washable ceiling to be installed over the food prep area, and food-prep quality flooring.
  • A paint job

We’ve totaled it up to $18,000 (that’s actually without the handbags, folks) and we’re asking you to help! We launched this indiegogo on our bookstore's opening day, SUNDAY NOV 16 with jazz by Ouroboros and a historic reading by Michael McClure and Diane Di Prima. It was a huge success! We were deeply moved to see this beautiful old building filled with old and new friends. Thanks so much for your support!  

We're currently open noon to five Thursday through Sunday. If you're in the neighborhood, join us to say hello, hear about our plans for the remodeling, and check out our fine - and growing - stock of new and used books . We're planning more events over the next couple of months: Please join us and watch for updates!

You can friend us on facebook here:

 https://www.facebook.com/events/1556773741206068/   

Other ways to help:

If you can't contribute money, you can still help! We're still building our bookstore stock, so if you have quality books to donate or sell, we'd love to hear from you. If you have time on your hands, come help us with dump runs, painting, drywall mounting, and our other dirty jobs. Most important, spread the word about La Commune! Visit, tell your friends, like us on facebook, follow us on twitter and share this indiegogo page.  Thank you, and see you at the Omni!

the interest of a thriving world of books and ideas-- we’re seeking
partnerships with small local presses and distributors, who are also feeling
the pinch of online retail. Expect to see a dedicated table for Small Press
Distribution in Berkeley and PM Press in Oakland, to start with, with more to
follow. In the same spirit we will be hosting regular readings and book parties
for local and visiting authors, and instituting a membership program with
discounts on books and café fare.
The
café : we aim to provide a friendly and  unpretentious
alternative to the work station cafés that are popping up around the city: a
comfortable space that welcomes the whole neighborhood with affordable
coffee and wholesome foods. We'll start small with coffee, baked goods and
sandwiches, but our dreams include soft serve ice cream and kombucha on tap.
Really!
Beyond
the café bookstore -- La Commune at the Omni: Once we have our space fixed up we can’t wait to
get started on all the fruitful and mutually supportive collaborations we’re
envisioning with other collectives in the Omni. We see La Commune as an integral part of a project much bigger, more ambitious and more amazing than just ourselves: the co-creation of a community and art space in Oakland open to all. We hope La Commune will be a
classroom for the Bay Area Public School, a publisher of broadsides, posters,
and chapbooks printed out of the Omni basement, an outlet for selling Omni-made
wares, and a place for readings, workshops and gatherings of all sorts. But first...
What
we’re asking:
Why
do we need your money? Great question.
A
lot of the stuff that was in our space that looked ready to use turned out to
be broken or in violation of numerous city codes. Other stuff just wasn’t
there. We had to remove the old bar, because it was rotten underneath, and
we’re starting from scratch with the plumbing and electrical. We're opening the
bookstore while still under construction, but we have a lot more to do before
we can start serving coffee or food, and some of it is expensive. Here are some
of the boring things that we didn’t plan on needing but can’t do without:


All new plumbing (ouch)


New lighting and
electrical wiring


Working refrigeration


New sinks


A new bar

Clear glass windows

Louis Vitton handbags for
our weekend getaways to Napa


A washable ceiling to be
installed over the food prep area, and food-prep quality flooring.


A paint job


We’ve
totaled it up to $18,000 (that’s actually without the handbags, folks) and
we’re asking you to help! We launched this indiegogo on our bookstore's
opening day, SUNDAY NOV 16 with jazz by Ouroboros and a historic reading by Michael McClure and Diane Di Prima. It was a huge success! We were deeply moved to see this beautiful old building filled with old and new friends. Thanks so much for your support!  We're currently open noon to five Thursday through Sunday. If you're in the neighborhood, join us to say
hello, hear about our plans for the remodeling, and check out our fine - and growing - stock of new and used books . We're planning more events over the next couple of months: Please join us and watch for updates!You can friend us on facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1556773741206068/   
Other
ways to help:
If
you can't contribute money, you can still help! We're still building our
bookstore stock, so if you have quality books to donate or sell, we'd love to hear from
you. If you have time on your hands, come help us with dump runs, painting,
drywall mounting, and our other dirty jobs. Most important, spread the
word about La Commune! Visit, tell your friends, like us on facebook, follow us on twitter and share this indiegogo page.  Thank you, and see you at the Omni!

story:
We would like you to offer a support for the idea of an entirely new and inspiring place in Krakow, Poland. A place that connects the city of Krakow cultural tradition and modern approach to eating and spending time in developing creative ways - „Hariprasad Samosa & Curry”

It is going to be a place of vegan food, mainly inspired by Indian cuisine but not only..Hariprasad in India means  karma free food, spiritual food, which has a positive effect on our body and spirit. We would like to make this place among few vegan and vegetarian places in Krakow not only focused on pleasing the palate, but also the place where we can strengthen our spirit, relax from the hectic and frenzied pursuit of profit and endless desires, where we can focus on our interior, meet people with similar needs , take part in lectures on yoga and self-development or listen to live music, which goes to our hearts in a building ..

This idea was born out of my personal needs as I was working as a vegetarian chef for many years. I used to work as a chef in England, Birmingham, the award-winning The Warehouse Cafe (https://www.facebook.com/thewarehousecafe? fref = ts) as well as in various places in Krakow and Warsaw. 

I am interested in yoga and self-development, I met many local yoga teachers and a lot of people looking for the true values in life, not necessarily related to a specific religion. Living in Krakow, I miss the place where I could spend time in the evening not drinking a beer and not stuffy room on cigarettes where I felt my senses become more dull than alive, but in a place where I could meet creative people interested in yoga, self-development, art and philosophy of different cultures. Talk to them, be inspired, exchange the experience, a place for people interested in the broader of the Eastern philosophy but not only…for those who are looking for something more in life, can meet other people thinking the same way, stay together, have delicious karma free meal. 

Together with me Natalie and Joanna my very good friends will be creating this place. Two girls that i used to work with several different vegetarian projects in Krakow.

Krakow is a unique place, a former Polish capital and cultural capital of Poland a place with great potential, which is still undiscovered visited by numerous tourists from abroad, especially from Europe and mainly from England, from where flights are frequent and cheap.

We have already started preparing vegan food that we deliver to six organic shops in Krakow (https://www.facebook.com/Samosapierozkiindyjskie?fref=ts) 

Food that we would like to serve are mainly all kinds of samosas and curries, we will also serve thali or a plate with few small dishes, eg., rice, dhal, curry, chapattis, samosas and chutney. 

Our dream is also to distribute food to those in need at least once a month. We want to have a share not only geared towards feeding but also towards the people and the excluded.

The money raised by Crowdfunding platform will be used for arrangements and premises equipment. The biggest expenses are air conditioning and kitchen equipment. We are looking for premises that already has a kitchen and two small rooms, one with a bar and tables and a place for teachers or musicians. 

We would like to organize periodically free yoga and other traditions (Buddhist, Sufi, and others) lectures, ethnic music concerts, gongs, drums and mantra meditation.

If you love Indian cuisine, you are close to the ideals of self-development, spiritual development, or in any other way you like our idea PLEASE SUPPORT US!!!

story:
Who We Are

1VoteMatters is committed to helping Albertans determine their best opposing candidate to vote for during the upcoming federal election.  We will do this by commissioning a publicly accessible survey during the second and third weeks before the election. In the last week we will actively promote the crowd-sourced slate of candidates to the rest of the province.

We have been working on this for over three years since the 2012 Calgary Centre by-election which saw vote-splitting send a Conservative MP to Ottawa with only 37% of the vote.

Last spring, Alberta Premier Jim Prentice called a snap election that was not supposed to occur until 2016. While we had previously been focused on working towards the federal election, we sensed an opportunity to connect voters who were yearning for change within our province.  We were right.

Our initiative, 1ABVote, had substantial engagement:

  • 3872 people participated in our survey.
  • There was over 100,000 visits to our website.
  • Our social media content had over 20,000 shares.
  • Our slate was 87% accurate in predicting winning non-PC candidates.

Ultimately the election resulted in the first change in Alberta's government in over 43 years. It was exciting but it also exhausted the financial resources we had accumulated for the upcoming federal election. This is why we need your help.

What We Hope To Do

Of Alberta's current 28 ridings, 27 of them have Conservative Members of Parilament.  We want to show Canada that our province is more diverse than that.  
We will run a campaign similar in structure to our provincial effort but with a more developed ground game.
Our Budget
  • Secure Survey Facilitation              $4000
  • Website and Graphic Design          $3000
  • Social Media Promotion                  $5000
  • Printing                                                  $2000
  • Administration                                    $1000

Should we only get a portion of the money, we will adjust proportionally after basic survey costs are covered.

What You Can Get

By donating to our campaign you become an Agent of CHANGE with the hopes that you will continue to promote our efforts.  Agent of CHANGE toolkits include:
  • mini-comics
  • posters
  • t-shirts
  • lawn signs
As well, premium donation perks include advance data access, on-line polling opportunities and expert consultations.

The Impact

It's looking to be a close race this fall.  The better aware that voters are with how their community is thinking, the more effective their vote will be.  Supporting our initiative will help remind parties and their leaders that they work for the voters, not the other way around.

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't just need money. 1VoteMatters also needs people to spread the word.  You can easily promote our campaign by using the IndieGoGo share tools or by getting involved with our active social media presence. And good old fashioned word of mouth is the cornerstone of any grass-roots movement.

But most importantly, be sure to vote on October 19, because, in the end, your one vote matters. A lot.

Thank you.


Authorized by the 1CalgaryVote Committee
