story:
Lachlan, a Celtic duo out of Louisville KY has been asked to play for Wilderwood Service Dog's fundraiser in Maryville, Kentucky. As this is a fundraiser for a non-profit organization, we are hoping to not have them pay Lachlan a dime. $500 is Lachlan's minimum goal and everything above our goal will go directly to Wilderwood Service Dog's.

A little bit about Wilderwood. This is a message from Tiffany, the director.

Hello, everyone, my name is Tiffany and I'm the president/founder of Wilderwood. This organization was born out of dreams, sweat and tears, and I'm proud to be a part of it. We opened our doors in Maryville, TN on August 1, 2005. I am a psychiatric nurse by trade and have been involved in psych care and nursing for all of my adult life. I have seen a lot of treatment modalities in that time. I have given a lot of medication. I deal daily with brain trauma, autism, emotional illness, dementia, and Alzheimer's. Out of these experiences arose an awareness that there was something missing and something that simply MUST work better.

I have also been involved with dogs since childhood. I have trained dogs in obedience, animal assisted therapy and service dog work. Wilderwood is an outgrowth of those life experiences.

In all my experience I have never seen anything, and I can safely say ANYTHING, that has been more therapeutic than the animal/human interaction. What happens to a person's soul, and then their perception, in the presence of a beloved animal is far reaching. That relationship impacts a person's life more than a therapist, medicine, treatment programs or all of them combined. In that reality, Wilderwood finds its passion. Our dogs help individuals gain independence (emotional and physical). Our dogs provide unconditional love and support. They assist in all facets of life; behavioral, emotional and physical. We are excited to be a part of something so wonderful.

Thanks for your support!

Our dogs help individuals gain independence (emotional and physical). Our dogs provide unconditional love and support. They assist in all facets of life; behavioral, emotional and physical.  We are excited to be a part of something so wonderful.Thanks for your support!

story:
Featured on Cleveland based 96.5 KISS FM's Facebook page

My Story

Hello world, my name is Adam Corrao. I am currently a senior in high school and an entrepreneur. I have started this business for two main reasons: one being that I feel as if business comes natural to me and two being that this is my way of being abnormal. Let me emphasize on that second point. I fear the normal life of the 9-5 job and living paycheck to paycheck. It's not for me; this is my escape route. 

The campaign is for my website www.earhipster.com. This company specializes in Apple style Earpods. That being the earbuds that you receive from Apple when you purchase an iPhone or iPod. The problem is that these earbuds are only sold in the color white which is common and generic; and for $30 if you purchase them from Apple. My website's main purpose is to help you express individuality. We do this by selling the famous earpods for ONLY $10 in the colors gold, green, red, orange, pink, and white. 

I already have inventory, however, my main focus is gaining funds to advertise and scale the business. Please read on to understand the magnitude of your contribution.

What We Need

My funding goal is quite low at only $1,000. Scaled down, if only 100 contributors donate a mere $10, my goal will be reached. 

Based on if I reach my goal, the following is how the money will be spent:
  • $400 will go towards online ad campaigns and to boost my SEO rankings
  • $400 will go towards the purchase of print ads such as flyers, postcards, business cards, posters, etc.
  • $200 will go towards inventory
If there aren't enough generous people such as yourself and I don't reach my goal, then I will scale the prices down based on the amount raised. 
With this I campaign, I want to ensure trust and satisfaction for my contributors. If you have any questions that you want to ask me, my email is earhipster@gmail.com.

The Impact

The impact of your donation would be HUGE. I currently am lining up some business contacts to advertise with, however, that will not be enough to scale my company to the point I need to be at. Your generous donation will give me the opportunity to make this company go through the roof. 

The earpods I sell are the most popular earbuds in the world. What makes Earhipster stand out is the diversity in product and price. As I previously stated, I sell the earpods in SIX different colors whereas Apple sells them in one. The quality is the same between the two. On top of that, I sell my earpods for only $10, Apple sells theirs for $30. My inventory is unmatched. 


Your donation will help not only spread the deals to the masses, but once I receive a high volume of sales, I will ship worldwide rather than domestic. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate monetary value to this campaign, you can still donate sentimental value. All you need to do is simply click one of the share buttons.

Help me make my voice heard.

story:
As part of a passionate team of East Lansing and Lansing residents, V-Day Lansing was created in the fall of 2013 with hopes to spark conversation in the Lansing community regarding domestic and sexual violence, in addition to creating a movement of support and solidarity for victims, survivors and all who are effected by violence. 

A MEMORY, A MONOLOGUE, A RANT AND A PRAYER: WRITINGS TO END VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN & GIRLS is a groundbreaking collection of monologues by world-renowned authors and playwrights, edited by Eve Ensler and Mollie Doyle. These diverse voices rise up in a collective roar to break open, expose, and examine the insidiousness of violence at all levels: brutality, neglect, a punch, even a put-down. The volume features such authors and topics as: Edward Albee on S&M; Maya Angelou on women's work; Michael Cunningham on self-mutilation; Dave Eggers on a Sudanese abduction; Edwidge Danticat on a border crossing; Carol Gilligan on a daughter witnessing her mother being hit; Susan Miller on raising a son as a single mother; Sharon Olds on a bra; Patricia Bosworth on her own physically abusive relationship; Jane Fonda on reclaiming our Mojo; and many more.

This production is a benefit performance.  100% of proceeds from the show will benefit the Lansing Capital Area Response Effort (CARE). CARE is a Domestic Violence Post Arrest Response Team and the only post-arrest response team for victims/survivors of domestic violence in Lansing, Lansing Township, Meridian Township, East Lansing and on the campus of Michigan State University.

While ticket sales contribute immensely to our funds for CARE, we hope that creating a convenient way to donate online will help us to raise even more support for a local organization that relies heavily on donations to keep their services going.

These diverse voices rise up in a collective roar to break open, expose, and examine the insidiousness of violence at all levels: brutality, neglect, a punch, even a put-down. story:
The Inspiration:

Over the past four years the Kruse family has added almost 2,000 American Flags to the patriotic display along Greenville's Historic Park Street, the Audie Murphy Overpass leading into Downtown, and have lined I-30 from Monty Stratton Parkway to Moulton Street.  Many residents of Greenville already participate and have a flag placed in their front yard by the Greenville Daybreak Rotary.  The Kruse's were inspired to go out on their own and acquire the flags after watching CBS Sunday Morning episode that featured Larry Eckhardt aka "The Flagman" and his efforts to honor America's fallen heros.  In the past few years, the flags have been used to line a portion of the funeral procession of the late Navy Seal, Chris Kyle, as well as other events around the area.


The Project:

This year we are concentrating on expanding the memorial at the Audie Murphy Overpass.  The memorial started last year honoring the 267 fallen soldiers from WWI, WWII, Vietnam War, and Korean War - all with their home of record being Hunt County.  However, this year's memorial will be opened up to current Hunt County residents that have a friend or family member that was killed in action - but did not reside in Hunt County at the time of their death. 

Also, every other year is a maintenance year for Greenville Flags, so the funds we raise this year will go towards retiring frayed flags, and replacing them with new ones.  These are crucial years as they are also planning years for the following year growth. 


How You Can Help:

We are once again asking for contributions to help with the supplies needed.  With such a large inventory of flags and crosses, the maintenance can be quite hefty.  You can make a contribution via this campaign or visit our Facebook page for more information on how you can help.  (https://www.facebook.com/GreenvilleFlags)

story:
Vegans in the South of England need their own camp-out!

This year I attended the UK Vegan Camp-out. It was a fantastic event with more than 2,500 people attending. They had activism talks and workshops presented by some of Youtube’s most famous (and infamous) activists. You can imagine how inspiring it was.

On top of that there was also a chance to commune with other vegans, eat vegan food and for the kids there were fun times too! What more could you ask for?

Ever since coming home I have been wishing there was an event like this closer to my home (in Surrey). In my imagination I pictured a camp-out here in the South East with a focus on vegan food and living. We could have music, cooking demonstrations and vegan lifestyle workshops to share our experience of how to live a peaceful vegan life.

Everything was going swimmingly in my head and then I started wishing someone would set something like that up. It would be great and I would definitely buy a ticket!

Who knows how long I would have had to wait around for someone else to sort that out, so I decided I’d have to do it myself….

One Monday evening I posted on my Facebook page and I received an immediate positive response. It turns out loads of other people had been thinking the same thing and were willing to help with the organisation.

What to expect

PEOPLE - we are aiming at getting 300-500 vegans together.

VENUE - we have found a perfect vegan and dog friendly venue in Hever, Kent.

EDUCATION - cooking demonstrations, yoga classes, etc..

ACTIVISM talks.

ENTERTAINMENT for kids and adults including LIVE MUSIC and KIDS ACTIVITIES 

FOOD - On top of the cooking demonstrations there will be delicious vegan food available.

Where and When is the Event

It's at Hever Camping, in Kent from Friday 13th July 2018 to Sunday 15th July 2018. Here's a few photos of the site when they were setting  up for LeeFest this year:-
 

 

What will you get for your money?

We need to pay the deposit on the site very soon and have some funds in place for upfront costs to make sure we have all the facilities we need on the weekend.  That's where you come in. We are offering a 20% discount if you buy your tickets now - that way we can pay the upfront costs to make sure the event goes ahead.

£5 THANK YOU perk - for those of you who can't make it but want to support the event, you'll get a huge vegan thank you and massive vegan love.

£15 T-SHIRT perk - buy a t-shirt to help support us and you'll get a huge thank you and massive vegan love thrown in for free! (Our designer is busy designing the t-shirt right now).

The £32 BASIC perk - this perk gives you entry for one to the camp-out and a big thank you for supporting us. It's non-refundable so we can get on and get booking things but on the plus side, it comes with a 20% discount.

The £48 ADVANCED perk includes entry plus an awesome specially designed t-shirt, which our designer is busy working on right now. Also a 20% discount.

If we have enough demand for a 'glamping option' we will add one!

How can you help, I hear you ask?

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help make Our Vegan Weekend an awesome success by:-

  • Sharing our Facebook Page (https://www.facebook.com/ourveganweekend/) or get the word out there on Twitter and Instagram using the hashtag #ourveganweekend

  • Telling every vegan you have ever met about the event and asking them to share it with their friends

  • Using the Indiegogo share tools!

The website will be up and running very soon and we'll let you have the details as soon as we can.

story:
Crucible Brewing - Our Story So Far

Opening Crucible Brewing in 2015 has been, literally, a dream come true for us. From our humble beginnings as passionate homebrewers we started on a road that brought us to where we are today. There have been days that we have struggled, days of long hours, and hard work. This is the reality of opening a small business. But we love what we do. We love beer. And we love seeing the excitement and the enthusiasm of our patrons and local community. The community that has become our backbone and resolve. Because of our kick ass community, every day has been an incredible day doing what we love, and loving what we do...oh and the beer certainly helps! ;-)

Community

With the original founding location of Crucible Brewing: The Foundry, in Everett, we noticed something incredible. It's not something we noticed right away because, frankly... we arent that smart. What we noticed is that the local brewery has become the spot where the neighborhood gathers. Where people from all walks of life, all trades and backgrounds, meet. Converse. Share the stories of their day. And share their birthdays and special occasions with loved ones. The community is who we make our beer for. It's because of this growing awareness that we decided it was time to grow with our community.

The Future

With the addition of our new production brewery and taproom, the Woodinville Forge, our dream got a little bigger. With our acquisition of the brewery equipment, assets, and location of 12 Bar Brews we now have the tools to share our love of beer with the greater Washington Beer Community. We are asking that you trust in our dream and help us to grow into the brewery that we know we can be. We wont stop till we can make sure that you can enjoy Crucible beer wherever you go: at home, at your favorite restaurant or bottle shop, at work (wouldn't THAT make Mondays go faster...) and beyond.

How You Can Help

First of all. Every little bit helps! We have put together a TON of reward tiers/perks as part of our Crowd Funding campaign and we've tried to balance it out so that every level has something fun, cool, or exciting in it for you our supporters! Take a look at each of the levels and contribute what you think you can afford to help us continue to grow and to expand. Note: Be sure to SCROLL DOWN because, we werent kidding, there are a TON of perks to choose from: Annual Mug Club Memberships, Founders Mug Memberships, Exclusive Backer T-Shirts and Swag...you can even give Dick at Tattoo or Shave Shawn's Beard if you are brave enough!
 

Stretch Goals

Crowler Machine

Our first "Stretch Goal" for when we break through the $10,000 funding goal is to finance the purchase of a 32oz Crowler Machine for the Woodinville Forge taproom. You'll be able to enjoy a recyclable 32oz can on the go just like at our founding location!

Additional stretch goals will be revealed as we approach different funding levels, so keep that support coming and stay tuned!



Risks & Challenges

We have already signed a lease and payment agreement for the Crucible Woodinville Forge. Its a done deal.The new brewery and taproom are going through no matter what! What we ask of you is that you support us now so that we can continue to grow at the pace of the demand of our beer. We also want to build the Woodinville taproom into the same kind of relaxed, comfortable, atmosphere that we currently enjoy in Everett. A home away from home. A neighborhood gathering spot.

Other Ways You Can Help

Crucible Brewing couldn't have gotten this far without your help. If you love Crucible and our beer, but cant afford to back us, thats OK, we totally understand! You can still help by spreading the word and getting the news out there:

  • Sharing our campaign and project with your friends and loved ones through social media and other channels.
  • Keep up with our progress and save the date. Bring your friends, families, and loved ones to the brewery and check out the new Woodinville Forge taproom and brewery when it opens this December!

Thank you so much for your help and support!

Sincerely,

Dick Mergens, Shawn Dowling, and the rest of the Crucible Brewing Crew!!!

story:
Have you ever wondered what the best model for the community
development is?

We found the answer!

The pledge of a prosperous and developing community is its members who don’t give up, don’t migrate, don’t fear to take an action and make a change.

"Community Development through Social Entrepreneurship" project has initiated a campaign aiming to raise money for at least 10 active members of the 7 regions of Armenia to start successful business projects and donate their profit to the social welfare of their communities.

The future social entrepreneurs have already received the necessary trainings to start and run successful social enterprises, but don’t have the complete funds to start up. 

The social impact of these 10 projects will not only reduce the unemployment and emigration, but will also address the environment, inclusion, cultural heritage, social security etc. These are vital issues for Armenia, as well as any other part of the world which faces such problems.

For the establishment and successful functioning of the social enterprises our change agents need seed money to start with. Each enterprise needs from $4,000 to $10,000 as presented in their business plans.

To make sure your contributions are used effectively professional business coaching and consulting services will be provided to the beginning entrepreneurs for the first six months after establishment of the enterprises.

Every dollar matters! You can choose to contribute the amount you wish.

We have prepared a nice and wide variety of perks to remind you about the deep gratitude of the beneficiaries and the great action you did to make Armenia better! So, if you wish, please pick a perk from the suggested list below. 

The successful realization of our campaign will be a perfect illustration and encouragement for all those enthusiasts throughout the world who

*believe in the idea and concept of social entrepreneurship

*concern about the future generations

*share the responsibility for the environment and the Nature

*ready to change the world!

  • Help us get connected! Spread a word through your social network channels.
  • Detailed information about these 10 projects and the team you can find  here.
  • Write to crowdfunding@se.center and get on board no matter on which side of the globe you live.

story:
Experiences vs. Products

Thank you for finding us on Indiegogo and helping us realize our dream! We are thrilled to be in the process of building Elevated Bouldering Center in Cody, Wyoming. The recent explosion of interest in Cody’s rich outdoor climbing possibilities has inspired this project by two entrepreneurial, outdoor-enthusiast, community advocates; Aaron and Kate Danforth.

We believe in this project whole-heartedly.  As Cody’s climbing culture and outdoor areas are being developed, Elevated Bouldering Center will be the ideal launch pad for your next climb. We want the bouldering center to be your “go-to” resource for planning your next rock climbing trip in our area.  For people visiting Cody, we want them to leave with a new appreciation and respect for the area and a memorable adventure they can share when they return home.  For locals, Elevated will be a space to train, collaborate, and introduce climbing to future generations. 

With your generosity, we will be able to fast-forward to the building phase.  The center will include fully padded bouldering areas for all skill levels, training space and an integrated slackline as well as a family & community room, and education lounge– Elevated is going to quickly grow into a place for the climbing community to convene; avid & new rock-climbers alike!

Why Indiegogo!?

We’re asking for a pretty large amount of money. We’re doing this for two huge reasons:  1) like you, we want this project up and running, and 100% complete, as fast as possible. 2) We want our community, other like-minded individuals, to be able to reap the rewards and share in our successes.

Our goal for this campaign is to raise the initial capital needed to fully transform a cold steel building into a well-lit, warm, climbable community space.

The breakdown of campaign funds we’re attempting to raise will be spent as follows:

  • 30% will be spent on padded flooring for all climbing rooms
  • 25% of funds asked will go toward completing heating & lighting for the building
  • As this space is predominantly a rock-climbing gym, the remaining 45% is needed for hand-holds, and wall construction!
  •  

Our Gifts to You!

If you chose to help us raise money, we will show our overwhelming thanks with gifts of gratitude! From fun little things to significant gear and parties, we are offering up the following perks to our generous benefactors!

  • Tee-Shirts and Stickers with our pretty sweet logo!
  • Day Passes (and even Year Passes) to the climbing gym!
  • Climbing gear like chalk bags and harnesses!
  • V.I.P. launch party!
  • Lifetime membership!

 

Why?

Ultimately, our goal is to weave education and recreation together, while providing access to diverse experiences throughout all four-seasons in Cody, Wyoming.

Not All Contributions Need to be $!

We are excited and thankful you’ve read this far. We are immensely grateful if you chose to donate to our vision. If you can’t, we’re very grateful for your interest – and we will need lots of volunteers for construction and route-setting.  Give us a shout and let us know if you are willing to help!

story:
First Shift

Have you ever thrown a party and you were the only person having to clean up the mess?

Have you ever been too tired or too hungover to cook and wished that someone would just bring food to you?

I know that I have definitely been in both of those situations; so I want to help you start your day off right.

We want to save you the hassle of cleaning up after parties and tailgates so you have more time to have fun with your friends and family.

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to operate properly and efficiently, we need your help to make sure that we have the best team and equipment that will be serving you. 

We need about $5,000 to help us get started, and there are perks that you can receive if you help us get funded. 

We have:

  • Stickers 

  • Koozies
     
  • T-shirts 


  • Breakfast (for two)

  • Cleaning Service

We will make sure that every dollar is spent on ensuring that we can create the best possible experience tailored just for you.

The Impact

We wholeheartedly believe that this is a service that will be life-changing to many people.

Sure, you can get other people to clean your home and deliver food to you, but we want to make sure that you feel 100% so you are able to do the things that you need to accomplish that day.

Risks & Challenges

Starting a business is difficult, and we will not be perfect when we launch; however, I will do everything I can to provide the highest-quality customer service possible. 

I have been in the service industry for many years, and I will use my experience to better serve you. Having said that, we will depend on your feedback in order for us to grow as a business.

Other Ways You Can Help

So you want to contribute but you're not in a position where you can. We get it.

You can still help us out by spreading the word about our business idea.  You can share this campaign with your friends and family, and follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to stay updated on the latest news about our campaign.

If you have any questions about what we wish to accomplish or what we can provide for you, visit us at www.firstshiftathens.com.

Thank you so much for your support! We hope to see you all soon!

story:
What is FostaParty? 

FostaParty is a nonprofit organization that specializes in children’s birthday parties. For every Sponsor Party we host for a paying customer, we throw one free Fosta Party for a child in the foster care system.

How it began 

In high school, our founder Khira Patel mentored a little girl who had been through the foster care system and was touched by her strength and resilience despite the adverse circumstances she had faced. This friendship is what sparked Khira’s passion to better the lives of foster children.

The Impact

There are over 424,000 children in the foster care system on a given day who are less likely to have a positive childhood experience due to the traumatic nature of their upbringing. By throwing them a birthday party, we help these kids create positive memories and a knowingness that they are not a burden, but are loved and valued by the people around them.

When someone hires FostaParty to plan their child’s birthday, the profits from the event provide a free party for a child in the foster care system. Through our one-for-one model, we help families not only have fun, stress-free, and tax-deductible events, but also extend their goodwill and bridge the gap between two different communities. We imagine a world in which all children have the opportunity to have a positive childhood experience. FostaParty does that by throwing events that celebrate life, connect communities, and cherish memories. 

Challenges

In the midst of a pandemic, throwing events can be challenging. FostaParty has been resilient to these changing environments and threw a virtual Fosta Party. We created an interactive experience by shipping a fully-decorated and themed box that included goody bags, decorations, presents, and a scrapbook to preserve memories for our Birthday Star. 

We understand that we are working with a community that requires deep care and sensitivity. Navigating the intricacies of CPS can be time-consuming, but we are working to build our relationships with case workers and local agencies to ensure we are serving the families, children, and foster community in the best way possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

FostaParty is also seeking connections to corporate sponsors and grant opportunities to enable our organization to grow rapidly and serve the foster community as best we can.

Please feel free to follow our Instagram @fostaparty to stay up to date with our fundraising and party planning efforts! If you know anyone that would be interested in throwing an event with us, refer them to our website and send us an inquiry email to fostaparty@gmail.com.

story:
Our Story

We are two brothers who live in Copenhagen, Denmark. One works as an animator and compositor and the other as a video director and editor. Even though we took a more artistic route than the rest of our engineer family, we have always had a love for constructing things: everything from Legos to video equipment such as dollytracks, skatedollys and glidecams. When we discovered 3D printing through the RepRap Project we realized that this technology would allow us to design things, and make a difference on a much bigger scale. We started to look for attainable goals, and for the last 6 months we have been working on our first project; the Kontinuum Garden.

What is a Rotating Garden?

The Kontinuum Garden is a hydroponic garden. It's a highly efficient rotating flood & drain system (see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroponics#Ebb_and_flow_or_flood_and_drain_sub-irrigation) that lets you grow fresh vegetables, fruits, herbs and even flowers in the comfort of your own home. It is easy to use, has minimal water consumption, produces high yields on a minimal area, and all without getting your hands dirty.

You can put them in your garage, home or perhaps a school. You could even get together with others in your community, designate an empty store, a building or an entire area to set up a place where everyone has free access to hydroponic food.

The Kontinuum Garden is our original design but of course we are familiar with the other designs that are on the market such as the Volksgarden, the RotoGro System, and the B-Pod etc. However, none of these gardens come with lights whereas the Kontinuum Garden comes complete with a high-efficiency LED system. We will also include a motor, pump, fan and everything else you need to fully assemble the garden.

The Plan

Our plan consists of four steps:

  1. Build a regular-sized 3D printer. COMPLETED
  2. Use the regular-sized 3D printer to print the pieces for a large 1x1 meter 3D printer.
  3. Design, print and assemble 3 Kontinuum Gardens.
  4. Testing; food, different types of plants and growth-media, and release our data to the open-source community.

Why Make it Open Source?

We believe that a combined effort yields a better product. The concept of Open Source allows others to become inspired, and make their own changes and upgrades. Undoubtedly someone will get an idea to make the garden more efficient, and in the long run, we will all benefit from it.

Also, we believe that these types of technical solutions should be freely accessible as a basic human right. Believing you can own an idea is an illusion. Your idea is built on the common knowledge of mankind, and the minute you share your idea with other people, they own it too.

When this project is completed we will set up a webshop and sell the Kontinuum Garden online. However, anyone will be able to find the designs and instruction for free online and build the printer and garden themselves from scratch.

What We Need

If we reach our goal of $8,000, $2,000 will go to parts for the big printer (including motors, hotend, heatbed, structural metal, bearings, electronics etc.) and the other $6,000 will go to 3 fully functional Kontinuum Gardens (including plastic, motor, fan, LED system etc.)

If we fall short of the $8,000 goal, we will scale down the initial project and instead only print 1 or 2 gardens depending on the amount we do raise.

The Goal

The campaign goal is to print 3 fully functional gardens. We intend to test the potential of one of them ourselves and send the other two out for testing under various circumstances. One will go to a retired agricultural engineer, and the other to a small family. This will provide us with important growth data as well as feedback about what works and what needs revision to make it user-friendly to as many people as possible.

What You Get

Perks of course include our deepest gratitude but also supporter and sponsor titles, or how about your name forever engraved in the Kontinuum Garden prototype? You can also get your name printed on one of the growth boxes which will then be shipped to your home when we finish testing. You can even be the first person to own a Kontinuum Garden. Apart from the initial 3 gardens we intend to make, 2 additional gardens will be available as perks, complete with LED system, motor, pump etc. for you to put together yourself. We will of course make a free instructional video that you can view online.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Share our campaign video on facebook!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Please help us change the way people think about food.

 

Thank you for your support!

Jeppe & Mads

 

Links

www.reprap.org/wiki/kontinuumreprap

www.thingiverse.com/kontinuumprints

www.facebook.com/kontinuumprints

story:
Jan 21, 2011,

      Hello from Ghana! 


The time is up! Thank you to all of you who donated, and all of you who passed this link along. This fund-raiser was a big success, and we will begin work on the projects right away.


We are currently in Accra, the capital of Ghana, about to set off for Tapko this week. The widows of Tapko are ready for us and excited to begin work on the projects. We will begin building beds for the dry-season farming right away, and shortly after will begin planting the acacia trees. They are prepared to water everything by hand for the remainder of the dry season until April or May. 


If the funds are sufficient, we will help the women purchase the grinding mill asap. If not, some friends in Canada have agreed to help raise a little more so that we will have enough to purchase it before we leave the country in a few months.


If you would still like to donate, but missed the dead-line on here, email us at tapko.collective@gmail.com.


Once again, thank you all for donating. We will keep you updated on the progress of the projects.


      Greg and Fabienne



The Tapko Widow's Collective is a group of over 70 women living in the village of Tapko, in northwest Ghana, who are dedicated to creating sustainable and empowering solutions to poverty in their community. An entirely grassroots, village-organized group, they have identified specific needs and goals to continue their process toward self-sufficiency. In 2003 the collective began selling direct-trade Shea butter to supply Tapko with a sustainable source of income. Since then they have purchased health care and school supplies.


      The Widow's Collective is currently raising funds for three projects which, along with the Shea butter income, will provide them with increased economic and environmental stability:

        1. Acacia Tree Planting - In northwest Ghana, people rely on firewood for cooking. In some villages Shea trees are being cut down, as a last resort, for firewood. Since Tapko relies on Shea trees to make and sell Shea butter, the villagers do not want this trend to take root in their community. To conserve Shea trees, the community plans to purchase and plant 5000 Acacia trees. Acacia is a robust variety which survives in desert climates, grows quickly,and can be cut for firewood 3 years after planting. 

        2. Grinding Mill - They plan to purchase a grinding mill which will allow them to grind Shea more efficiently, as well as process food crops, such as millet and corn.

        3. Dry Season Farming - People in nearby regions of Ghana have developed methods of growing more food during the long dry season using container gardening, improved water storage, and drought resistant plant varieties. Tapko would like to buy seeds and equipment in order to begin applying dry farming techniques in their community. They would also like to bring someone to the village who is experienced with these methods of agriculture.


     The funds we raise will be entirely used by the Tapko Widow's Collective to work on these 3 projects. $3000 is our goal, but by raising more than $3000 the people of Tapko will be able to plant more Acacia trees, an act which will protect the region's Shea. From January through June 2011 we will be traveling to Ghana to work with the people of Tapko as these initiatives are carried out.


Unfortunately, we are unable to offer tax receipts for donations at this point. To do so, we would need to be a registered non profit, which neither us or the Widows' Collective officially are.


Thank you for supporting people making locally-inspired change,

Fabienne and Greg

story:
Help 8 People Bring Street Vending Back to Boyle Heights!

 Our Streets, Our Jobs!


We love our Street vendors!... & we hope you do too!

 

The East LA Community Corporation (ELACC) is working with local street vendors in Boyle Heights to raise funds to create an Evening Farmerâ€™s Market in Boyle Heights.  ELACCâ€™s mission is to advocate for economic and social justice in Boyle Heights and East LA by leading grassroots efforts towards self-sufficiency and access to brighter economic opportunities for the residents.

 

Why?  Vendors have been a staple of the Boyle Heights history and culture for decades. However, they were displaced by police over a year ago.   Boyle Heightsâ€™ vendors created a grassroots community market, where residents could enjoy delicious street food and local culture.  After ten years in operation, it was shut down by police.

 

Now, ELACC is reviving the spirit of this Market through the creation of the Boyle Heights Evening Farmers Market. These 8 vendors and many more worked tirelessly with ELACC to garner support within City Council for the Farmerâ€™s Market Pilot Program.   This puts the vendorsâ€™ vision that much closer to the grand opening of the market.

 

Right now, thousands of street food vendors throughout Los Angeles have no legal protections to earn their living.   This market is a crucial first step to legalizing and regulating street vending in Boyle Heights. So they won't have to worry about police coming for them. Street vending is one of the few ways that folks in our community can work to support their families.  

 

These 8 vendors want to operate in a legitimate farmers market.  But they need new equipment that meets health dept. requirements. Right now, they are working hard on saving their money but they need your help.  This is where we can all pitch in to transform lives!  

 

ELACC and the vendors are asking for your support to help the vendors get closer to realizing their vision!!

 

How it works

We use the pay-it-forward model.  The money that you donate to ELACC is 100% tax deductible and will go beyond these 8 vendors.  We plan to grow this program to reach at least 30 more vendors in the community. Each vendor needs $1,875 to go legit. To bring them to the finish line, we need $15,000.

The startup costs total approximately $1,875 per vendor. Hereâ€™s what it gets them:

-              Food Certification 

-              Kitchen rental for preparation of food

-              Health Permits

-              Insurance 

-              Farmers market rental space 

-              Equipment 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Repost this information on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and any other social media site. Connect with us, support, and come grub out at our farmers market in Boyle Heights!

story:
My Story

For the past ten years, I have offered acupuncture, chinese medicine, and nutritional counseling to the good people of Los Angeles.  If you have had treatment from me, you know my passion for chinese medicine and its capacity to help people.  I have reached a point in my career where I want to own and operate my own office.  I just need seed money to purchase equipment and pay a few months' rent.  I have no doubt that the day I open my doors, I will have a steady stream of clientele, both new and former.  It's just the initial investment, that in the immediate, seems elusive.  That is why I am turning to all of you and humbly requesting support.


The Impact

I am going to open a small clinic that is more centrally-located so that I may serve more people. This will mean less driving for you westsiders. I will operate this clinic myself meaning more privacy for my current clientele.


What We Need & What You Get

When you donate to my endeavor, I will match your donation dollar for dollar in acupuncture sessions in my new clinic.  Here is what that means for you:


A first session with me is $125.  So if you donate $125, you get an initial session which is an evaluation, acupuncture and email support.

A follow-up session with me is $80.  So if you donate $80 (or in increments of $80) you get a follow-up session(s) with email support.

A series of cosmetic acupuncture is $1,100 for ten sessions.  So if you donate $1,100, you get 10 sessions of cosmetic acupuncture and email support.


So really, it's a win-win!  Obviously, you will need to live in Los Angeles to benefit in the dollar for dollar offer.


If you wish to donate $5, I will receive it with tremendous heartfelt thanks.  If you live in other parts of the world, I will not be able to honor the dollar for dollar offer but you will have the satisfaction of knowing that you created something really meaningful and beautiful in my life.  And for that, I extend my deepest gratitude.

story:
Our Story

Greetings! My Name is Volante, and i've been working hard for the past month to get my dream to become a reality. I'm searching out every possibility to achieve this goal. Currently, i've found a fantastic opportunity to expand my network, learn more about doing business as a woman and as an added bonus, get to have fun while doing so.


The Impact

The main reason for this campaign is to help support my family. - long term. I need this business to work so that i can keep a roof over my family's head and food on the table.


What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $2500 - this will help me pay for an Airline ticket to the conference i'm working to attend, the hotel for the weekend, as well as money to 'live off' while there. It'll also give me a cushion for paying the bills for home and work while building this business. On My blog The Wandering Gypsie (http://thewanderinggypsie.com/?page_id=56) i've created a page for helping me get to this Convention. Yes, Blogalicious '12 is directed at women in social media who are trying to expand their knowledge. **Founded in 2009, the Blogalicious Weekend conferences are aimed at celebrating the diversity of women of all ethnicities in social media. Over the course of 3 event-filled days, savvy, influential and talented women (and a few men!) bloggers will re-ignite a sense of unity within the multicultural blogging community. We'll also connect with marketers who recognize the importance of our demographic in todayâ€™s marketplace, all while networking, building relationships, and promoting inspiration and success for each other.** 

Helping me to reach this goal is giving my family & business a better chance at being the best it can be. And eventually not living lest than check to check.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help me by supporting http://www.beyondthewillows.com web store. Buy something or share it with your friends.

story:
We are three students from Nepal, the Netherlands and South Africa who are taking part in the International Youth Initiative Program (YIP) in Sweden, a one year training program in social entrepreneurship.

 

Part of our curriculum is a one month long international internship for which we have chosen to go to Bolivia.

 

We are completely fascinated by Bolivia because of its unique position in world: Bolivia is one of the richest countries in the world in minerals and energy resources and yet it is one of South Americaâ€™s poorest and least developed countries. Bolivia is also a country with the highest percentage of indigenous population in Latin America but the only one with an Aymara Indian, Evo Morales as the first indigenous president elected to office. What helped us connect to this beautiful country of contradictions is Maria Mercado, an amazing young Bolivian woman who attended YIP last year with the support of a Swedish organization called SOFIA. After the course,  Maria went back to her home country to use her newly acquired skills and knowledge to continue her work with Kawsay, a non-governmental organization that works on the reaffirmation of indigenous heritage.

 

Kawsay was founded in 1999 as a Native Cultural Center and today is completely run by the Bolivian people. The intention of Kawsay is to strengthen the processes of reaffirming the identity of indigenous people through training and provision of spaces that help spread knowledge and invigorate the principles and values of the native Bolivian indigenous culture. Kawsay works as a facilitator for communities to reassess their cultural techniques and visions on life within different areas such as agriculture, education, indigenous rights and environmental caretaking.

The question that Kawsay is facing right now is how in the 21st century do you incorporate traditional wisdom that is part of the indigenous culture in a world that seems to strive to be more â€œwesternâ€ every single day. Maria, with her strong indigenous roots along with her year abroad in Sweden works with this question on an individual level everyday and this we believe is also an important question of the time we live in â€“ how do we as a human civilization march ahead into the future with the wisdom of the past?  

 

In order to answer this question from multiple dimensions, we will be working in 3 different areas:

 

Pedagogy â€“ We will work with the children at the Cusicuna Green School in Cochabamba that is connected to KAWSAY. Cusicuna is an alternative school for children with philosophy similar to Waldorf education but with the incorporation of indigenous wisdom. We will be working with this philosophy to understand how children are taught in the Bolivian context. 

Agriculture â€“ Kawsay supports farms and families in Cochabamba that have an intention of farming in a sustainable way with the integration of local knowledge... We are very thrilled to have this opportunity to work in the land with the Bolivian farmers to understand their relationship with food, the land and nature. As a two-prong approach to understanding their agricultural/food system, we will be working in the land as well as taking interviews of the farmers to understand their stories. 

Culture & Arts â€“ Kawsay has an extensive arts and culture program that strives in keeping traditions alive through exchanges between different communities. We plan to be a part of these exchanges by helping facilitate these processes and understand what culture and tradition means to them today.

Outside of these three areas, we hope that this exchange will strengthen the exchange of knowledge and support between YIP, SOFIA and KAWSAY - 3 incredible organizations which all stand for positive social change!

 

There are several ways that we are aiming on documenting this experience. We are going to keep a blog (which we are currently setting up) where we will post regular updates of our learnings, the sights we encounter, the people we meet, the work we are doing as well as the beauty that is Bolivia. We hope that you will be able to support our vision and mission in some way!

 

Please Click "Add to Favourite" to help us make a noise and get the campaign seen

Share with Friends to help spread the word

Contribute and help us reach our goal

story:
Intro

My name is Tami C. I am the owner of IMENA inc. a hair and beauty business located in Harlem New York. I am also a graduate of the Hunter College School of Social Work program, MSW with a concentration in mental health.

Imena is a beauty company that strives to provide services that promote healthy hair in an atmosphere that values customer service and education. IMENA promotes all forms of beauty from the most popular styles like blow drying and roller sets, to natural hair styles like locs and braids.

Part of our mission is to help women find and become comfortable with their personal style and to help them learn how to showcase their individual beauty. While the goal is healthy hair, the ultimate goal is to promote greater self esteem and inner beauty by highlighting one's outer beauty.

With your contribution, you will be helping us create an atmosphere where ALL women can come and get great service and learn how to take care of their hair.

We specialize in helping women through the "transitioning" process. A process where women who have worn their hair straight are inspired, many for the first time, to wear their natural hair in it's natural state. Our mission is to help women find and get comfortable with showcasing their individual beauty.  We understand that this can be a short or long journey and we will be there to help them along the way.

This campaign is extremely important in our journey to making this salon a reality. We have already started contruction. We just need a little more help.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help us create an atmosphere of learning and support for the women who visit our salon. Specifically, your funds will go toward completing contruction costs, setting up the salon, and producing a marketing campaign to let the public know we are here.

We are going to raise $6,000. We want to say thank you in a very special way to all our contributors. Here's how:

Pledge $50 - Get a $10 gift card, plus your name will be listed in the thank you section of our website

Pledge $100 - Get a $25 gift card to be used on any full price hair service of your choice and be listed in the thank you section of our website.

Pledge $250 - Get a $50 gift card to be used on any full price hair service of your choice and be listed in the thank you section of our website, plus receive a free copy of our film BEAUTIFUL: The Documentary / A short film on what it means to women of color to wear their hair in it's natural state in this society.

Pledge $500 or more - Get a $100 gift card to be used on any full price hair service of your choice and be listed in the thank you section of our website, plus receive a free copy of our film BEAUTIFUL: The Documentary. 

The Impact

This salon is needed in our community. A place where all women can feel appreciated and valued regardless of their hair type. By creating this space, we as a community create self worth and self esteem in our women and young girls. Empowerment is key!!  We will also host panel discussions and special events that promote beauty, integrity and self worth in women of all colors, shapes and hair textures.

In addition to being a great source of support and a hair resource for women, we will be giving back a portion of our proceeds every year to different community organizations. So your contribution not only helps IMENA, it allows us to help the community! THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR PLEDGE!! Evey dollar helps!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please be sure to help us get the word out by using the indiegogo sharing tools and post this campaign on your facebook, twitter and other social media pages. Thanks so much!
 
Visit us online at www.imenainc.com

story:
Our Story

My name is Scott Schipper and I am a 27 year old musician from California's Northern Bay Area. In mid November of 2011 I was diagnosed with colon cancer of the colon and liver. I play in a national touring reggae band named "Thrive". I took a step back and realized how many people can be reached when your playing in front of 100's to 1,000's of people every night and over the internet. Inspired by my bandmates, family and friends I decided to start a movement to stop cancer named, "Unify to Thrive". Unify to Thrive is a non-profit organization that raises money for the children at St. Judes Hospital for Children. Me being so young and having a type of cancer that is usually only found in older men is the reason I decided to reach out to the children. The children in our society are the most important thing of all to me. Seeing a child suffer is the one thing that really chokes me up most since I have been battling cancer. Knowing that a 1 month year old child is in pain and not able to tell his/her parents. It is just tragic. No parent should ever see their child out live them in this day and age. Unify to Thrive is also a clothing line. That is how we have been raising money for the children thus far. At www.unifytothrive.com you can order a full line of apparel and 100% of the profits go straight to the children at St. Judes. 

The Impact

I play in a musical scene where with all the bands combined there are over 2 million friends on facebook available at the click of a button. With that many people reached at the click of a button the chance for success is guaranteed! This campaign is geared to success only. Is only raising 2000$ when the goal is 5000$ a failure? Heck no! Every dollar counts in this campaign. Every dollar that helps a child is a dollar well spent. No if ands or buts.


What We Need & What You Get

I am raising money to make Unify to Thrive be heard at an international level. When I say heard I dont just mean the name, I mean the music. Music heals and so do the repercussions of people coming together for a great cause. I am raising money to record, print and press a reggae album. This album will be comprised of some of the best, well known reggae artists and bands in America. Reggae bands and artists with hundreds of thousands of fans coming together to record on an an album that will have all its profits donated to St. Judes Hospital for Children. If I do not reach my goal I will not give up. I will continue to sell Unify To Thrive apparel and contribute all the profits to St. Judes Hospital for Children. I will keep going until I make this goal a reality.


Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone visit www.unifytothrive.com and check out the apparel you can buy. You can buy something you can be stylish in and still make a contribution to a great cause. Wearing a piece of clothing that reminds you of a cause that is helping save childrens lives makes it all the sweeter. Spread the Unify to Thrive promo video and get everyone involved with musiic and a cause that saves lives!

I am raising money to make Unify to Thrive be heard at an international level. When I say heard I dont just mean the name, I mean the music. Music heals and so do the repercussions of people coming together for a great cause. I am raising money to record, print and press a reggae album. This album will be comprised of some of the best, well known reggae artists and bands in America. Reggae bands and artists with hundreds of thousands of fans coming together to record on an an album that will have all its profits donated to St. Judes Hospital for Children. If I do not reach my goal I will not give up. I will continue to sell Unify To Thrive apparel and contribute all the profits to St. Judes Hospital for Children. I will keep going until I make this goal a reality.


Other Ways You Can Help
Everyone visit www.unifytothrive.com and check out the apparel you can buy. You can buy something you can be stylish in and still make a contribution to a great cause. Wearing a piece of clothing that reminds you of a cause that is helping save childrens lives makes it all the sweeter. Spread the Unify to Thrive promo video and get everyone involved with musiic and a cause that saves lives!

story:
For centuries, people of African descent have been colonized and controlled by a Eurocentric system based on untruths. We have been deceived and stripped of our majestic identity. We have been misled, leaving us to believe in a hierarchal system in which Black is inferior. We have been miseducated.

It is the mission of theBLACKproject to reeducate ALL people by revealing the truth behind both our history and our current social standing. We promote Black Consciousness and Black Nationalism as a means to bring true power into the Black community. But first, we must decolonize our minds.

The Impact

By presenting true historical information, fostering critical discussion, and implementing hands-on community service projects, we will positively impact Black communities nationwide.

What We Need & What You Get

theBLACKproject's Board of Directors has estimated the start up costs for this organization to be around $2,500. These funds will go towards legalizing theBLACKproject as a legitimate non profit organization, ensuring that we have a quality website for video hosting, implementing community service programs, and providing merchandise for members. Even the smallest donation will help us reach our goals for reaching you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to donate, please spread the word!! It is important to have as many people involved as possible!

story:
This is Nicholas...

                 

Nicholas has a dream to be in the community workplace someday just like his big brothers and sister.

 

Sadly, Nicholas' future is one of being isolated with little chance of escaping the dreariness of a sheltered workshop

The Nicholas Project will  provide the skills, opportunity, and the environment to enable Nicholas, and hundreds of others also, to live their dreams out.

 

The Nicholas Project provides a real business for Nicholas, and other intellectually disabled individuals. This business, and eventually businesses,  will give these individuals real jobs in a real business and help them to learn life skills, feel true independence, and create lasting friendships within the community. Most programs for intellectually disabled people place them into isolation. The Nicholas Project includes them into society.

 

While most of us take our skills, knowledge, and jobs for granted, Nicholas dreams of just a fraction of the opportunities we are given in our daily life.  With each dollar you fund to the The Nicholas Project, those dreams are one step closer to becoming a reality. 

 

With the funds raised from generous individuals like you, The Nicholas Project will be able to purchase a small food truck/trailer, which costs around $17,000.  This food truck will provide the much needed jobs for the intellectually and developmentally disabled individuals who take pride in their hard-work and service to the community.  While the first food truck/trailer continues to raise money, The Nicholas Project will grow as well into more  food trucks, pet services, used bookstores, theaters, etc.  At The Nicholas Project we are not creating one business, but businesses for countless individuals in our community and others too.

Thank you for your time and we can't wait to see your smiling faces when you visit us at our first food truck/trailer  in the near future.

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

To learn more about The Nicholas Project please read the article below, provided by The Nicholas Project's founder, Bruce Bussell:

 

The Nicholas Project - A Real Business for Intellectually Disabled Individuals

There are a great many programs out there for training people who are disabled, but one group of disabled people are often overlooked. The intellectually disabled are often placed into workshops where they sit around tables with dozens of others and shred paper with their hands or stuff envelopes.  If they are lucky, they may be chosen to put together a simple product such as ceiling sprinklers designed for fire protection.  It is rare that any of these programs place the disabled trainees side by side with non-disabled peers. Because of that, socialization among the trainees is very poor and often leads to conflict. Not quite the life anyone dreams of achieving.

The saddest thing is that these people are often trained in school vocational programs that are very good and give the students a feeling of belonging and worth. Losing their place in those programs when they graduate can have a sudden and awful affect on the individuals and is often followed by a marked increase in depression. Parents often talk of how their children had such a love of life until they graduated and entered some of these sheltered workshops. I have had parents tell me that the change in their children was so significant that they felt helpless in trying to help them.  This program offers the help that many of these parents so badly need.

I have worked with intellectually disabled students for 31 years. I know they can do so much more than society thinks they can. I have seen it first hand with many students and now with my wonderful son Nicholas.  Intellectually disabled individuals can hold productive and meaningful jobs when given proper training.  Sure, some of these jobs are jobs the average non-disabled person would probably scoff at, such as stocking shelves, bussing tables, etc. but that is much more challenging and satisfying to them than simply shredding paper.  The great thing about getting these people in jobs like I am describing is that intellectually disabled individuals will almost always love their jobs and take great pride in them. They never complain about the job being boring, too hard, or really anything else that would be negative. You give an intellectually disabled person a job like these, train them right and you will have an employee for years. Turnover will not be an issue in a position that, in the past, has exceedingly high turnover among non-disabled employees. The best part is that these people will no longer be isolated, but will instead be a valued member of the workforce.

My son, Nicholas, has Down Syndrome and Autism. He is a good worker but will always need supports to work and be a productive member of society.  Most individuals with disabilities like Nic's end up, after graduation from high school, working in those shelters I described earlier.  They sit around all day and shred paper by hand, stuff envelopes, and receive little to no interaction with others.  It is no wonder that most of them are so lifeless when you visit these workshops. It hurts me deeply to see the students I had, who were full of life and seemed to have such a carefree life, become so detached from life and society when they enter these workshops after graduating from high school.

Nic is 15 years old and will be entering the school's vocational training program soon. It is important to him that he has a real job, a job that this project would create, during his vocational training program so that he can experience real work environments instead of sitting at a table tearing paper. That is why we, at The Nicholas Project, want to have the flagship part of the project up and running by Summer 2013. It can be used with more students, or graduates, who need training too. This real world training program, which will give the people working in it real wages, can provide individual skills to each trainee that can help level out the playing field for them.  It is also a great way to foster inclusion as non-disabled workers will need to work in the business so that the disabled people can better learn acceptable work skills.

We believe that people with intellectual disabilities can work in a small business such as a shaved ice business.  Nic loves to keep things organized and loves to clean also. These are jobs that he would be thrilled to have and would take great pride in. Many other cognitively disabled people would do well in this job too and will be given the same chance Nic gets.

We are hoping to gain the funding for one shaved ice trailer and entire business set-up such as the one from Frigid Frog, here in Texas.  After getting this one trailer up and running, I believe that the business will profit enough to purchase a second unit so that more disabled individuals will be able to enter the program and receive training and wages.  

Although the first business in this project will be a shaved ice business, other businesses created with profits could be a food truck, a small hamburger joint, a janitorial service, a pet service or kennel, etc.  The important aspect is that cognitively disabled individuals that would normally be "warehoused" into shelters will be trained for real world jobs.  They can stay in the business as long as it takes for them to find a job elsewhere.  They may even end up in the business they trained in permanently.

After succeeding here in Lubbock, I hope to create a non-profit company helping people nationwide follow this model.  I will create a book, or manual, describing exactly how to do what we did and, with the profits created as well as sponsorship from people who will see just how amazing this project is, we will be able to provide seed money for those people to start a business too. I know this will work. It could help thousands of people but I need the funding for only the first trailer and business.

Less than $20,000 can create a project that can help thousands and generate millions of dollars without government funding. All we need is the seed money to get this project started. Once I prove that these individuals can be given lives that are meaningful, the profits and the private sponsorships will provide the funding for so many others.  

What We Need and Why

As you can see in the link below,  the trailer , shaved ice machine, and the flavor package costs $16,790. After the fees, the total funded amount is a little less than what is needed, but I will come up with that amount locally. 

You can see what is provided by Frigid Frog in this link. 

We hope to get this trailer up and running by Spring 2013 and save the profits from all of our hard-work and buy a second trailer and a third and so on.  Shaved Ice businesses are very profitable as the entire cost of making a sno-cone is about 35 or 40 cents and sell for up to $3 or $4.  Many weekend events such as parades or fairs can create a huge profit trail while putting our hard-working individuals to work, which will enable pride and joy in their work.  I know my son will thrive.

I have been a special education teacher for 31 years and have professionally worked with disabled individuals long before Nicholas entered my life.  Having him changed my life for the better.  I see how talented he is but it is not easy for others to see these special abilities, how much joy he receives from working and from pleasing others when he does good work.  I have job-coached disabled students and know that the opportunities are not readily available in our communities.  This project will start out small and grow into a huge national program that can be copied in every community across the country.

The Impact

This small trailer can create hundreds of copy-cat businesses for other individuals who have disabilities and who can work productively when given the opportunity instead of being pushed aside and forgotten.

Many parents of a child like mine will tell you that they dread the day their child graduates from high school because the options for a real job are extremely slim. This project can grow to being something that puts hope out there for others.

A Bonus for You

There are a couple of perks for you when you graciously fund The Nicholas Project. The perks are listed on the right side of this page. Talented Creative Design Team Leader Brandon Bussell has created an awesome and very recognizable shirt for all those people who choose that perk. I will also send you a newsletter keeping you abreast of how this whole project grows so that you can see what a huge difference you helped make.

 Here is a link to The Nicholas Projects's Blog.  You can read more about how your funding of this one business will impact thousands of others.

story:
The Anywhere Alarm is a great invention that will change how people protect themselves, their families and their property. The Anywhere Alarm is an inexpensive, small, portable, simple to use alarm system that gives everybody a little more comfort and security.

If the Anywhere Alarm prevents one act of violence in a hotel or motel, prevents one child from consuming liquor, poisons or paint, prevents one teen from playing with Dad’s power tools or guns, it will all be worth it.

The Anywhere Alarm is armed by removing the unique electronic key. It will then sound the alert siren (100dB) if moved in any direction. It can be used to protect against entry from the outside: on doors, windows, gates, etc. The Anywhere Alarm also keeps people out of unauthorized inside places: medicine cabinets, under the kitchen sink, paint lockers, gun cabinets, private papers, closets, power tools, etc. Or, less critically, it can be used to keep little brother out of little sister’s room, and vice versa.

The Anywhere Alarm works for everyone, from children to senior citizens, at  the office and at home. Use it to protect bicycles, cars, lawnmowers, garden tools, tool sheds. Use it at college on your computer or to protect your dorm room. 

The Anywhere Alarm Intruder Alert System is easy to use because all the thinking is done by an on board computer. Many security devices wind up too complicated. Home security systems have expensive monthly payments, require sophisticated installation, hard to remember passwords and procedures for arming and disarming. With the Anywhere Alarm, there are no switches, no settings. Just pull out the unique key, place it where you want it and it will arm itself.

The Anywhere Alarm was designed to be small, lightweight and easy to carry with you. More than 70% of American overseas travelers are women. When they are staying in hotels abroad, they can be targets for violence or theft. The Anywhere Alarm protects anyone who travels. It needs no external power. No transformers. No strange plugs. The built in battery will last for at least 3 years. It can give you that extra measure of protection against theft or violence.

The Anywhere Alarm is moving forward. The funds being raised are for manufacturing units and to produce a series of commercials to be aired nationally.

I have tremendous confidence that the Anywhere Alarm will help many people throughout the world. I believe in this invention.
 
I will be happy to keep you informed all the way.

 

The Anywhere Alarm was created to protect you, your family and mine. Let’s bring this wonderful invention to people everywhere.

Help as much as you can. Besides contributing, help get the word out and make some noise about this program. Especially use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you very much for your help.

story:
My beautiful wife and I survived a tornado last year, 4 months after she immigrated to the US. My wife is an academy trained theatrical actress who, due to circumstance has been unable to act since arriving in the U.S.  I spent 2 years working towards her immigration.

I sacrificed everything for her, only to lose my job 4 months later, and lose it all a month later when the tornado struck Huntsville (we sold everything we own to survive this past summer).

We relocated to FL after I accepted a new job that unfortunately furloughed 8 weeks later. We ended up on food stamps, in emergency housing for the following 3 months, while I looked for work.  We did what we had to do to survive.

I then landed a new (temp 4 month) contract, and only recently accepted another position with benefits (finally). I have worked incredibly hard for the past 6 months, only to make ends meet. I'm a little tired, but I will not rest.  It has been a hard climb back, and its been relatively unstable due to unfortunate circumstance, and the nature of my work (Govt).

We are off our butts, and now on our toes, in that we finally have a car and apartment - now it's time to get firmly on our feet.

My humble request to you all...  We need furniture (everything, bed, sofa, etc) house-wares, everything for a home, as we are starting completely from scratch.

Everything I do, I do for my divine wife. I want to see my wife on stage, or in a film in my lifetime. I owe her this! She deserves so much more than I have been able to provide in my own efforts, but that will not stop my continued drive and passion to show her what the true American experience is all about.
