story:
What is Sugartooth Tours?

Sugartooth Tours is a new dessert tasting tour launching in the late fall of 2012 in Manhattan. On our food tours, our licensed NYC tour guides take a group through a neighborhood giving historical and a culinary background to the city and specific neighborhoods while tasting some of the best local sweets.

Our tours are special because we are dedicated to serving the sweet-tooth in everyone! We seek to provide the best customer experience through high quality tastings, superior customer service, and friendly and informed tour guides.

Meet the Owners:

Co-owners Allyson Tolbert and Sarah Rolleston come from a theatrical background. After getting their degrees at the University of Florida and Ithaca College (respectively) they both performed in multiple national Broadway tours. One could say that they ate their way across the United States and Canada while touring with the shows, searching out the best local foods in each city, and often going on food tours. Now back in New York City, they have decided to share their love of food, specifically the sweet stuff, with the rest of the world. 

About Culinary Tourism:

Culinary tourism is defined as experiencing the food of a country, region, or area, and is quickly becoming one of the most popular ways to explore a city. Not only is tourism in New York City on the rise, but culinary tourism is on the rise all across the United States and the entire world. One of the great aspects of culinary tourism is that it appeals not only to tourists, but also to locals. The rise of the foodie-culture in New York City makes this especially true in our great city. 

How You Can Help:

We are seeking to raise $4000. With this money we can:

  • become a legal entity
  • launch our website
  • become licensed NYC tour guides
  • purchase promotional materials
  • pay for our first year of insurance costs
  • cover other miscellaneous costs such as office supplies. 

We have great incentives at a variety of donation levels and you can see them all on the right side of this page. 

We hope that you are as excited and passionate about our business as we are, and we hope that you will help us get Sugartooth Tours get off the ground by making a donation today. Donations of even $1 are helpful. Even if you are unable to donate, you can help us by spreading the word and passing along our information. Be sure to keep up with our progress by following us on twitter @SugartoothTours, on facebook, and right here on indiegogo.com as well. 

Thank you!!
story_txt:
What is Sugartooth Tours?
Sugartooth Tours is a new dessert tasting tour launching in the late fall of 2012 in Manhattan. On our food tours, our licensed NYC tour guides take a group through a neighborhood giving historical and a culinary background to the city and specific neighborhoods while tasting some of the best local sweets.
Our tours are special because we are dedicated to serving the sweet-tooth in everyone! We seek to provide the best customer experience through high quality tastings, superior customer service, and friendly and informed tour guides.
Meet the Owners:
Co-owners Allyson Tolbert and Sarah Rolleston come from a theatrical background. After getting their degrees at the University of Florida and Ithaca College (respectively) they both performed in multiple national Broadway tours. One could say that they ate their way across the United States and Canada while touring with the shows, searching out the best local foods in each city, and often going on food tours. Now back in New York City, they have decided to share their love of food, specifically the sweet stuff, with the rest of the world. 
About Culinary Tourism:
Culinary tourism is defined as experiencing the food of a country, region, or area, and is quickly becoming one of the most popular ways to explore a city. Not only is tourism in New York City on the rise, but culinary tourism is on the rise all across the United States and the entire world. One of the great aspects of culinary tourism is that it appeals not only to tourists, but also to locals. The rise of the foodie-culture in New York City makes this especially true in our great city. 
How You Can Help:
We are seeking to raise $4000. With this money we can:

become a legal entity
launch our website
become licensed NYC tour guides
purchase promotional materials
pay for our first year of insurance costs
cover other miscellaneous costs such as office supplies. 

We have great incentives at a variety of donation levels and you can see them all on the right side of this page. 
We hope that you are as excited and passionate about our business as we are, and we hope that you will help us get Sugartooth Tours get off the ground by making a donation today. Donations of even $1 are helpful. Even if you are unable to donate, you can help us by spreading the word and passing along our information. Be sure to keep up with our progress by following us on twitter @SugartoothTours, on facebook, and right here on indiegogo.com as well. 
Thank you!!

story:
Be a Part of Bringing the Newest Innovation in 

People Powered Transportation to     

   Downtown Denver Summer 2012!!!!



Who We Are And What We're Doing

 

My name is Nick Phillips and Iâ€™m bringing downtown Denver itâ€™s newest source for luxury transportation. Carrying somewhere between 8-12 passengers, the People Powered Limo is the best way for downtown Denver guests to get from the bar to bar. The People Powered Limo is designed to be a hybrid between people power and a low speed electric vehicle.

 

The People Powered Limo turns Denver into the ultimate party zone. With the hottest bars and clubs on a 7 block stretch the People Powered Limo gives downtown a safe and exciting way to see all that these places have to offer. This seven block stretch is the Bar Route. It spans from 14th and Market to 21st and Market and hits areas on Blake and Larimer including Larimer Square and Beta Music Hall.

                        One Time Rides = $5

                        All Night Pass + Perks = $20

 

The People Powered Limo is also the best source for your next big advertising campaign!


Why Do We Need Only $15,000?

 

The People Powered Limo needs the funding to exist. Weâ€™re working together with Orlando Baker and his team in Fort Collins to make my innovation a reality. $15,000 was the number put together from the necessary materials to build the first one. These include:

                       

Steel Alloy for the Frame â€“ $2,500

                        Recumbent Bike Parts â€“ $2,000  

                        Limo Seating Area â€“ $5,000

                        Lights (Interior and Exterior) â€“ $1,000

                        Wheels â€“ $1,000

                        Electric Assists â€“ $1,500

                        Gearing â€“ $500                       

                        Storage Area â€“ $750

                        Website, Business Cards, Marketing â€“ $750

           

We're already in the drafting stage now and with our goal reached we can have this service out by Mid April! If we blow our goal out of the water, we will build more People Powered Limos and continue to make the service even better.

                       

The Impact

 

If you know me then the biggest impact you will be making is on me. Iâ€™ve been dreaming about this sense I was a pedicab manager for Jayâ€™s Valet and rather than going to investors Iâ€™m trying to make this happen with the help of friends and family. Iâ€™m going all out on this one and canâ€™t wait to make this happen.

If you donâ€™t know me then the biggest important impact your going to make is for yourself. Whenever you come downtown you can always guarantee that when that People Powered Limo is out on the Bar Route you donâ€™t have to stress about getting from bar to bar or back to your car or light rail. Weâ€™ll have you covered!

 

What You Get for Your Help!

 

Beyond being a huge part of bringing my People Powered Limo idea to life and getting to enjoy the service, contributors also get the awesome Perks listed to the right.

Our Perks are mostly service based and will come when the People Powered Limo is up and running this summer. We will also be doing drawings based on your donation amounts. There will be a $5 drawing, a $30 drawing and a $100 drawing. More to come on those later!

If you have any ideas for rewards Iâ€™m very good at listening to suggestions! Already thinking about doing some advertising Perks

 

VERY IMPORTANT!!

You donâ€™t have to give monetarily to make an impact, we need all the noise we can get using Facebook, Twitter, Word of Mouth and any other technique you use!

Also as stated before I want to do some drawings. There will be movies, People Powered Limo Gear, cool Rockies gear and whatever else we can get our hands on! If you have a local business or a product you want to get out there drop me an email at thepeoplepoweredlimo@gmail.com and we'll work something out!


Learn more about Orlando Baker - 

http://www.coloradoan.com/article/20120113/BUSI...

Like us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/peoplepoweredlimo
Follow us on Twitter - @pplpoweredlimo

story:
Our Story

First, please check back as more photos and video will be added.


I am the owner of Rolling Hills Asylum in E. Bethany, NY, a 54,000 sq. ft. and 11 & 1/2 acre historical property in Western NY.  Opened January 1, 1827 as the Genesee County Poor Farm, the property has a rich history and has had many lives, including becoming the Genesee County Infirmary and the Genesee County Nursing Home, before closing in 1974. It sat empty for nearly 10 years, eventually having a succession of private owners spanning over the last 38 years - making me the fourth private owner.  Rolling Hills Asylum is a pseudonym created by the morphing of names created for the property by a few of the previous owners.  


The property has a history steeped in sadness and tragedy, including over 1700 documented deaths.  From the early 1700's when it was a stage coach stop and a tavern, to when it opened on January 1, 1827 as The Genesee County Poor Farm, a self sustaining facility consisting of over 200 acres of land, fruit and vegetable gardens, cattle, chickens, various crops, a bakery and dairy, and more.  People would come to reside here because of poverty, such as losing their farms, becoming a widow, widower, or an orphan, perhaps they were a civil war veteran, or be mentally or physically disabled.


The next phase of the property was created in 1938 and was opened as the Genesee County Infirmary,  the hospital for  county. It handled all types of illnesses including tuberculosis.  By the mid-sixties another transformation was made when it became the Genesee County Nursing Home.  It stayed open until 1974 when a new facility was built in Batavia, NY and the residents were relocated, causing the facility to shut down. Over the next few years the property was divided (all but 11 acres became the Genesee County Park) and many of the old wooden structures such as the dorms and barns were torn down, leaving the main brick buildings and just a few smaller barns and a carriage house.  


in mid 2009 I heard the then owners were giving up the property and no one knew what would happen to the facility.  Thats when an overwhelming desire to acquire the property took hold of me, I was literally compelled to "rescue" the property, though my funds were menial,  in hopes of preserving the history and remembering all of the thousands of residents that have lived and died here.  Now that I  am here, I realize what a huge undertaking this project is, and though I have many amazing volunteers, money is still a major hold back in making the necessary repairs such as repairing the slate roofs, the flat tar roofs, re-grouting the old original windows, repairing the cupola, and sealing all the brick to thwart water damage.


The Impact

Last year, my volunteers helped remove close to 7 tons of pure garbage and this year the volunteers helped remove two 40 foot dumpsters of more pure garbage as well as begin the very necessary repairs of the holes in the roofs. As you can imagine, water is my enemy - that includes snow as well as rain.

My goal is to preserve the property and repair it so I may continue to expand on the historical tours and grow the museum, eventually expanding the repairs to the out buildings and grounds.  Poor Farms are an integral part of the history of the United States, they were almost like the first welfare system, if you will, and there are not very many of us still standing.  Poor Farms afforded a place for people to live safely, and as long as they were able-bodied, everyone had a job on the farm. This was to help keep the costs of the supporting the residents low, but also to give these people a sense of self worth, by helping to earn their keep, rather than just becoming some charity case. Though I embrace change, growth, advancement of technology, etc., its important to remember the past and recognize and pay homage to how life was so we can truly understand and count our blessings for todays gifts by keeping the history alive and available for others to come and experience.


What We Need & What You Get

For those donating $10 - $99 dollars, your name will go on the Rolling Hills Asylum website acknowledging your donations. For those donating  $101 to $999, your name will be included on the website as well as on a plaque to be hung in the museum in the building, thanking and acknowledging you for your donation.   Those contributing $1000 or more will receive both the afore mentioned as well as be invited out to a special RHA/ Indie GoGo thank you event later in 2012.


Currently Rolling Hills Asylum is supported by offering (for a fee) Historical and Flashlight tours as well as public and private ghost hunting opportunities, and by the generosity of volunteers who give of their time, sweat equity, and love and support of Rolling Hills Asylum, its former residents, and of me.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can spare the funds to donate, and I understand that.  However, if you smoke, buy a Starbucks, like to grab a glass of wine or a beer out, or even purchase chewing gum, would you please consider forgoing just one of your treats to help preserve this amazing property?  If not, you can help in other ways, the easiest is by spreading the word about the fund raising efforts of Rolling Hills Asylum here on Indie GoGo and of the tours offered at Rolling Hills Asylum by visiting our website at http://www.RollingHillsAsylum.com


In the past, I've worked for The United Way and March of Dimes and one of the most important things I learned from these experiences is that if you never ask, you'll never receive a YES.  So please, don't assume your friends, colleagues, business associates, and acquaintances are not interested in helping preserve this incredible historical property. Don't answer NO for them. Instead, send them the link http://igg.me/p/56948?a=356555 to this cause and let them make the decision for themselves. 


Thank you!

story:
My Story

My name is Amitay Tweeto. one day, i woke up and told myself, "it can't go on like this."

there was too much noise coming from all the social media, the loud city, the work, the home, etc.

So i created the quiet place:

http://thequietplaceproject.com/thequietplace

Just for me and my friends. i published the link to my 400 friends on Facebook and twitter and then...


The Impact

...it exploded. 


Suddenly, hundreds of thousands of people all around the world began to spread the word â€” They told me again and again that they desperately needed this quiet place.

I was (and still am) amazed. actually, it's ironic how much noise the quiet place is making :)


You can see the (ironic) Facebook page to see the reactions:

https://www.facebook.com/thequietplaceproject


On December 2011, I opened "the thoughts room":

http://thequietplaceproject.com/thethoughtsroom


It was also a success among the quiet place residents and helped many people to feel relieved. 


I tried to ask for donations, but it's not enough, I got maybe 30-50 dollars each month and it's barely cover the server.


What I Need & What You Get

So, It's just the beginning and I have many idea to come.

Right now I'm focusing on the next room that I hope will help the quiet place residents to fulfill their dreams and help each other with their life.


You can visit the contribute page to see why I need the money :)

http://thequietplaceproject.com/contribute


Amazon servers are the most expensive, after that there is the development. Apparently, It's not a cheap idea :|


I want the project to stay free.


I don't really got anything to give back except the continuation of this *free* project. So for now it's just my big thank you.

story:
Our Story

     Welcome to Corsino Cakes!  After three years in business we have finally moved from renting random space to having our own shop!  Now with the perks of renting a shop come the down sides as well.  MOSTLY when it comes to the bank.  After multiple failed attempts, no financial institution would back a young guy with a prosperous business no matter what the amount.  We were declined a loan and line of credit.  After regrouping from that, we brought on multiple investors to cover our renovations and equipment needs.


   


 


     Many of you have expressed some interest in investing with Corsino Cakes, but maybe did not have quite the amount of money we were looking for, so we have decided to set up here at IndieGoGo to do a bit of capital raising to cover our need for a line of credit .  So, here is the place to show a little additional support and get a little something back in return for your contribution!


Where has Corsino Cakes been, and where is it going


     Corsino Cakes has been around now for three years starting when owner Derek Corsino was still completing his degree in Baking and Pastry Management from The Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, NY.  Shortly after graduation, bakery space was secured and production began out of Red Hook shortly after.  After two and a half years it was time to move onto bigger and better things!

     In the winter of 2010-2011 Owner Derek Corsino competed in two Food Network Challenges, the first airing in August 2011: Renaissance Festival Cakes, and the next airing just a short time ago in October titled Halloween Ghost Story Cakes.  The responses from the show were fantastic, just ill timed as the relocation was not quite ready yet!  Corsino Cakes hopes to go back again to seek top prize and come home victorious next season. 

     Once the shop gets fully off the ground the business will be expanding into new territory!  We will be offering classes in cake decorating starting with the basics and going up to advanced sculpture as well as a variety of classes in baking at home as well.  The business also will be expanding into some small scale wholesale cakes and pastries for local businesses, and finally selling small cakes and select bakery items from our new store in Wappingers.

       


The Impact

     So, where does this money go?  This is a capital raise to help get the business off the ground and securely into our new shop in Wappingers Falls.  As we have hit many delays and bills still have to be paid, much of our cushion cash (working capital) has had to be spent on rent for the past few months.  So, instead of taking on a full investor, we would like to open this up to everyone, and give a little something back for your help as well.


What We Need & What You Get

     We are looking to raise at least an additional $4,000 in capital to cover the rest of our need for a line of credit.  So, what do you get out of this?  Here is what!

For donations between:
  $5-49 you get 5% off for the next year ending December 1, 2012
  $50-99, 10% off for the next year ending December 1, 2012
  $100-499, you get a card for 15% off any order for life
  $500+, a card for 25% off for life.

     Basically, the more you invest, the more you save on a future order.  These discount cards are good for classes, baked good, and cakes only.  They cannot be used for corporate purchases and wholesale business. 

This is as a thank you for your generous contribution to help get Corsino Cakes fully off the ground!

If you are interested in Investing any larger amount please contact Derek Corsino Directly.

Please use the PayPal option if you choose to donate.


www.CorsinoCakes.com

2653 E. Main St

Wappingers Falls, NY 12590

845-702-4902

CorsinoCakes@yahoo.com

What We Need & What You Get
     We are looking to raise at least an additional $4,000 in capital to cover the rest of our need for a line of credit.  So, what do you get out of this?  Here is what!For donations between:  $5-49 you get 5% off for the next year ending December 1, 2012  $50-99, 10% off for the next year ending December 1, 2012  $100-499, you get a card for 15% off any order for life  $500+, a card for 25% off for life.       Basically, the more you invest, the more you save on a future order.  These discount cards are good for classes, baked good, and cakes only.  They cannot be used for corporate purchases and wholesale business.  This is as a thank you 
for your generous contribution to help get Corsino Cakes fully off the 
ground!If you are interested in Investing any larger amount please contact Derek Corsino Directly.Please use the PayPal option if you choose to donate.
www.CorsinoCakes.com
2653 E. Main St
Wappingers Falls, NY 12590
845-702-4902
CorsinoCakes@yahoo.com

story:
I live on a fixed income since my brain surgery in 1996 for a (thankfully benign) brain tumor. I was six weeks in a hospital in N.Y.C. relearning to use my right side, after coming home and learning to walk again I began to have balance issues. However, I was able to drive which allowed me to have my independence.

  Late December 2012 I got a call from Woodstock dispatch informing me that my car had been stolen and totaled. However, then I got a fantastic new to me 2002 Jeep that I truly loved!

  In late June 2013 I had cervical spine surgery and it also solved my balance problems. I felt like my old self! I was so happy to be able to walk without a cane. Unfortunately, two months later I had a terrible car accident and totaled my new to me car.  Oh Noooo!!! Not only that but my balance issues reappeared which doesn't allow me to walk the two miles into town. Or anywhere.

  Now I need money to get another reliable car so that I can get on with my life. I have lived in this area for thirty seven years and want to be actively involved with my community and have my independence back.  Needless to say it can get very depressing. I am a people person I need to be able to get out and see people!

Please help me return to my independent lifestyle!

Dear friends anything you can do will be appreciated!

Thank you,

Ann King

story:
BBRAXTON Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men

Hi! My name is Brenda Braxton and I'm so proud to have been able to supply a much needed service by launching BBRAXTON; Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men, a men’s grooming salon in New York City. The salon is the first of its kind and occupies 2,000 sq. ft. of storefront in one of the city’s first “green” luxury high rise condominiums. The salon complements this evolution by providing the atmosphere of a traditional gentlemen's club, barber shop and new age spa; offering services such as hot towel straight razor shave, hair cuts and hair styling, body massage and integrated skin care. Patrons can catch up on the news, style trends, watch sports or relax and listen to R&B or Jazz music streams. 

What We Need 

While launching BBRAXTON in 2006 was an amazing undertaking it was also a personal financial drain. At that time bank financing for this new venture was impossible. The lending institutions could not wrap their heads around the concept of an upscale barber shop. So, by refinancing my home I was able to fund the entire start up costs and prove there was a market for this venue. But the economy has taken a toll on everyone and Small Businesess have felt it in a big way! Until now BBRAXTON has been able to survive through shear persistence and continually providing excellent custom service. But I now find I need help to keep our doors open and  go to the next level.

BBRAXTON  is raising  $60,000 to develop a BBRAXTON Product line which will continue to add revenue to the brand, launch a marketing/PR campaign and perform much needed salon repairs. To date, there are no other full service, upscale barbering parlors and spas in upper Manhattan (above 110th Street), thus BBRAXTON can still be considered a first to market venture, setting a precedent which has made it a staple of the present Harlem Community. 

What funds will be used for

BBRAXTON is seeking to establish its own brand of grooming products. Having a branded line of products will help our bottom line by allowing us to have a retail product that can be sold at our salon and website and eventually in other venues.

Our first product line is called First Shave by BBRAXTON ™ which is a three step shaving kit for the young first time shaver. It provides a regimen that  teaches the importance of proper grooming in life. First Shave by BBRAXTON™ is not just another shaving product. It's a young mans first step into manhood. It sets the tone for how he treats himself and how the world views him. To date there are no products that address this young niche. Most shave products are made for mature gentlemen and are too harsh for younger first time shavers. First Shave by BBRAXTON ™ is perfect for this demographic! 

Product Formulation          3,000

Lab Hours               2,000

Packaging Design        2,000

Labels         5,000

Formulation Copy write    550

Labels              5,000

Formulation Copy write      550


MARKETING PUSH      (5 month plan)               15,000

Efforts include the initiation of a sustained marketing strategy utilizing company-sponsored events, public relations and social media to build brand recognition and drive sales in the metro NYC area through its flagship location and the internet

BBRAXTON has secured the social media services of Biz Chica to enhance our marketing presence on the internet. Ideas include the implementation of the BBRAXTON YouTube channel, Twitter feeds, Blog Talk Radio and the continuation of its Facebook Fan Club page

Corporate Events

BBRAXTON will promote its space as a private event space for high profile corporate events. Companies include Black Enterprise, Gillette, American Express, NBA Players Association, NY Urban League Young Professionals, UPTOWN Magazine and other Wall Street Based companies.

Salon Repairs

While being in business for over five years is a great thing, it also put wear and tear on our physical space. We are in need of many repairs. 

Floor repair                               5,000

Wall Paper Repair/Painting      4,000

MARKETING PUSH      (5 month plan)  15,000                                                  

Working Capital

The remaining funds would insure the ability for us to have working capital and breathing room...What a concept :)

About Me

 Theater has been my life since I was 19 years old when I got my first Broadway show. I never thought I would find anything that gave me as much pleasure and fulfillment as being on stage until I launched BBRAXTON Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men. As an actress I always knew at some point I would have to figure out what I would do on that day when work didn't come as quickly as it use to. So when I launched BBRAXTON and felt the same thrill I knew this was my next passion and career! That feeling was further solidified when in 2009 I was the only woman honored with the “Men of Style Award ” given by Gillette Fuzion and the BBRAXTON salon hosted the Gillette Fuzion Tour in New York City for the second year.

So here's a little about me. I am a native New Yorker (born in the Bronx) and graduate of the High School for the Performing Arts. At the moment I'm starring in an off Broadway show called Cougar The Musical. Previous to that I played  Velma Kelly in Broadway’s hit musical Chicago.  I was also featured on Broadway in the musical revue Smokey Joe’s Cafe, a performance that earned me a 1995 Tony Award nomination, the NAACP Theater Award, the city of Chicago’s Jefferson Award and a Grammy Award for Best Cast Album. My other Broadway credits include Jelly’s Last Jam, Cats, Legs Diamond and the original production of Dreamgirls.

In realizing the importance of giving back, I founded a not -for-profit organization called, Leading Ladies Just for Teens (LLJFT), seminars geared toward empowering young girls to be the best they can be. Leading Ladies began in 1996 at the Virginia Theater while I was performing in Smokey Joe's Cafe. They were a series of seminars designed to encourage, challenge and inspire young girls to dream and set goals. For my work with LLJFT I received the Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. “Living the Dream” Award given by New York Gov. George Pataki and the Josephine Baker Award from the National Council of Negro Women.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by getting the word out about BBRAXTON by visiting us at BBRAXTON 1400 5th Avenue 212 289-3200 or www.bbraxton.com.  We are ready to pamper our gentlemen! Please feel free to use the Indiegogo Share tools to pass on our story and campaign. 

I THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!

story:
Dear Friends, by Ana Iris My family has been dedicated to the production and marketing of bakery products, and other products for parties since 2005; Our slogan is: A place with taste and distinction. Our brand Anairis is recognized by many people in our city for the good service and product quality.

To provide good quality service to our customers, meeting their needs and exceeding their expectations towards us, we want our products are top quality, and we consider it very important that there is an atmosphere of the following values: responsibility, respect, honesty, commitment, cleanliness, dedication, discipline and positive Attitude  We prepare the best cakes for all kindsof events, with our cakes all your guests will be satisfied, because the combination of fine ingredients contains no additives or preservatives, and have a variety pastries and white bread for the whole family.

 

 

 Especially, our specialty covers, 27 varieties of cakes with different recipes, flavors and colors. We deliver orders at home in ballrooms any event, some photos I expose our catalog below.

 

Why Colmena Groups?

The Colmena Groups Project by Ana Iris, is acombination between English and Spanish. Groups comes from the word workgroup or team, our company is 100% family and thence derives Hive = Colmena; want to be a business center in which many families and entrepreneurs can thrive in the pastry industry.

Why I decided to present my project on IndieGoGo?

Our vision is to be the leader and consolidate as a franchise chain in the business ofbakery, confectionery and salty variety, with a presence throughout the country of Mexico, through a committed team. Thus we come to IndieGoGo to strengthenand raise funds to achieve our vision and work in the most professional, corporate image, professional designs, register our trademark and patent our products; equip machines business with greater capacity and speed work, cooling equipment and displays, mounting a business website, a platform of membershipsfor those who want to learn the art of bread and pastry business has the opportunityto be part of our family.  With the contributions that have come Colmena Groups Project;  will be used to equip and give a good corporate image business.

  1. Two Columns In Stainless Steel $ 780 USD
  2. Blender / Mixers Brand Magnum $ 2,474.00 USD
  3. Bread Slicer $ 825 USD
  4. Fine pasta sheeter masses $ 2300 USD
  5. Blender / mixer Brand Magnum $ 1,488.00 USD
  6. Curved glass refrigerated box  $ 8,100 usd
  7. Shelves for bread display $2300
  8. Legal services $2000 usd
  9. Dynamic web portal with Training Platform and membership panel $ 1,600 usd
  10. Stainless Steel work tables $ 1,800 usd
  11. Refrigerator $1,725 usd
  12. Kitchen and bakery accesories $ 2,300 usd
  13. Bakery Oven $1,500 usd
  14. Oven Swing / Rotating  Bakery Oven $ 22,300 usd
  15. POS $ 2,125 usd
  16. delivery truck $17,000 usd
  17. Paints and refurbishment of the premises $ 2,850 usd

We greatly appreciate anything that youcan offer. We look forward to sharing many more joys with our community of families. With much gratitude,Colmena Groups By AnaIris

And for all my friends in Latin America here I tell you in Spanish: 

Mi familia se ha dedicado a la producción y comercialización de productos de panadería, pastelería y otros productos para las fiestas desde 2005, nuestro slogan es: Un lugar con buen sabor  y distinción. Nuestra marca  Ana Iris es reconocida por muchas personas en nuestra ciudad por el buen servicio. 

Para ofrecer un servicio de calidad a nuestros clientes, satisfaciendo sus necesidades y superando sus expectativas hacia nosotros, queremos que nuestros productos son de primera calidad, y consideramos es muy importante que exista una ambiente con los siguientes valores: responsabilidad, respeto, honestidad, compromiso, limpieza, dedicación, disciplina y Actitud positiva

Preparamos las mejores tortas para todos los eventos kindsof, con nuestros pasteles todos sus invitados a ser satisfecho, ya que la combinación de fine ingredients no contiene aditivos ni conservantes, y tenemos una variedad de pasteles y pan blanco para toda la familia.

Sobre todo, nuestra especialidad abarca, 27 variedades de pasteles con diferentes recetas, sabores y colores. Entregamos pedidos en salones de fiestas, algunas fotos que se exponen nuestro catálogo.

¿Por qué el proyecto Colmena Groups?

El proyecto Colmena Groups por Ana Iris, es una combinación entre Inglés y Español. Grupos proviene de la palabra grupo de trabajo o equipo, nuestra empresa es 100% familiar y de allí deriva Colmena, quieremos ser un centro de negocios en el que muchas familias y emprendedores pueden prosperar en la industria de repostería.

¿Por qué he decidido presentar mi proyecto en IndieGoGo?

Nuestra visión es ser el líder y consolidarse como una cadena de franquicias en el sector de negocios de panadería y pastelería, variedad dulces y salados, con un presencia en todo el pais el país de México, a través de un equipo comprometido;  llegamos a IndieGoGo con la finalidad de  reunir fondos para lograr nuestra visión y trabajar en la imagen profesional, corporativo, registrar nuestra marca y patentes de nuestros productos; equipar el negocio con máquinas de mayor capacidad y velocidad de trabajo, equipos de exhibición y cuartos de refrigeración, montaje de un sitio web de negocios, una plataforma de membresias para aquellos que quieren aprender el arte de pan y pasteles y puedan formar negocios y ser parte de nuestra familia.

Con las aportaciones que logremos con el proyecto Colmena Groups;  se utilizarán para equipar y dar una buena imagen de la empresa.

  1. Espiguero de 2 columnas capacidad 34 charolas $ 780 USD
  2. Batidora / Mezclador Marca Magnum $ 2,474.00 USD
  3. Cortadora Masas $ 825 USD
  4. Laminadora masas 2300 dólares USD
  5. Batidora 20 litros $ 1,488.00 USD
  6. Vitrina Curvo Refrigeradora de pasteles $ 8.100 USD
  7. Estantes para panadería 2300USD
  8. Servicios legales y fiscales $ 2,000 USD
  9. Portal web dinámico con plataforma de formación y  membresía de $ 1,600 USD
  10. Mesas de trabajo de acero inoxidable $ 1,800 USD
  11. Refrigeradores comerciales con doble puerta $ 1.725 USD
  12. Accesorios para para pastelería y panadería $ 2,300 USD
  13. Horno de Gaveta con 6 charolas; Gas $ 1,500 USD
  14. Horno de Columpio de 30 charolas $ 22300 USD
  15. Punto de Venta $ 2,125 USD
  16. Camióneta de reparto $ 17,000 USD
  17. Pinturas y acondicionamiento del local $ 2,850 USD

Estamos muy agradecidos por todo lo que podamos recibir de ustedes;  Esperamos poder compartir muchas más alegrías a nuestra comunidad. Con mucha gratitud, Colmena Grupos por Anairis

Camióneta de reparto $ 17,000 USD
Pinturas y acondicionamiento del local $ 2,850 USD
Estamos muy agradecidos por todo lo que podamos recibir de ustedes;  Esperamos poder compartir muchas más alegrías a nuestra comunidad. Con mucha gratitud, Colmena Grupos por Anairis

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am Bobby Hill; CEO of a new, developing, entertainment company in Mobile, AL called BCHILL Entertainment. Yes, I said Alabama. I graduated with my A.S. Degree in Theater and my BFA in Theater Performance. In college, I never was really given a chance to act in many plays because of my skin color. I auditioned at other theaters and got parts in plays, films, commercials and more. I started to think to myself, I would never want my friends or family to go through that much hardship trying to get in a play because of skin color or different walks of life. That day I decided that I wanted to make a company for people that just need a break and a foot in the door for the love of the Arts.

The Dream

My dream was to start a film company that would not only be bring money and jobs to the state, but also to provide a professional work experience, and resume credit to all actors, artists, and musicians in lower Alabama. There are so many talented men and women with in this state I want to give them a chance to shine and show their hometown what they can do. BCHILL is all about getting your foot in the door in cinema, artwork, theater, and music.

What Your Funds Will Provide For

The funds for this fundraiser will go to purchasing film equipment and supplies, hosting showings, and producing amazing films! At the moment all funding is coming out of my pocket. I believe in art and I know that with a little help this small company will grow to become a safe haven for new actors, actresses, writers, and anyone with a love for this craft.

All the money that is donated will help to get an LLC and other company development benefits. 

In Conclusion

NY has talent. CA, and LA, has talent. Why not Alabama? Why should we have to uproot, leaving our families and friends, for a screening or an interview on the other side of the country? There is talent here! It is hidden, untrained, and inexperienced. Help us to bring it into the light!

How You Can Help

BCHILL Entertainment is always looking for new talent. We need actors, camera crew, writers, extras, fight instructors, prop masters, and many more. We're not just developing a company here, we're building a community

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! This is the start of something that will benefit everyone young and old, new, and experienced.

So BCHILL

story:
“As the day’s, weeks and months passed, Ms Yee, Mr. Gordon and Ms Divall taught me that what matters is not what people think of you, it’s what you think of yourself. This is the most important lesson that I have learned in these Friday (yoga) classes.”  

 “We learned that if you focus on one goal and we believe in it, it will happen. It is not just focusing, it required acting too. In my point of view Yoga helps a lot of people to go through their problems. How? If a person learns to focus in a class, she is learning how to focus in life.”

 ~ Grade 10 students, Forest Grove School

 

THE VINYASA FOR YOUTH PROGRAM

Vinyasa Yoga for Youth empowers youth aged 5-22 through the practice of Yoga. While the popularity of yoga continues to grow and classes and studios are readily available, programs geared specifically towards youth are hard to find, even in the major cities.  In the past 4 years, Vinyasa Yoga for Youth has established programs in 30 schools in Saskatchewan and has worked with over 2000 youth.  With the success of these programs, we are now ready to expand into additional cities across Canada

 

SUPPORTING YOUTH

Yoga provides youth with an opportunity to be physically active in a non-judgmental, non-competitive environment. Youth learn to treat themselves with love and respect, and recognise that they have the power to make positive and healthy life choices. 

In addition, yoga is proven to: Maintain flexibility and strength for growing bodies, enhance concentration, increase self-esteem, provide tools for stress management, spark creativity, enhance body awareness, teach discipline and responsibility and develop compassion for self and others.

 

EXPANDING THE PROGRAM

With internationally renowned yogi Ryan Leier serving as founder and directing chair of the program, Vinyasa Yoga for Youth has gained remarkable support. We are now looking to expand our reach into cities across Canada including: Vancouver, Halifax and Edmonton.  Funds raised will go directly toward:

 

1.      Developing yoga youth training curriculums for school and community centre programs

2.      Connecting with school boards and communities

3.      Implementing programs

4.      Establishing sustainable grants to secure funding for our programming 

 

WHO WE ARE

Yoga for Youth is a registered non-profit in Saskatchewan (charitable status pending). Our program is currently running in Saskatoon Public and Catholic School Boards, the Northern Lights School District and in the beginning stages with the Greater Vancouver School District.  

The program supplements curriculum in primary and secondary schools by providing in-school workshops, supporting afterschool programs and youth groups, and holding weekend and summer retreats. We work with specific grants and business to support schools that have high numbers of At-Risk Youth (especially in inner-city locations) and have also just launched a pilot project in Northern Saskatchewan to the communities of Buffalo Narrows and La Loche.  

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

By donating today! Any contribution is significant. If right now you do not have money to support this project, then spread the word! Share this link with your friends and acquaintances, send emails, help family members who do not know how to use the internet, and finally, become a fan of our facebook page  and  visit our website at www.vinyasayogaforyouth.com.  Please help us spread the word and pass this message along!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Carole Freeman, a nutritionist and hypnotherapist. I have been passionate about helping people develop healthy eating habits for over 15 years. I'm a double graduate of Bastyr University with a bachelors in nutrition and a dual masters in nutrition and clinical health psychology. Additionally, I'm certified in clinical hypnotherapy.

My approach is different. I address the underlying issues that cause poor eating habits - correcting nutrient difficiencies, rebalancing brain chemistry, healing childhood issues, all while building self-esteem and teaching coping skills like mindful eating, emotional regulation and relaxation.

Some of you may know that my ultimate vision and goal is to develop the "natural health version of Jenny Craig" - natural health nutrition clinics throughout the Seattle area and expand into other states. While there are many diet clinics, there are currently NO NATURAL HEALTH weight loss clinics that offer a comprehensive solution to developing healthy eating habits that support long-term natural weight loss. There is a huge potential here!

Up to this point, I've been building my business, Hypnotic Nutrition, by "bootstrapping" - which means financing expantion via current cash flow. I have been seeing clients at two different locations, renting space from wellness centers in Kirkland and Bothell. I have found a 420 square foot location that will allow me to provide this revolutionary healthy lifestyle support all in one location in Bothell, WA (Seattle suburb). 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation will help me open my first clinic. Planned opening will be June 1, 2013. My goal is to raise $5,000 which will provide the supplies, equipment and improvements to the space so that Hypnotic Nutrition will have a full-time, dedicated location for serving clients. Funding this will allow me to provide 1-1 nutrition and hypnotherapy, cooking classes, nutrition and psychology workshops, healthy meals and snacks to-go, plus classes and workshop on a variety of topics to support healthy eating habits and a healthy lifestyle, like yoga, pilates, meditation, etc.

You get perks at each level of donation! (See below for more details of perks) You also will be helping bring a healthy, natural, effective, feel-good solution to many Americans that struggle with weight loss, self-esteem and healthy eating habits.

This is a bare-bones approach, but if my funding goal is not met completely, I will scale back even more. Donations will go towards funding start-up of clinic based on prioritization. My goal is to open this clinic, one way or another! 

Lease and Facilities Expenses (high priority) (~$2,600)

  • First month rent $780
  • Deposit $780
  • Paint $200
  • Signage $700
  • Phone & internet $70
  • Liability insurance $150 (down payment) 

Equipment (medium high priority) ($1230)

  • White board plus stand $50
  • Locking file cabinet $200
  • Folding chairs (20) $400
  • Folding workshop tables (4) $200
  • Sound screen machine $40
  • Hot plate $40
  • Massage table accessories $100

Goods to sell (medium priority) ($500)

  • Books
  • Snacks (pre-packaged)
  • Supplements

Supplies (medium priority) (~$100)

  • Paper towels $20
  • Toilet paper $10
  • Hand soap $3
  • Facial Tissues $10
  • Copy paper $50

Decor and furnishing (low priority) ($1000)

  • Ambient lighting $200
  • Front desk chair $50
  • Rolling treatment stool $50
  • Abient music player $40

PERKS

What do you get for your donation? Most importantly, you will be improving the health and happiness of our community, but you will also get some fun perks:

$25 donation

2 hypnosis recording downloads from my pre-recorded titles. I will send you a code to download your recordings from my online store.

$50 donation

Month long pass for unlimited classes that will be help at our new clinic. We will be offering classes on cooking, nutrition, mindful eating, emotional eating, ending cravings, relaxation, meditation, guided imagery, yoga and more.

$75 donation

FREE 80-minute nutrition and hypnosis session. Come to my office in Kirkland or Bothell for an 80-minute session. Alternately, you can use this session via phone or skype.  

$125 donation

2 free 80-minute nutrition and hypnosis session. Come to my office in Kirkland or Bothell for an 80-minute session. Alternately, you can use this session via phone or skype.

$200 donation

3 free 80-minute nutrition and hypnosis session. Come to my office in Kirkland or Bothell for an 80-minute session. Alternately, you can use this session via phone or skype.

$500 donation

10 free 80-minute nutrition and hypnosis session. Come to my office in Kirkland or Bothell for an 80-minute session. Alternately, you can use this session via phone or skype.

$1000 donation

A full 8 hour day of VIP services! I will spend the day with you (in the Seattle metro area) providing you with the services of your choice. You may choose from in-home cooking services, cooking classes (for just you or for a group), shopping assistance, pantry reorganization, menu planning, nutrition counseling, nutrition education, hypnotherapy or more. 

The Impact

Chances are, you know a friend or family member that has diabetes, high cholesterol, high blood pressure, depression or anxiety or is overweight or obese and at significant risk of developing serious illnesses due to poor eating habits and lifestyle.

Hypnotic Nutrition's clinic will have a huge impact on our community, both locally and beyond. Obesity is an epidemic with nearly 70% of American's being overweight or obese. Type 2 diabetes is increasing at record numbers. Children are gaining weight at alarming rates and developing diabetes at earlier and ealier ages. Depression and anxiety rates are on the rise, as well. Heart disease and cancer rates are growing, too. All of this can be greatly reduced by developing healthier eating habits. 

Over the last 8 months, I have built my practice to 3 days per week of seeing clients, plus 2 ongoing groups. Opening this clinic will allow me to take it to the next level. Together we can help even more people lead the healthiest lives they can. Let's do this!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute at this time, please share with others!

Use the Indiegogo share tools, post to Facebook, or email your friends and family.

 

Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU for your support!!

story:
Who would you have become if, from age five to seven, you were sexually abused by a neighbor? What would your life look like if you never knew your parents? How would your life be different if your parents abused drugs and pimped you out as a child? These are some of the stories of the men we serve.

Emmaus Ministries reaches out to men in survival prostitution on the streets of Chicago, men who sell themselves to other men to survive. Through nightly outreach teams and a daytime drop-in center (Ministry Center), Emmaus staff and volunteers build relationships of trust with these men, working together to help them get off the streets and develop a life-transforming relationship with Jesus Christ. 

During my junior year at Franciscan University, I went on a mission trip to Emmaus Ministries in Uptown, Chicago. Emmaus Ministries was founded by a Catholic deacon, but was created to unite Protestants and Catholics in ministry. When I went to Emmaus for mission, the Lord showed me why I was created. He fashioned me for this ministry. I fell in love with the men and the mission of Emmaus. I have been accepted to be a full-time missionary at Emmaus Ministries starting in August. My heart is full. I would like to bring you with me to Emmaus. When a man relapses or when it seems like there is no hope or when I am unsure if I can love anymore, please, please pray for me. I know I cannot do this alone. 

As a volunteer staff, I am fundraising my way to Emmaus. I would like to invite you to play a crucial role in the work of salvation history. My total fundraising goal is $10,000, but I started out with $5,000 in hopes to make half of it before the summer. This will cover my expenses in order to serve the men of Emmaus. The ministry covers my room and board, but everything else is up to me. If you could help me financially in any way, it would be an immense gift. Your help would allow me to volunteer for a year and serve the lowest of the low. The world discards and despises male prostitutes. In the eyes of our culture, they do not have dignity or worth. And that is exactly where I desire to be. Thank you. Thank you! To learn more about Emmaus, here is the website - check it out! http://streets.org/

story:
A Mother's Day gift, when needed most...

My name is Alita, and I'm here to tell you about my friend Lisa.

She is a tireless student and loving mother of two little boys.  She shows up for people in her community and her family, no matter what.  This year her husband, 30-years-old, was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes, and their lives were flipped upside down in un-imaginable ways.  

The financial and emotional burdens to follow have been overwhelming and exhausting, to say the least.  I have watched from a distance, feeling helpless yet inspired by their courage and determination to cope and keep hope. 

I have watched this family overcome the shock of discovery, the fear of treatment, trials & tribulations, and battle fatigue. Lisa held this family together every step of the way, they are now finally seeing a light at the end of the tunnel.

The gift I wish to bestow upon this Mother, is few days of rest on a sunny beach, far away, with friends and laughter -- a remedy that she's been secretly wishing for and needs now more then ever.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $1500 will cover airfare to Mexico, transportation, accommodation and meals. Any additional funds raised will go to past due medical bills and family care.
  • A donation of air mileage would be awesome too!  It currently takes 45K (Delta) to for a round trip ticket!  Contact Alitawatson@gmail.com with questions or ideas!
  • YOU will perform a random act of kindness that will impact a family, and possibly do the same for your mother . . . tell me your story, and I'll write it for you!

The Impact

This gift will revive faith and strength in the foundation of a family that could use some angels right now. Lisa's husband and community has been looking for a way to say thank you . . . if this gift was to come from all of US, we could start a trend!  Reminding those around us to thank our mothers, every chance we have and when they least expect it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Diabetes is widely recognized as one of the leading causes of death and disability in the United States.  Type 1 is an auto-immune disease and has no known cause.  We all know someone with this disease . . . take time to learn about it. Find a cause that feels good to you, make a donation, spread the word.

story:
Who We Are 

We’re Nap Time Startups - a crowdfunding platform and a team of business coaches exclusively dedicated to raising funds for mom and women entrepreneurs.

Below we discuss…

  • What We Do
  • Why We Are Building a Crowdfunding Ecosystem for Mom and Women, Exclusively
  • Our Community Oriented Crowdfunding Platform
  • Why Are We Crowdfunding
  • Why We Will Succeed
  • Impact of Your Donation
  • Description of Some Rewards

What We Do 

We empower mom and women entrepreneurs with a crowdfunding platform and innovative ecosystem that provides financial guidance and long term funding.  We work with entrepreneurs to provide donors and investors with quality, vetted opportunities.

The ecosystem also provides entrepreneurs with the ability to reach out to the “crowd” (i.e., donors and supporters) for product evaluation and market needs. By successfully engaging the crowd, entrepreneurs can acquire consumer and product info that provides a winning marketing edge. The Ecosystem also enables donors and investors to “spot” good products and gain insight into the company’s capabilities and month to month activities.

Why We Are Building a Crowdfunding Ecosystem for Mom and Women, Exclusively

Here’s why...

1.  Woman are an untapped source of innovation. As noted by Catherine Snowman, Nap Time Startups' Crowdfunding Coach (and a mom), “We traditionally purchase over 85% of all household products, plus we now dominate social networking and consumer technology usage. Most of us have generated ideas for new products or how to improve existing ones. We need to turn our innovative ideas into reality.”

2.  Women Startups are lagging for they can get the most important ingredient - MONEY

  • Despite all the news, woman startups are lagging behind their male counterparts (Kauffman Foundation study,A Rising Tide).
  • Why? For every $100 of investment capital committed, women entrepreneurs receive only $5. (Alicia Robb, author - A Rising)
  • The reason?  Alicia Robb notes…Men start with more money, enabling easier debt financing.  Old-boys investment community has few women members.

3.  Nap Time Startups wants to be part of the SOLUTION by raising funds for mom and women entrepreneurs and providing an environment that is based on community values – collaboration, transparency and trust. 

Our Community Oriented Crowdfunding Platform

Within the Nap Time Startup crowdfunding platform mom and women entrepreneurs, donors and our Business Coaches are a community with a similar goal - the success of the entrepreneur’s startup.  To achieve success, we’re building the Nap Time Startup crowdfunding platform with an innovative Ecosystem.  It empowers entrepreneurs with long term funding plus the ability to reach out to the “crowd” (i.e., donors and supporters) for product evaluation and market needs. By successfully engaging the crowd, entrepreneurs can acquire consumer and product info that provides a winning marketing edge. The Ecosystem also enables donors and investors to “spot” good products and gain insight into the company’s capabilities and month to month activities.

By building a collaborative and transparent Ecosystem that promotes trust, both the entrepreneurs and her supporters win!

Why We Are Our Crowdfunding

Our 2014 goal is to raise funding for 1000 mom and women entrepreneurs.  This requires the completion of our innovative ecosystem and recruiting three (3) additional Business Coaches. The expense is $360,000.  We are crowdfunding $90,000 or 25% of the total expense.

Why We Will Succeed

We have an experience team. They have all started their own businesses and several of their companies have either gone public or have been acquired by a Fortune 500 firm.  We believe that there is a need to create a full life-cycle ecosystem focused on women entrepreneurs and we have the team in place to make this happen.

Impact of Your Donations

Your donations will help us fund coaching and build out a collaborative support ecosystem via innovative technology for mom and women entrepreneurs.  Our ecosystem will connect the entrepreneur with our business coaches, affiliate marketers, "women in business" mentors, crowdfunding donors and potential equity investors.  We are creating a recipe for not only early stage crowdfunding but also long term business success with coaching and seasoned, expert resources.

Our dynamic ecosystem called "My Startup" will aim to:

•  Increase the success rate of women owned businesses

•  Build awareness of the lack of funding for women entrepreneurs

•  Create an economic impact with new job creation


Description of Some Rewards

Thanks for supporting our cause.  In the right column is the list of rewards and their description. Below are more details for a few rewards.

story:
Typhoon Yolanda (Haiyan), one of the most powerful typhoons on record, ripped through central Philippines last November 8, 2013, leaving more that 6,000 people killed and over 12 million people affected.

The CITIZENS’ DISASTER RESPONSE CENTER (CDRC), a local non-government organization that pioneered and continues to promote community-based disaster management in the Philippines, immediately mobilized its network of regional centers and people’s organizations to respond to the impact of the disaster.

Almost two months after, CDRC and its network of volunteers and supporters, continue to work on the ground -- providing immediate relief, shelter and livelihood assistance, and psychosocial support to the affected communities.

The rehabilitation process may be hard, but with your help, the survivors will be able to recover from the devastation.

Every dollar that you donate to our campaign will go directly to CDRC's rehabilitation efforts:

  • Livelihood projects
  • Shelter construction/repair
  • Disaster Risk Reduction activities

story:
Join the Jumpjet Set. We have hacked the world of private flying, and are passing on the savings to you. We offer round trips in a private jet for commercial airline prices.


Our proprietary technology optimizes charter schedules to offer round trip flights to members as low as $450 within their time zone, and $1750 coast-to-coast. Memberships start at $21 per year to allow you access to our services as needed, and monthly Premier memberships offer guaranteed rates and tons of benefits. 

Founded by an expert in the aviation industry, we launched our beta test last year to test the concept. It went really well, and we are ready to start flying, we just need your help. 

To be able to process thousands of reservations on a national scale and handle customer experiences we need to upgrade our technology. This includes producing an enterprise APP as well as back-end technology that syncs with car and hotel rentals.

Imagine flying like this:



When you paid for this: 

No lines, free bags, and fly with other cool JumpJetters.  

WHAT IS JUMPJET?

Jumpjet is a tech-oriented company, and the only company in the world offering private jet travel at commercial airline prices.

We use long term planning and shared travel to offer low prices:

-Plan your trip at least 30 days out. The further out you book, the cheaper it gets.

-Be flexible when booking, but final dates are confirmed within 24 hours of booking.

Imagine just 8 of you on this baby going NY to LA, often for less than first class on major carriers! We size the jet to the trip.  Empty seats are free for our Premier Members! 


Jumpjet is great for companies of all sizes, alumni trips, sport trips, wedding trips, gifts, anniversaries, bat/barmitzvahs, mile high club, celebrities and non-celebrities, families with kids and families without kids, couples of all shapes and sizes, and even your cat or dog!


OUR MISSION

Jumpjet is the next generation of air travel.  Our mission is to bring the convenience and luxury of private travel to the masses. Who doesn't want to fly on a private jet and skip long airport lines? 

In the future Jumpjet will be the first true "Tech-Jet".


 JUMPJET PERKS

WHO WE ARE

Will is our founder and chief visionary.  He has dedicated the last 8 years of his life to this vision.  He is very passionate about Jumpjet and the mission at hand.  Will is a helicopter pilot with seventeen years in aviation. 

Naram is the cool guy and has to because he is our Chief Marketing Officer.  

Jumpjet Media & Press.

OUR PRESS AND MENTIONS

"Jumpjet" selected number 5 of the top 10 Christmas gifts for traveler you know" -FOX
"We are going to make flying fun again"-Leaders Magazine.
"Let's give up the long lines, stress of airline travel and come fly with us for the cost of a coach airline ticket" Pimm Fox Bloomberg
"The Cost of Flying Private is coming down"-Time Magazine
"People hate airline travel.  We are going to enable them to look forward to flying again"-CNBC.COM
"Jumpjet is literally going to change the way we fly all over the world.  If you live in the UK and travel to the USA you can use Jumpjet when we start flying."-BBC 
"My wife loved her Jumpjet flight" -Mitchell Modell - CBS Undercover Boss
"I love what you do. God do I love Jumpjet" -Academy Award Winner Richard Dreyfus
Other honorable mentions in the media are: NBC.com, The Josh Tolley Show, Entertainment Tonight, New York Post, BetaKit and Condé Nast.

What our Test customers have to say

-Good morning Jumpjet … the crew and the plane were amazing … I have done a fair amount of private flying and if this is the service you will be offering … you will have a lot of very happy customers. Ben and Robert were amazing … and the flight went off without a hitch. Thanks so much!! Ken R, Detroit, MI

-Golf in Nebraska with seven friends.  My second trip was a business trip.  This will be the go-to service. I am sure of it.  Thank You So Much. Andy S, Morristown, NJ.

-My wife flew with Jumpjet to Los Angeles from NYC.  They stopped in Colorado on the way for maybe thirty minutes to pick up another member.  On the flight home there was no stop.  It was incredible.  I demand safe transport with professional service.  My wife loved it. MM, New York City, NY.

-After a five hour weather delay the plane finally showed up.  I have to admit I was a little upset.  But the plane was incredible.  The crew was amazing and one of the Customer Care Agents from Jumpjet greeted us on our arrival with flowers for my wife to apologize for the weather.  Our return trip was flawless.  Thank You Jumpjet. Dan M. DuPage, IL.

-Love-Love-Love the test flight we did.  Wowee.  Whoever dreamt this one up deserves a medal.  Would have liked to have heard about food beforehand but Craig our Pilot ran off and surprised us with a great sandwich lunch.  Can't wait for full-time service.Sent From My iPhone- Bill S. Nashville, TN.

-We had a chance to fly one way to our vacation home. (we only needed one way).  I have bad hips and let me tell you, Jumpjet - Thank You!  There was no stress, no long walks, no lines.  And everyone including Melissa was just wonderful.  Mr. Ashcroft, I understand starting a business is hard.  Don't you dare give up on this wonderful company you have created. Anne. M Dallas,TX

-Jumpjet changed our family's life in terms of stress free travel.  It was just fun to fly on a plane once again.  Go team Jumpjet.  Big kudos to Brett for being such a great customer care person. Brad P, Santa Monica, CA.

-Took my 92 year old father to the Florida Keys with my son.  Three generations on a private jet for the first time.  Amazing-Thank You Jumpjet. Brandon R, Delrey Beach, FL.


THE FAQS

How can you do what no one else can?

Let's take the emotion and passion out of the equation for a second.  It boils down to aggregating planes in an efficient manner, and putting like-minded people in the same private jet going to the same destination who are willing to work with our rules.  We also have some pretty smart Flight Planners!

How many jets do you own?

Not One! That is another reason why Jumpjet can do what others can't because we buy large amounts of charter from the industry. We are a friend to the industry and we don't have the headaches and costs of owning the jets like the airlines do.

Have you Tested this yet?

YES, we did a Beta test last summer.  We flew approximately 900 hours.  We made some mistakes and did some learning.  One of the reasons we are doing this crowd funding is to upgrade our technology, and to implement our new systems. We also have learned in the months since then that a lot of people would like to use the service.

I can't get my payment to work. What should I do?

Email the Indiegogo Customer Happiness Team at support@indiegogo.com. They'll be able to track your transaction and help with any issues.

What countries will Jumpjet be flying in the future?

USA is our first market (except Alaska and Hawaii), and we are open for membership in 42 USA "origination" cities with another 78 cities planned over the next two years.  You can fly from any "origination" city to any other city of your choice within the 48 contiguous states. From there we will expand into Canada, The Caribbean and Mexico, South America, Europe, Asia , UAE and India. 

Why set such a low funding goal?

It’s all about scale. To offer the final product at a competitive price we need to produce enough volume to make an impact. We believe this funding target and these perk levels give us the best chance of success. Mind you if we can exceed our goal we would not complain.

What if you fail to reach the funding target?

Well, we are not focusing on the negatives.  We believe there are enough of you out there who would like to fly on a private jet and make a difference while doing so. Let's see what we can all achieve.

Can I come work for you?

Come on down. We need a few great people to help. If you want to volunteer and earn some free flights you can do that from your home.  If you'd like to come join the team send us a letter about yourself and the difference you can make each day at Jumpjet.

If I live overseas but travel to the USA can I still use Jumpjet?

Yes.  You must be screened against the USA "NO FLY LIST", which we will do for you.  As long as you are approved, then may we offer you a cup of coffee and a danish before take off.

Regarding time zones and pricing?

Your price is determined by how many time zones you fly between. The more time zones you fly across the more your trip will cost. Jumpjet Departure Cities. Jumpjet Arrival Cities. 

Other Ways You Can Help Us Change Flying!

Tell your friends and co-workers all over the world about Jumpjet. Let them know they can now apply to fly Jumpjet.com in the USA before we expand worldwide.

story:
The Problem

The Bookshelf, a 20-year-old, small, independent bookstore in Truckee, California, is on the brink of closing. Due to decreased traffic, increased rent, and the changing bookstore environment, the business is struggling. This is a problem. The people of Truckee-Tahoe love their books and their local bookstore. They don’t want to see it close.

A Community Solution

This month, when we heard that the locally owned, independent Bookshelf in Truckee, was about to close after 20 years, we formed a group to breathe some new life into the business and try to save it.

The Bookshelf has been such an important part of our lives as readers, parents, teachers, community members, writers, and isolated mountain dwellers -- not only for the books, but also for the author and community events that the Bookshelf has hosted over the years. We can’t imagine Truckee without it. 

Here's Our Plan to Save Our Shelf:

• Buy Books: We have launched a grassroots campaign to raise awareness about the fate of Bookshelf to encourage community to buy local, especially during the holiday season;

• Youth-Led Rally on November 23rd: High school students designed and implemented a campaign to raise awareness via social media and culminating with a rally on November 23rd. Check out their campaign at www.gofundme.com/5636jk;

• Raise Money: We have launched this campaign to raise $30,000 over the next 60 days from the community and long-time patrons. Our hope is that thousands will donate a small amount to help Save Our Shelf;

• Improve the Space: We plan to bring in a local interior design expert (who has generously donated her service) to give the old Shelf a new, more inviting and appealing look (with the possibility of new paint, furniture, window displays, etc.);

• Create new business plan for long-term sustainability: We are collecting ideas on how to transform the Bookshelf including a membership model, new ownership, forming partnerships, or finding a new space. In January we will analyze our options and move forward. 

Our Goal:

Develop a Bookshelf that is everything we love about the old Shelf and more -- with a sustainable business plan that can become a model for other efforts like ours to keep culture, the arts, and small businesses alive and well.

All we need is you.

The Impact

This campaign and the funds that we raise here will determine the future of the Shelf! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation to the campaign, you can still help the Save Our Shelf campaign succeed by contributing in other ways. We would love it if you:

• Spread the word! Please forward this campaign on to all friends, colleagues, and family

• Join the working group. We need more people with resources, expertise, and most importantly, energy and time to help out in making this happen. If you can volunteer some time we would love for you to get involved. Stop by the Bookshelf or e-mail the owner, Debbie Lane (bookshelf.truckee@yahoo.com), to learn how.

The people of Truckee-Tahoe love their books and their local bookstore. They don’t want to see it close.A Community SolutionThis month, when we heard that the locally owned, independent Bookshelf in Truckee, was about to close after 20 years, we formed a group to breathe some new life into the business and try to save it.The Bookshelf has been such an important part of our lives as readers, parents, teachers, community members, writers, and isolated mountain dwellers -- not only for the books, but also for the author and community events that the Bookshelf has hosted over the years. We can’t imagine Truckee without it. Here's Our Plan to Save Our Shelf:• Buy Books: We have launched a grassroots campaign to raise awareness about the fate of Bookshelf to encourage community to buy local, especially during the holiday season;• Youth-Led Rally on November 23rd: High school students designed and implemented a campaign to raise awareness via social media and culminating with a rally on November 23rd. Check out their campaign at www.gofundme.com/5636jk;• Raise Money: We have launched this campaign to raise $30,000 over the next 60 days from the community and long-time patrons. Our hope is that thousands will donate a small amount to help Save Our Shelf;• Improve the Space: We plan to bring in a local interior design expert (who has generously donated her service) to give the old Shelf a new, more inviting and appealing look (with the possibility of new paint, furniture, window displays, etc.);• Create new business plan for long-term sustainability: We are collecting ideas on how to transform the Bookshelf including a membership model, new ownership, forming partnerships, or finding a new space. In January we will analyze our options and move forward. Our Goal:Develop a Bookshelf that is everything we love about the old Shelf and more -- with a sustainable business plan that can become a model for other efforts like ours to keep culture, the arts, and small businesses alive and well.All we need is you.The ImpactThis campaign and the funds that we raise here will determine the future of the Shelf! Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't make a donation to the campaign, you can still help the Save Our Shelf campaign succeed by contributing in other ways. We would love it if you:• Spread the word! Please forward this campaign on to all friends, colleagues, and family• Join the working group. We need more people with resources, expertise, and most importantly, energy and time to help out in making this happen. If you can volunteer some time we would love for you to get involved. Stop by the Bookshelf or e-mail the owner, Debbie Lane (bookshelf.truckee@yahoo.com), to learn how.

story:
What is Eat Local Farms?

Eat Local Farms is an online local food marketplace and distribution start-up company.  Our mission is to increase access to local food by making it easier for farmers to connect with consumers. Our online market allows local food producers to reach customers, sell their products, collect payment, organize delivery, and manage inventory.  Farmers build their own virtual farm stand and their products are showcased on our website. Shoppers can view all the local produce available in their area and purchase dairy, fresh produce, regional meats, and other locally made goodies. Customers place their order, which will go directly to the farmers so they can start harvesting the produce or the baker will pull their loaf of bread from the oven, which they bring to our food hub. We conveniently pack everything and deliver it right to customers home or office.

We Need Your Support!


The perks for your support range from hand written thank you notes, “Eat Local Farms" tote, T-shirts, farm fresh local produce, to 10% off all your orders in the first year. We really appreciate any support no matter how small. Please share our passion to support local food with your friends and family. Your support will not only help us to start our business but will help support your community which includes local farmers through the purchase of their products. We strongly believe that we can build a healthier food system by making it easier for anyone to purchase local food.



Why Local Matters?

  • Most produce loses 35-75% of vitamin C and most other phytonutrients within 7 days of harvest because from field to fork food travels 1,500 miles or more. 
  • Industrial agriculture’s success is centered on increasing productivity.  Unfortunately, its success comes with inherent negative trade-offs:  land-water-soil degradation, chemical inputs (fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides), transportation costs and a large carbon footprint. 
  • Locally grown food tastes and looks better. The crops are picked at their peak, and farmstead products like cheeses that are handcrafted for best flavor. Livestock products are processed in nearby facilities and typically the farmer has direct relationship with processors, overseeing quality - unlike animals processed in large industrial facilities 
  • No- GMO’s!! In the modern agricultural system, plant varieties are chosen for their ability to ripen uniformly, withstand harvesting, survive packing and last a long time on the shelf, so there is limited genetic diversity in large-scale production. Smaller local farms, in contrast, often grow many different varieties of crops to provide a long harvest season, an array of colors, and the best flavors. Livestock diversity is also higher where there are many small farms rather than few large farms.
  •  By supporting local farmers today, you are helping to ensure that there will be farms in your community tomorrow. That is a matter of importance for food security, especially in light of an uncertain energy future and our current reliance on fossil fuels to produce, package, distribute and store food.
  •  Buying local products keeps local money in the local economy. For every $1 spent at a local business 45 cents is reinvested locally. For every $1 spent at a corporate chain only 15 cents is reinvested locally.

story: Hi, my name is Adam and I'm hoping to find some kind souls who can help me buy a christmas gift for my Mother. I am currently unemployed and unable to afford any gifts for anyone. I can't bare the thought of not getting something for my Mother who has always been there for me in any way she could. My Mother raised me and my two sisters on her own while working and going to school at the same time. Somehow she managed to do all of that and still be an amazing Mother. Recently she developed arthritis in her knee and is having trouble sleeping and keeping up with household chores. My plan if I can raise enough funds is to buy her a robot vacuum so she will no longer have to vacuum. Thanks for taking the time to read this. If you are not able to donate please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out. THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROSITY & MERRY CHRISTMAS!

story: Matt Drope is presently in hospital in Vancouver and his family here on the Sunshine Coast could use a hand from the community. If you can donate, please do.  This little hockey player needs to get better.    His team misses him!    Thanks.

story:
Short Summary

My Dad and stepmother lost everything in the devestating hurricane this past Monday.   Along with the boardwalk he has nothing left but memories.  The home was located in Toms River, NJ on the lagoon.   The house was their primary home that they both put their hard owned money into.  The house has been passed down through three generations.  

My father worked extremely hard all his life for what he owns.  He is an army veteran and retired Corrections officer.  He is a very giving man and would and has saved others from harms way.  He had to be rescued on Tuesday morning from his car in which he sat for over 5 hours in knee deep water.  

This is a small token my sister and his grandchildren can do for him.  While there are memories he has no home to return to.  No basic needs.  

Update:  11/5/12 - My sister went down to help, it breaks our hearts that our dad has to suffer a loss like this, anything you can give will make a difference; thanks again!   

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for 2,500.00

The monies will be used for immediate relief and critical assistance.  

Food and basic needs such as food, clothing and shelter.  

Any help is graciously appreciated.  

It would mean the world for their children and grandchildren to see them safe.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word to others!
