story:
In 2011 at the age of 46, I was diagnosed with stage 1 breast cancer. I had no family history, ate well, exercised, didn't smoke and rarely drank. As I went through treatment, I met many women who were in my same position. In fact many refer to Breast Cancer as an epidemic. If this is true, something has changed in our lives that is causing this. I began looking at the products I put on my skin and was shocked to learn that many of the products that were "natural" also had parabins, chemicals and dyes. I decided to go back to basics and design my own skin care made from all natural ingredients and essential oils. From this, the idea to create a "chemo care" package for women going through treatment came to me. Women's skin, nails and sense of smell change dramatically when going through chemo. This package will include a calming body butter, foot balm, lip balm, facial toner and calming bath soap. All natural, UNscented and with your help, free to the women who are in need of these products. I will use the funds raised here specifically for the chemo care. Funds will go towards product, testing, machinery, packaging, promotion and delivery. It's a small thing in the grand scheme of things, but a big thing to the women who are being gifted. I hope you can be a part of Violets Are Blue.

See my story in the Philadelphia Inquirer Newspaper from Oct 5th, 2012.

http://www.philly.com/philly/news/local/172759131.html

story:
This is a story the media isn't covering.

Yet, it is already happening.

Please support COMBATANTS FOR PEACE and their Media Outreach Campaign and Bi-National Activities.

[Please Note: Thanks to iWagePeace, donations are currently being matched dollar for dollar up to a total of $7,500!! See Our Latest Update.]

We see horrifying images of violence coming from the Middle East these past weeks, and a seemingly unending cycle of hatred and conflict – with both sides stuck in a narrative with no way out.  We are a group of former combatants that are not waiting for our governments - we are actively doing it differently, and we need your help.

The “Combatants for Peace” movement was started jointly by Palestinians and Israelis who have taken an active part in the cycle of violence; Israelis as soldiers in the Israeli army (IDF) and Palestinians as part of the violent struggle for Palestinian freedom. After brandishing weapons for so many years, and having seen one another only through weapon sights, we have decided to lay down our arms, and to fight for peace.  Our mission is to actively spread the message that a non-violent solution to the conflict is possible, and our hundreds of members and participants are living proof that it is.

We Need Your Support to Continue These Important Activities - especially now with the ongoing violence between our countries.  Help Us Reach A Wider Audience With Our Message.

Hundreds of millions of dollars have been spent in just the last month on this war. And the media only perpetuates it by focusing solely on stories and images of violence and hate.  We take a different path.

Your funding will help us to:

· Hire and set up Bi-National media teams, which will work to get our story out and to act in order to influence public opinion in Israel, Palestine and the rest of the world.

· Bring consciousness to both publics regarding the hopes and suffering of the other side, and to create partners in dialogue.

· Educate towards reconciliation and non-violent struggle in both the Israeli and Palestinian societies.

· Create political pressure on both Governments to stop the cycle of violence, end the occupation and resume a constructive dialog.

· Reach beyond the region and connect with people around the world who believe in non-violence and the importance of allowing a new story to emerge - one of peace, coexistence and interconnectedness.

WE BELIEVE that only by joining forces, will we be able to end the cycle of violence, the bloodshed and the occupation and oppression of the Palestinian people while allowing for the ongoing security of the citizens of Israel. We understand that it is impossible to resolve the conflict between the two peoples through violent means; therefore we declare that we refuse to take part any more in the mutual bloodletting. We will act only by non-violent means so that each side will come to understand the national aspirations of the other side. We see dialogue and reconciliation as the only way to act in order to terminate the Israeli occupation, to halt the settlement project and to establish a Palestinian state with its capital in East Jerusalem, alongside the State of Israel.


WE ARE A COMMITTED GROUP that began in  2005 with a few people, and now number in the hundreds, with 5 regional groups.  We have been organizing meetings between Israeli and Palestinian veterans, in which both sides tell about the violent actions that they have taken part in and about the turning point which led them to understand the limits of violence. Naturally, these meetings were fraught with many fears, however we soon learned that despite years of fear and hatred, there is more that unites us than divides.  Even in these most trying of times, we are determined to:

· Continue with the combatants’ meetings, which allow each side to understand the other’s narrative, via the approach of reconciliation rather than conflict.

· Implement an educational lecture series in public forums on both sides (universities, youth groups, schools etc.). The lectures will be given jointly by an Israeli and a Palestinian veteran, who will concentrate on the transition from violent struggle to the recognition of the limits of violence.

· Create joint projects which educate towards non- violence.

· Create joint frameworks in order to become familiar with the culture, history and current needs of the other nation.

· Participate in demonstrations and other non-violent actions against the occupation as a bi-national group.

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT to break this cycle of hatred and conflict and to end this conflict through non-violent means.

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

1. Please Donate to Our Campaign for Combatants For Peace.


2. Please Help Us Get The Word Out - Share This With Friends on Facebook, Twitter and Other Social Media.  Send email with the link to your friends.


3. Share This Campaign With Your Community, Church, Synagogue or Mosque.



THANK YOU - FROM COMBATANTS FOR PEACE!



"I refuse to accept the view that mankind is so tragically bound to the starless midnight of racism and war that the bright daybreak of peace and brotherhood can never become a reality... I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word."
~ Martin Luther King, Jr.

story:
Welcome!

Josh and Emily (that's me) are getting married November 1, 2014 and we are planning to go on the honeymoon of a lifetime, literally.  You only get one shot at a honeymoon so we are trying to make it as special as possible!  We are asking for a few donations as a wedding present.  If you aren't too keen on sending us a blender, this is a wonderful alternative!

The Honeymoon

We are going to an island off the coast of Belize to an extremely relaxing private island/hotel called Cayo Espanto.  Here are some cool things we get:

  • Our own villa!
  • Plunge pool
  • Private deck
  • Housemen waiting on our every whim
  • Food/drinks
  • Hammock
  • And much, MUCH more!

The Money ($$$)

You may be asking yourself, "How do I know it is going to your honeymoon?" or "What if I just want to give you money sans Honeymoon?" To answer the first question, you don't!  Our method here is indirect.  We have already paid to reserve the villa for the honeymoon but we need a replacement for this money given that it would've been spent on things like groceries, rent, etc.  So even if you don't want to contribute to the honeymoon, it will definitely be going to useful things as mentioned above.  AND if we make our goal we get to keep more of the money for ourselves as opposed to giving it to the website.

    THANK YOU!

    Emily & Josh

story:
Our Mission

Thank you for reading this in advance!!  

Garden to Grill is a celebration of prepared plant-based foods. We create eclectic, full-flavored Cuisine using local ingredients as much as possible.   Most of our menu items are made from scratch in our kitchen using our own vegan recipes including our non-dairy cheese, mayonnaise, sauces, veggie burgers and more, with a multitude of gluten-free options. 

 

Our dedication to Service is carried even further because the Garden to Grill plant-based menu also serves the planet.  We are committed to ecologically sound, sustainable, and the best practices in the restaurant industry guidelines.  We model how to treat Our Guests and Our Earth through serving food that is not only delicious and healthy, but reduces environmental impact and creates a positive net-effect on the planet: We use compostable and recyclable food containers to reduce our energy use and cut our food waste to the minimum.

 

Our dedication and commitment to a plant-based, restaurant alleviates needless negative impact to animals and the environment. The Garden to Grill commitment is practical and makes a real difference compared to that of a similar, traditional-style restaurant.  In the last 12 months alone we saved:

 

 • 50+ million gallons of water

 • 8,000 animals

 • 110,000+ pounds of CO2 gasses

 

At Garden to Grill we take pride in our ability to offer a food experience that benefits our customer’s health and well-being and the well-being of the planet and the animals that share this earth.

 

Our philosophy is summed up as:  Garden to Grill serves a healthy-heart, plant-based diet optimal for overall wellbeing with a variety of quick savory meal options for your fast paced life.

 

 

 About Rey:

 Rey grew up eating a traditional, Mexican-American Cuisine consisting of beef, pork, and dairy. After years of being ill from food-related ingredients, Rey had the realization that maybe the food he was eating was causing his ill health. Rey suffered from food related illness for years. He was handicapped by the sickness; fevers, chills, excruciating stomach pain since he was a child. Rey was willing to try anything to change his circumstances. In 1994, Rey made the decision to change to a plant based diet. Rey immediately experienced improved health and quality of life that he continues to enjoy to this day.

 

Rey Ortega began his life’s work with Alternative Baking Company that same year. Rey founded and developed ABC from the ground floor and nourished it into a large, wholesale production. He sought to provide a healthy, vegan alternative to the world.

 

Looking for bigger and better opportunities, Rey left ABC and immediately opened Sun Flour Baking. It was 1997 and the orders began pouring in. Once again, from scratch he built the bakery from the ground up. The Sun Flour Baking vegan cookies quickly made it onto the shelves in stores, airlines and high-end hotels. He sold millions of cookies over the years. Rey takes pride in providing healthy food alternatives to everyone, not just the vegan community. The bakery only grew bigger and faster.

 

 

Ronald Russell:

4th Generation Californian Ron Russell is a chef, restaurateur, author of fiction and non-fiction, and an artist.

 

In addition to Garden Grill, Ron is co-partner in Sun Café Organic, which has won more than a dozen culinary awards including being named 1 of the 10 Best Restaurants in Los Angeles by Open Table in 2013. Sun Café counts Mila Kunis, Colin Farrell, Anne Hathaway, John Salley, Serena Williams and many other celebrities as regular customers.

 

Since his late teens, Ron has followed a plant-based diet for the animals, for the planet and for health. From age 11, Ron has worked to be an environmentalist: recycling, reducing wasteful consumption and the environmental decision to be a vegan.

 

Over the past 3 years, in more than 150 plant-based cooking classes, Ron has developed and shared 15-minute gourmet healthy recipes with his students.

He has been featured in the NY Times, NBC News, Los Angeles Times, and InStyle, among other media.

 

 

Rey and Ron

 One day Rey gives Ron a call asking him to help him save a vegan/plant based café in Sacramento, CA. The Sugar Plum Vegan café was going out of business and they saw an opportunity to save it. The previous owner was in severe debt, losing money and unable to keep the business afloat. She was desperate to keep the café open to the public, even if she wouldn’t be running it herself. They kept the doors open and changed the name to The Plum Cafe. They held a grand re-opening and packed the place inside and out. Over the next two and a half years, Rey and Ron poured money, sweat and tears into The Plum Café. They embarked on a long process of remodeling the cafe, upgrading equipment, building a new team of employees and expanding and perfecting the menu and now are slightly profitable.

 

Presently, The Plum Café & Bakery nurtures the veg community with mixers and special events. We service the gluten free community with our menu items and our pastries. We bring in people who would have never considered a plant-based diet and offer nutritious and delicious food that satisfies even the meat eater. We employ 24 people and offer lifetime employment.

 

We offer in-house, fresh made foods. We source local fresh bread daily. We make all of our own pastries, sauces and cheese.

 

 

The Goal

We are changing our name to Garden to Grill to more accurately reflect our farm to table sensibilities. In addition, we plan to open additional locations to spread our healthy and environmentally sound plant-based comfort food. Our goal is to open a second location in the greater Sacramento area. We want to reach those anxious for our food and cannot get to our midtown location.

 

When we open our second location, we can touch more lives with nutritious loving foods.  We have already saved water, animals and alleviated damage to the environment. Imagine what we could do with multiple locations! 

 

Ultimately we would like to open up to 15-20 locations in California. Learning from successful plant-based restaurant models such as Veggie Grill and Native Foods, we believe our concept will take plant-based foods to a new level.  This new location is a jumpstart will start our momentum to opening a new store every six months.  With every $75,000-100,000 we can open up one location.

 

 

 The Predicament

 The Plum Café has a wide customer base and a high level of foot traffic. We have found stability yet we are held back by our facilities and limited space. Our building is approximately a hundred years old and this creates challenges.  The rent is high, the repairs and maintenance are high and we spend much of our time, energy and resources trying to keep up with the building. With most of our money going back into The Plum Café, we do not have the start up capitol at this time. 

 

 

Where will the money be invested?

Our primary need is for remodeling, employees, and equipment: ovens, furniture, register systems, signs, and materials to name just a few. We buy recycled equipment whenever possible to save money and the environment.

 

 

Risks and Challenges

 We appreciate the risk associated by opening up a new location.  However, both Ron and Rey have had great success starting up businesses from the ground up. They have 4 start ups between them. Rey has over 20 years of experience in food business. Ron has 5 years running a top restaurant in Los Angeles.

 

In order to ensure high foot traffic, we will embark on a rigorous marketing campaign, including commercials, advertisements, flyers, specials and coupons. Our new location will employ a smaller staff by using a specialized menu of exceptional items built around a smaller staff and reducing risk. This will ensure on going success.

 

We aspire to build a network of Garden to Grills that are as accessible as Chipotle. We will provide lovingly prepared, plant-based foods that exceed customer expectations and prepared with exceptional care and speed. Opening a new location is the next step in our journey. Please join us in making the world a healthier, less polluted place by being a partner in Garden to Grill!

 

 Secret Plan

So what's the "secret plan" Rey mentioned?  We can’t tell you in detail because of potential competition issues.  But we can tell you that we plan on finding existing locations that are already built for a restaurant, to avoid the huge build out costs usually associated with start up restaurants.  We want to be as environmentally conscious as possible by buying recycled whenever we can--from the location, to the equipment we buy. 

 

 Garden Grill’s Secret Weapon

 Using the automation available at Rey’s 4,000 sq ft bakery as a central commissary to prep items will give us a large advantage over single unit or small chain cafes. In addition, Rey’s famous and award-winning GF baked goods will provide a powerful differentiation and added revenue source from traditional fast food providers. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't donate to our campaign you can still support us in our effort:

Talk about us! Tell your friends, post on Facebook, twitter, face to face. Let everyone know what were doing and how they can help.

Indiegogo tools are available as well as wall posts on Facebook. Get creative find new ways to share our efforts.
story_txt:
Our Mission
Thank you for reading this in advance!!  Garden to
Grill is a celebration of prepared plant-based foods. We create
eclectic, full-flavored Cuisine using local ingredients as much as possible.   Most of our menu items are made from scratch in our kitchen using our
own vegan recipes including our non-dairy cheese, mayonnaise, sauces, veggie
burgers and more, with a multitude of gluten-free options. 
 
Our dedication
to Service is carried even further because the Garden to Grill plant-based menu
also serves the planet.  We are committed to ecologically sound,
sustainable, and the best practices in the restaurant industry
guidelines.  We model how to treat Our Guests and Our Earth through
serving food that is not only delicious and healthy, but reduces environmental
impact and creates a positive net-effect on the planet: We use compostable and
recyclable food containers to reduce our energy use and cut our food waste to
the minimum.
 
Our dedication
and commitment to a plant-based, restaurant alleviates needless negative impact
to animals and the environment. The Garden to Grill commitment is practical and
makes a real difference compared to that of a similar, traditional-style
restaurant.  In the last 12 months alone we saved:
 
 •
50+ million gallons of water
 •
8,000 animals
 •
110,000+ pounds of CO2 gasses
 
At Garden to
Grill we take pride in our ability to offer a food experience that benefits our
customer’s health and well-being and the well-being of the planet and the
animals that share this earth.
 
Our philosophy
is summed up as:  Garden to Grill serves a healthy-heart, plant-based diet
optimal for overall wellbeing with a variety of quick savory meal options for
your fast paced life.
 
 
 About Rey:
 Rey grew up
eating a traditional, Mexican-American Cuisine consisting of beef, pork, and
dairy. After years of being ill from food-related ingredients, Rey had the
realization that maybe the food he was eating was causing his ill health. Rey
suffered from food related illness for years. He was handicapped by the
sickness; fevers, chills, excruciating stomach pain since he was a child. Rey
was willing to try anything to change his circumstances. In 1994, Rey made the
decision to change to a plant based diet. Rey immediately experienced improved
health and quality of life that he continues to enjoy to this day.
 
Rey Ortega
began his life’s work with Alternative Baking Company that same year. Rey founded and developed ABC from the ground floor and nourished it into a large, wholesale
production. He sought to provide a healthy, vegan alternative to the world.
 
Looking for
bigger and better opportunities, Rey left ABC and immediately opened Sun Flour
Baking. It was 1997 and the orders began pouring in. Once again, from scratch
he built the bakery from the ground up. The Sun Flour Baking vegan cookies quickly
made it onto the shelves in stores, airlines and high-end hotels. He sold
millions of cookies over the years. Rey takes pride in providing healthy food
alternatives to everyone, not just the vegan community. The bakery only grew
bigger and faster.
 
 
Ronald
Russell:
4th Generation
Californian Ron Russell is a chef, restaurateur, author of fiction and
non-fiction, and an artist.
 
In addition to
Garden Grill, Ron is co-partner in Sun Café Organic, which has won more than a
dozen culinary awards including being named 1 of the 10 Best Restaurants in Los
Angeles by Open Table in 2013. Sun Café counts Mila Kunis, Colin Farrell, Anne
Hathaway, John Salley, Serena Williams and many other celebrities as regular
customers.
 
Since his late
teens, Ron has followed a plant-based diet for the animals, for the planet and
for health. From age 11, Ron has worked to be an environmentalist: recycling,
reducing wasteful consumption and the environmental decision to be a vegan.
 
Over the past
3 years, in more than 150 plant-based cooking classes, Ron has developed and
shared 15-minute gourmet healthy recipes with his students.
He has been
featured in the NY Times, NBC News, Los Angeles Times, and InStyle, among other
media.

gives Ron a call asking him to help him save a vegan/plant based café
in Sacramento, CA. The Sugar Plum Vegan café was going out
of business and they saw an opportunity to save it. The previous owner was in

story:
ETA 01/07/15: THANK YOU!!

Thanks to the overwhelming support of fandom, Wincon 2015 in Pittsburgh, PA will be taking place this fall, October 15-18th. We look forward to seeing you there! We're beyond grateful and excited, and we've already started working hard on Wincon so we're ready to welcome each and every one of your shining faces! 

For those of you who donated, purchased registrations, or bought other perks, we're working right now to get the appropriate information sent out to you. Please email us if you have not received an email by January 15th!

If you missed the Indiegogo but you're interested in attending Wincon, never fear! We still have registrations available through our website at the $55 price, which includes access to all panels, workshops, roundtables, and special events, including our Saturday night dance party, Prom! Please visit our website for more details.

If you want to stay caught up with us, you can follow us on Twitter, Tumblr, or join our mailing list for monthly updates. Programming will be opening submissions in just a couple of months, and we're SO excited to read all your ideas!

---

What is Wincon?  

Since 2006, Wincon has defined itself as a 'by-the-fans, for-the-fans operation.' The entire event is free of any official personnel or celebrities of any kind. Wincon strives to be a safer space for fans of all races, gender identities, orientations, and abilities. 

Wincon’s ongoing mission is to bring together a diverse group of internet-based media fans in an inclusive environment to engage in fannish activities and foster meaningful connections. We provide programming created and led by attendees, on topics drawn from a variety of sources and involving everything from detailed meta to wildly creative fanworks, encompassing all aspects of fandom culture. 

As that fandom culture grows and evolves, so must Wincon. This campaign will allow us to expand our programming and activities and to increase our attendee cap to 300 people in 2015 (and beyond)! 

Your support means that an event that has been a fandom cornerstone for hundreds of fans since 2006 gets to live on. It means new fans will get the chance to attend Wincon and experience the irreplaceable feeling of being in a room where everyone understands and embraces fan culture; where we can talk about every aspect of fannishness without fear of judgement; and where we get to celebrate our community, its rich history, and its ever evolving future surrounded by people who genuinely love fandom!

Programming at Wincon

All of Wincon's multi-fandom programming is designed and staffed by volunteers, both attendees and members of our con committee. All our programming is suggested, voted on, and led by con attendees. This ensures that the content at Wincon is what the fans want to talk about, see, and do. We have large panels, small round table discussions, workshops, and several special events.

Our programming includes both fandom-specific fare (horror TV! comics! Elementary!) and multi-fandom topics (podfic! kink! diversity in fandom! femslash!) We cover a vast array of fandoms each year, and even if your fandom isn't represented with a panel of its own, you'll probably find someone else who loves it just as much as you do. You can also sign up for our Pimp Your Fandom panel and convince everyone to join you! Workshops give our attendees a chance to learn something new or improve your skills. Past workshops have included live beta reading, art tips and tricks, knitting 101, and making fannish plushies.

In addition to panels and workshops, we have amazing group events. Our Meet & Greet on Thursday allows everyone to mingle, hang out, play games, and get to know some new people before the weekend begins. Friday night brings our yearly Vid Show, highlighting premiering vids and old favorites to the fans in attendance. Our Bad Fic Idol competition is an exercise in just how ridiculous you can be in 400 words or less. Don’t forget to close out your Saturday at Winprom, where you’re free to come in your finest duds, your t-shirt and jeans, or your spiffiest costume.

Although not an official part of con proceedings, our committee also organizes activities in our host cities, including ghost tours and trips to popular local attractions for those who want to include some sightseeing in their con weekend.  

What We Need

At 300 attendees, the event itself will cost, at minimum, $18,000. We are setting our campaign goal at $15,000 to guarantee that we can meet this minimum and hold a successful event in October 2015. We are offering several registration and non-registration perks that will enable us to raise the needed amount in order to move forward with the event while still allowing us to keep registration open after the close of the Indiegogo Campaign. Registrations we sell after the close of the campaign will meet the remaining need (about 50-75 more registrations).

What does that $18,000 cover? Based off of the projection of 300 attendees:

  • Hotel Space - $9600
  • Attendee Swag (Bag, Tumbler, Pen, Notebook, Keychain, & more)- $3000
  • Programming Supplies (Workshops, Crafting, Games, etc.)- $1200
  • Registration Supplies (program books, lanyards, badges, badge holders, wristbands, buttons, etc.) - $500
  • Audio/Visual Rental - $500
  • Transportation of Inventory & Supplies - $700
  • IGG Perks (Shipping + Production) - $1500
  • Misc. Fees (Insurance, Banking, Paypal, Indiegogo, Website, etc.) - $1000

What will we do with any extra money we take in? Well keep in mind, the above costs are the MINIMUM. As we take in more money, we'll be able to offer more to our attendees in terms of activities, food and beverage, etc. without raising the cost of attendance. We'll also be able to make some longterm investments in Wincon's future by purchasing Audio/Visual equipment (therefore avoiding rental fees in the future), as well as a laser printer for registration, cutting down on printing costs. 

 

The Perks

We have some awesome perks to thank you for helping to keep Wincon alive. Of course, we are offering weekend registrations. You can purchase your weekend ticket for $55 or choose from several add-on options. 

Five amazing artists have contributed their talent and created custom Wincon Heroes art, inspired by the awesomeness of Wincon itself. You can get the Heroes on buttons, post cards, a poster, or all three! 

 

 

We also have some one of a kind perks from fan artists and creators. These include artist commissions, never before seen photos, jewelry, and more. Indiegogo limits the number of perks we can list at one time, so we will be rolling out some of these later in the campaign. Keep checking back!  

Additionally, Indiegogo only gives us 500 characters for perk descriptions. Please leave a comment or send us a message if you have questions or need more details about any of our perks.  

   

    


Please note: If you purchase a perk that includes registration, we will send you an email after the close of the campaign with details on how to complete the registration process. 

If you would like to register, but can't pay the full amount, you can pay what you are able. Just select no perk and we will email you after the close of the campaign to verify that you want that amount put towards a registration. 

If you love Wincon as much as we do and want to see it continue, please purchase your registration now or choose one of our other awesome perks! 

 

The Impact

Wincon is run by a 100% volunteer con committee. Not even our registrations are free. We believe that every penny of the money we take in from supporters and attendees should always be returned to the attendees via their Wincon experience. 

Wincon has always strived to be a safer space for fans of diverse backgrounds, and year after year, the con committee hears stories from attendees about how much this con means to them. It is a yearly event that so many look forward to, something that keeps them going throughout the year, and we want to see it become that for hundreds more.

As fan cons move more and more toward celebrity-driven, academic, and/or niche events, Wincon is something special in the fandom landscape. It is a con driven solely by fandom itself, welcoming and incorporating every aspect of fannish pursuit.  We believe with our whole hearts that is something worth supporting and preserving for many years to come.

 

Risks & Challenges

We are minimizing the risk to supporters and ourselves by running a fixed campaign. If we do not reach our $15,000 goal, everyone will be refunded by Indiegogo and we will cancel the event. We cannot in good conscience accept less than we know we will need to put on this conference.

In the event that we reach our $15,000 Indiegogo goal but do not hit our 300 attendee goal, we will be able to reduce costs in several areas to match the actual number of attendees, thereby still allowing the con to continue without any additional assistance. 

Our con committee has over 50 years of combined experience, and we have taken every step to ensure that we will never put unnecessary burden on ourselves or the fan community at large. We believe in transparency and responsibility, and honoring the trust put in us by our supporters and attendees.

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Can't afford to contribute monetarily? That is a-okay! We would really appreciate any help you could give us getting the word out there. If you believe in fandom as a community, that we deserve our own space to flourish and share, then reblog, retweet, post... do whatever you can to get the word out!

    If you want to stay updated on the campaign and Wincon happenings, join our mailing list!

If you believe in fandom as a community, that we deserve our own space to flourish and share, then reblog, retweet, post... do whatever you can to get the word out!
If you want to stay updated on the campaign and Wincon happenings, join our mailing list!
